loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grocery items to offer for sale in her store.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be motivated. She operates a retail business where she sells fish and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are local residents. 

Janet describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to buy more stock. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fish for resale. Her business goal is to own a big hotel within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will live a happy life. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of KES 50,000 was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to start another business.

loans.use: buy more stock of fish for resale.

loans.name: Tolgonay

texts.ru: Толгонай 46 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. Старшая дочь-замужем, сыновья учатся в школе. У Толгонай - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Толгонай занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав 23 года назад, с 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Толгонай, на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, также имеется 1,0 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает перец, капусту, морковь для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Дополнительно в свободное время Толгонай занимается пошивом национальной одежды для продажи, имеет небольшой доход. Ежемесячный совокупныЙ доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Толгонай обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом для закупа высококачественных семян перца, капусты и моркови для посевных работ и удобрений для обработки земли. Толгонай намерена получить хороший урожай, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи. Доходы от кредита Толгонай планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее образование сыновей.
texts.en:
Tolgonay is 46 years old, married, and together with her husband is raising three children. Their eldest, a daughter, is married and their sons are still in school. Tolgonay has a secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, Tolgonay raises crops and livestock, having begun 23 years ago with 5,000 som KGS.

Thanks to her hard work, Tolgonay currently has: one dairy cow and also 1.0 hectare of land, on which annually she grows peppers, cabbages, and carrots for personal consumption and resale. Additionally in her spare time, Tolgonay sews national dresses for sale and has a small income. Monthly gross income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Tolgonay applied to the bank Bai-Tushum for a loan to buy high-quality seeds of peppers, cabbages and carrots for the sowing work and fertilizers to prepare the land. Tolgonay intends to get a good harvest, that will certainly lead to an increase in the family's capital.

Tolgonay plans to invest income from the loan in propagating the quantity of domestic animals, and plans to save money for the further education of her sons.

loans.use: to buy seeds of cabbage, carrots,  peppers and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil and rice for her business.

loans.name: Nasira Parveen

texts.en:
Nasira is 30 years old and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has two sons and two daughters, all in school. Her husband has been running his own business of clothes selling for three years. He is responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. He needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient funds, he is unable to. Therefore, Nasira is applying fora  Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. Then she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. He can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profits with the help of this loan amount. 
Nasira is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of clothes for reselling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, palm, oil, vita, pepper, vita etc for her business.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Meet 29-year-old Aminata from Waterloo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with two children between the ages of eight and eleven years.  During the past eight years, Aminata established her fish business. She began her business because she wanted to develop herself and children. She works at the business from 8:00am until 5:30 pm, six days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is to improve her livelihood.

Aminata requires a loan in order to purchase more fish for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Aminata plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for clean cooking gas package with Liquefied Petroleum Gas for home improvement

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for cooking gas package as an on going home improvement plan

loans.name: San Bartolome Group

texts.es: Gloria tiene 41 años es casada con 03 hijos educando. Ella se dedica al preparado de postres para expenderlos a sus vecinos y al público. Ella tiene como finalidad implementar una bodega para mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Gloria en el grupo “SAN BARTOLOME” cumple la función de tesorera. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de leche huevos harina. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Gloria es la tercera del lado izquierdo viste chompa negra y polo blanco.
texts.en:
Gloria is 41 years old and married. She is raising three children. She works making desserts, which she sells among her neighbors and to the public. Her goal is to set up a store in order to improve her financial income. She will invest her loan in purchasing milk, eggs, and flour. 

Gloria acts as treasurer of the San Bartolome group. The group is grateful to Kiva lenders for the loan they are receiving. Gloria is the third person from the left. She is wearing a black sweater and a white polo shirt.

loans.use: to buy flour, milk, and eggs.

loans.name: Guljan

texts.ru: Гулжан 60 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитали 5 детей. Все дети женаты и проживают самостоятельно. У Гулжан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Гулжан занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав 18 лет назад, с 15,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гулжан, на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 3 теленка, 20 овец, а также имеется 4,20 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает картофель и пшеницу для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Дополнительно в летнее время Гулжан занимается производством настоек из лекарственных трав, ягод и семян для продажи, имеет небольшой доход. Ежемесячный совокупныЙ доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулжан обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом для закупа семян картофеля, пшеницы и эспарцета для посевных работ. Гулжан намерена получить хороший урожай, что непременно приведет к улучшению жилищных условий семьи. Доходы от кредита Гулжан планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт своего дома.
texts.en:
Guljan is 60 years old, married, and together with her spouse brought up five children. All the children are married and live independently. Guljan has a secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, Guljan raises crops and livestock, having begun 18 years ago with 15,000 som KGS.

Thanks to her hard work, Guljan currently has: three dairy cows, three calves, 20 sheep, and also 4.20 hectares of land, on which annually she grows potatoes and wheat for consumption and sale. Additionally in the summertime, Guljan produces tinctures from medicinal herbs, berries, and seeds for sale, and brings a small income. Monthly gross income amounts to 12,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Guljan applied to the bank Bai-Tushum for a loan to buy seeds for potatoes, wheat and sainfoin for the sowing work. Guljan intends to get a good crop, that certainly will bring improved living conditions for her family. Guljan plans to invest income from the loan in propagating the quantity of domestic animals, and plans to save money for home repairs.

loans.use: to buy seed of potatoes, wheat and sainfoin

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for one year's tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is a Business Management Student at the Maharishi Institute. Solomon is 22 years old and was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute:

What do you study at the Maharishi Institute and what classes do you enjoy most?

“I am studying Bachelor of Arts in Business. The classes I enjoy the most  are Principles of Business Studies, Business Law and Ethics, Economics and Science of Creative Intelligence.”

What are your goals after graduation?

“I would initially like to become an accountant in the finance department of a reputable company. I would then like to start my own transportation business, based in Durban at the sea, to enable imports and exports. I would like to visit the U.K., too.”

Tell us about your background.

“I was born in Soweto and still live there with my mother. She is a single parent and currently unemployed. I have two younger siblings.”

What do you do in your spare time?

“I like to read books, especially political ones. I enjoy spending time with my family and friends and I love playing soccer.”

How will the Kiva loan change your life?

“A Kiva loan will help me to help my mother and it will help me to achieve my dreams and be a better person in life.”

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a clean cooking gas package in order to acquire modern energy

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the package of clean cooking fuel for home improvement

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for the package of cooking gas for home improvement

loans.name: Derling Antonio

texts.es: El señor Derling, trabajador con grandes deseos de superacion, a sus 24 años esta casado, labora como guarda de seguridad para una empresa privada, su compañera lo apoya economicamente ya que aparte de las tareas del hogar ella lava y plancha ajeno para ganar un poco mas  de dinero, el credito lo solicita para la compra de materiales de Construccion como cemento, arena, piedrin, para construir un cuarto anexo. Agradece el apoyo que se le esta brindado.
texts.en: Derling is a hard worker with a great desire to get ahead. At 24-years-old he is married and works as a security guard for a private company. His partner helps him economically because in addition to their household chores, she also washes and irons for other households to make a little extra money. The loan will be used to buy construction materials including cement, gravel, and building stones to build an additional room. He is thankful for the support that is being offered to him.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in his idea to provide youth skin care products, which is a completely new and appropriate product for the targeted market.

loans.name: Ángela De Jesús

texts.es:
Ángela de 62 años de edad,no estudia solamente recibio 2 meses de estudio en alfabetizacion, ella es viuda,su esposo acaba de fallecer tuvo 7 hijos pero 1 se le murio todos tienen hogares aparte, con la cliente viven dos nietos que son los que dependen de ella.

Ella administra una pequeña tienda, desde hace un año, lo aprendio de una vecina y ella decidio dedicarse a ello, porque debido a que ella no tiene ingresos de todos sus hijos y como ella cuida sus dos nietos ya que la madre de ellos fallecio y ella quedo a responsabilidad de ellos. 

Este ha sido su primer negocio, la tienda la tiene en la entrada de de una ciudad, una hija le ayuda con el negocio su horario de 6:30 -7:00 pm.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar productos para surtir la tienda, para que le generen mas ingresos que le ayude a mantener sus dos nietos que son huerfanitos. Con el préstamo tendra mas variedad de productos y con ello le generara mas ingresos, para asi poder sastifacer las necesidades de sus nietos, que estan uno de 12 años y de 8 años de edad.

sus sueños son ofrecer a sus clientes mejores productos, su tienda ampliarla mas porque ella quiere que sus nietos estudien y no se queden como ella.  El sueño de su hija que ya fallecio, es decir la madre de los niños  no pudo darle a sus hijos lo que siempre quizo , con este prestamo podra sacar adelante su tienda, y podra darles estudio a sus nietos y ellos tendran un mejor futuro
texts.en:
Ángela is 62. She has never had access to an education, but received just 2 months of literacy teaching. She is a widow, as her husband passed away recently. They had 7 children, but one died. The rest all live in separate households. Two grandchildren live with Ángela and are dependent on her.

Ángela has been running a small shop for a year. She learnt the trade from a neighbour and then decided to do it for herself. This was because she doesn't get an income from her children yet she has had to look after her two grandchildren since their mother died, leaving Ángela with the responsibility of caring for them. This is her first business and her shop is at the entrance to the city. One of her daughters helps her with the business, and their working day lasts from 6.30am to 7pm.

Ángela is asking for this loan to buy produce to stock her shop so she can earn more money, which will help to support her two young orphaned grandchildren. Through the loan she will have a bigger variety of produce, and this will generate more income so she will be able to cover the needs of her grandchildren, aged 12 and 8.

Ángela's dream is to offer the best products to her customers and to grow her store, as she wants her grandchildren to be able to go to school and not end up like her. This was the dream of her deceased daughter too (the children's mother), who was not able to give to her children what she had always wanted. With this loan, Ángela will be able to make her shop a success and she will be able to provide her grandchildren with an education and a better future.

loans.use: to buy produce to stock her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for the cooking gas package in order to save on time and money

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, rebar, cinder blocks, and stone

loans.name: Santos Esther

texts.es:
La señora Santos es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive junto a sus hijos y su esposo en una comunidad en la zona  de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta y elaboración de tortillas.
Doña Santos su negocio es muy conocido en su comunidad lo que hace que la demanda de su producto sea mucha. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de materia prima como maíz, leña y cal para seguir elaborando sus tortillas y contar con este ingreso el cual es muy importante para su hogar. 
Doña Santos espera gracias al préstamo poder contar con los insumos necesarios para seguir realizando su negocio y así cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y de igual manera que las ventas tengan un gran aumento considerable el cual se vea reflejado en la calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos. 
Doña Santos espera que su negocio  siga creciendo y convirtiéndose en el más conocido de la comunidad para de esta manera poder seguir apoyando a su familia a tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Enero  2014
texts.en:
Señora Santos is a very hardworking, responsible person. She lives with her children and her husband in a community within the zone of Honduras.  Her business is the sale and preparation of tortillas. Doña Santos’ business is very well known in her community, creating a big demand for her products.

She needs the loan in order to purchase basic materials such as corn, firewood, and lime, so that she can continue making her tortillas and have the income which is very important to her household. Thanks to the loan, Doña Santos hopes to be able to have the supplies that are necessary in order to continue running her business, and thus meet the demands of her customers; and she also hopes to increase her sales considerably, which will be reflected in the quality of life that her family will have because of the increased income. 

Doña Santos hopes that her business will continue growing and become the most well known in the community. In this way, she will be able to continue supporting her family, so that they will have more opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras—January, 2014.

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood, and lime for her business.

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es:
Doña Maria es una persona luchadora y honesta vive en  una comunidad al sur de Honduras, junto con ella viven sus 3 hijos. Su negocio es la venta de ropa usada desde hace 8 años.
Doña María  vende de manera ambulante en los barrios y colonias cercanas a su comunidad. Necesita el  préstamo para la compra de más producto como ser: camisetas, camisas, buzos, faldas, blusas, pantalones, vestidos, shorts,  etc. que necesita para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes. 
Doña María  espera que el préstamo la ayude mucho ya que contara con las prendas suficientes para cubrir los pedidos y demandas de sus clientes y de igual manera que sus ventas tengan un aumento y gracias a esto ganar más ingresos que mejoren el estilo de vida de la familia en el hogar. 
Doña María  espera que sus negocio siga creciendo y de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos puedan terminara sus estudios y así tener mayores oportunidades en el futuro.



Choluteca, Honduras –Enero 2014
texts.en:
María is an honest woman and a fighter.  She lives in a community in southern Honduras with her three children.  For the past eight years, she has had a business selling used clothing.  María is a traveling salesperson, going to the neighborhoods and towns near her community.  

She is in need of a loan to purchase more merchandise like: t-shirts, shirts, jogging suits, skirts, blouses, pants, dresses, shorts, etc..., that she needs to meet the demand of her customers.  María hopes that the loan will help her because she will have the necessary merchandise to meet the orders and demand of her customers.  She also believes that it will help her to increase her sales and increase her earnings so she can improve her family's living conditions.  

María hopes that her business will continue to grow so that she can continue to support her family, and her children can finish their education so they can have better opportunities in the future.  



Choluteca, Honduras -- January 2014

loans.use: purchase t-shirts, shirts, jogging suits, skirts, blouses, pants, dresses, shorts, and more for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two pigs and build a shed for them.

loans.name: Narcisa Monserrate

texts.es:
En el cantón Pichincha cada quince días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito San Juan, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación surcada por un gran rio lo cual lo hace propicia para los cultivos.
En este lugar vive la señora Narcisa, tiene 47 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 14 y 6 años que estudian en colegio  y escuela.
Doña Narcisa es una mujer que le gusta a base de trabajo salir adelante y sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella trabaja para el Estado pero para cubrir los gastos que generan el estudio y mantención de sus hijos también se dedica a la venta de productos Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja todos los días ya que trabaja los fines de semana, les vende a sus compañeras de trabajo las cuales son sus mejores clientes y esto porque les da facilidades para los pago, ella lleva 3 años con esta actividad con la cual se gana algo extra por el bien de sus hijos. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas. Lleva 3 años en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda. Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The San Juan credit group meets every two weeks in the Pichincha canton. This area is known for its diversity and the majority of the inhabitants here make a living in farming and raising animals. The area has a great amount of vegetation cut through it by a large river that is very conducive to growing crops. 

Narcisa is a 47-year-old woman who lives here. She is a single mother of two children. Her 14-year-old is in high school and her six-year-old is in elementary school. Narcisa is a woman who enjoys getting herself and her children ahead through her work. She works for the government but also sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and accessories) to cover the enrollment and school fees for her children. She works every day including the weekends and sells to her co-workers who are her best customers because she makes it easy on them to make their payments. She has been doing this work for three years, earning enough for her children's well-being. 

This loan will be used to buy perfume, accessories, cosmetics and creams. She has been a part of this credit group for three years and likes it because the loans are very helpful. Her dream is to offer the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy perfume, accessories, cosmetics and creams.

loans.name: Elisa Marilu

texts.es:
En el cantón Pichincha cada quince días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito Grupo En Acción, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación surcada por un gran rio lo cual lo hace propicia para los cultivos.
En este lugar vive la señora Elisa, tiene 48 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa. El marido es comerciante. 
Doña Elisa con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante en el hogar se dedica a la venta de sabanas, edredones, cortinas, entre otras cosas,  la mayor parte de su mercadería la vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes. Ella también le da parte del crédito para que su marido lo utilice en sus actividades, el se dedica a la compra y venta de cacao, actividad con la cual ha sacado adelante a su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar sabanas, edredones y cacao. Lleva tres ciclos en el Crédito Grupo y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos. Su sueño es  comprar un carro.
texts.en:
The Grupo en Acción lending group meets every 15 days in the Pichincha canton.  This area is known for being very dynamic, where its residents work in agriculture and animal husbandry.  It is a region with a lot of vegetation, traversed by a river, which makes it good for agriculture.  

Elisa lives in this area.  She is 48 years old and is in a common-law marriage.  She has three adult children, and two of them live in her home.  Her husband is a businessman.  With the intent of earning an income to help out and wanting to get ahead, she sells blankets, sheets, curtains, and other items.  She sells most of her merchandise in her house, where her customers come.  

She will also give part of her loan to her husband, so he can use it for his work.  He purchases and sells cocoa, a career that has helped him get their family ahead.  This loan will be used to purchase blankets, sheets and cocoas.  

She has been in the lending group for three cycles, and she enjoys it because of the ease of receiving loans.  Her dream is to purchase a car.

loans.use: purchase blankets, sheets and cocoa.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for clean modern cooking energy as part of her home improvement plan.

loans.name: Kurbonoy

texts.en:
Kurbonoy is 49 years old. She is married and has 3 children. She has a pedagogical education. She works in a theatre of her region. Her husband also works in a theatre. 

Kurbonoy has worked in the theatre for more than 23 years. She is a dresser. She likes her job. She tries to offer wonderful dresses for actors in all performances. Her son is a student. She must to pay for her son’s tuition. She is asking for a loan of 1100 USD with this aim. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Vinera

texts.ru: Винере 46 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Винеры - средне-специальное образование, окончила техникум по специальности -финансист. В 1988 году вышла замуж за Акпара. Семья очень дружная и во всем поддерживают друг друга. После развала Советской власти разделив свои земельные разделы стали заниматься животноводством и полеводством, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Винеры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 лошадь, 1 бычок, 20 овец, также обрабатывает 2,22 ГА земли, где в основном выращивает -фасоль и многолетние травы. Полученный урожай реализуют оптовым поставщикам. Дополнительно Винера занимается перепродажей картофеля и яблок.  Ежемесячный доход составляет 17,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Винера обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум"  за кредитом - на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. После закупки овец, они будут находиться в собственном хозяйстве. Летом скот будет под присмотром пастуха. Доходы от кредита Винера планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку бытовой техники.
texts.en: Vinera is 46 years old, married and raising 4 children together with her husband. Vinera has a secondary-specialized education. She graduated from college with the financial analyst profession.  She married Akpar in 1988.  The family is very friendly and support each other with everything.  After the breakup of the Soviet Union, having divided their land, they became involved in animal husbandry and farming with a purchase of livestock with 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Vinera's hard work, today her business contains 1 dairy cow, 1 horse, 1 bull, 20 sheep, and also a 2.22 hectare land plot, where she grows beans and perennial herbs. They sell the resulting harvest to wholesale distributors.  Additionally, Vinera is involved in reselling potatoes and apples.   In order to further develop her business, Vinera requested a loan from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy sheep in order to increase livestock headcount. The sheep will stay in their household after the purchase.  The livestock will be under a shepherd's watch in the summer.  Vinera plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money to buy consumer electronics.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is 22 years old, married and lives in Gaza with her husband and three children. She contributes to the family income since her husband’s income alone is not sufficient to meet the needs of her family members. Iman will open a beauty salon business since she has good experience in this field. 

Iman will buy a hair dryer, makeup tools, and electric generator for her salon. This will enable her to start her business and improve her financial situation. She dreams of expanding her business in future and wants to use part of the profits on her children’s education. She is very grateful to everyone who helps her to achieve success with this loan.

Ryada's Startup Loan is exclusively for borrowers who are beginning new enterprises, not for existing projects. To qualify, a borrower must show a clear business plan and realistic potential for success. The borrower must also invest their own money and resources into at least 50 percent of the start up enterprise. Ryada believes strongly in the potential of these borrowers and grants them a three month grace period to help them get their business off the ground.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer, makeup tools, and electronic generated for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto de 63 años de edad, es una persona acompañada convive con su esposa y sus hijos, estudio hasta sexto grado. se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. Junto a su esposa que le apoyan en la actividades agrícolas y en el ordeño de los animales que poseen. 

 Roberto junto a su esposa se dedican a la agricultura, oficio que aprendió de sus madre;  durante la mañana mientras su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y en la tarde trabaja elaborando tejas de barro.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una novilla que le vende un familiar y que en un futuro le producirá leche para incrementar la producción.
texts.en:
Roberto is 63 years old, has a 6th grade education, and lives with his wife and children. He gets up at 5:00 a.m. with his wife who helps with the agricultural chores and with milking the animals they have. Roberto and his wife work in agriculture, an occupation he learned from his mother. Roberto does this in the morning while his wife takes care of the house, and in the afternoon he makes clay tiles.

The loan he is requesting is for the purchase of a heifer from a relative. In the future it will add to their milk production.

loans.use: to buy a heifer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for modern clean cooking gas for home improvement

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for cooking gas package as part of his home improvement plan

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.en: Zulfiya, 36, is a hardworking woman who is married and has two children. Zulfiya has sewn national women’s dresses for more than six years. She offers good services and has her own regular customers. She has a kind heart and always tries to help her family and friends. Her brother does not have a job in Tajikistan and wants to go to Russia. Zulfiya is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy an air ticket for her brother. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy air ticket for her brother

loans.name: Ganjina

texts.en:
Ganjina is 23 years old. She is not married. Ganjina is a student in the fourth course of the Pedagogical Institute. She studies at the faculty of Russian Philology. She is a smart and hardworking girl. She studies well. Ganjina likes Russian literature, philosophy, history, and law. She always goes to library and reads many books.

She must pay for tuition at the institute, but she has not money now. She is asking for a loan of 600 USD to pay for tuition. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay her tuition for study at the Pedagogical Institute

loans.name: Gabriela Suyapa

texts.es:
La señora Gabriela es una persona honesta y responsable vive en  una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Su negocio es una  pulpería desde hace 5 años.
Doña Gabriela es muy visitada y conocida por los vecinos de su comunidad. Necesita el  préstamo para la compra de más producto como ser: arroz, manteca, pan, refrescos, churros, queso, mantequilla, embutidos, huevos, café, frijoles, azúcar, etc. 
Doña Gabriela espera que el préstamo la ayude mucho ya que contara con los productos necesarios y suficientes para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y cubrir la demanda que estos le hacen a diario y de igual manera que sus ventas tengan un aumento y gracias a esto ganar más ingresos que beneficien el estilo de vida de la familia en el hogar. 
Doña Gabriela espera que su negocio siga creciendo y así de esta manera poder apoyar a su hijos y que estos puedan terminara lo estudios y tener mayores oportunidades en el futuro.


Choluteca, Honduras –Enero 2014
texts.en:
Gabriela is an honest and responsible person who lives in a community in southern Honduras with her husband and their four children.  Her business is a small grocery store, which she has had for five years.  Gabriela's store is well known and visited by her neighbors.  

She is seeking a loan to purchase more products such as: rice, lard, bread, drinks, churros, cheese, butter, deli meats, eggs, coffee, beans, sugar, etc...  Gabriela hopes that the loan will be very helpful as she will be able to have the necessary products to satisfy her customers' needs and meet their daily demand.  She also hopes that this will improve her sales and in so doing, increase her earnings so that she can improve her family's living conditions.  

Gabriela hopes that her business will continue growing and she will be able to support her children so that they can finish their education and have better opportunities in the future.  


Choluteca, Honduras –January 2014

loans.use: purchase rice, lard, bread, drinks, churros, cheese, butter, deli meats, eggs, coffee, beans, sugar, and more for her business.

loans.name: Swale

texts.en: Swale is a 37-year-old married man with eight children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a farmer who grows cocoa as the main crop in his home. He sells it to people around him and gets income to run his home affairs. He wishes to expand his cocoa garden and get high yields which will cater for his welfare. However, he is challenged by inadequate capital and seasonal changes. Swale is requesting a loan to buy more cocoa and expand his garden.

loans.use: To grow more cocoa and expand his garden.

loans.name: Maraf Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Maraf Bibi, age 34, is the mother of one son and two daughters. Her husband owns a tailoring shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family.

Her husband needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of tailoring materials for the shop, including thread, needles, and cloth. This is very important for him, to continue his work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife, Maraf Bibi, is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan, with the goal of helping her husband. He will purchase the things he needs, with the help of the loan funds.

Maraf bibi is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and stitching-related items, like cloth and thread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, salt and other retail products.

loans.name: Sayohat

texts.en: Sayohat is a young and purposeful woman who is 18 years old. She is not married and lives with her parents in the southern part of Tajikistan. Sayohat began her sewing business two years ago. She developed her business and now has her neighbors as clients. Sayohat wants to increase her working capital and is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS  to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine to increase working capital.

loans.name: Oscar Réne

texts.es:
Oscar de 42 años de edad.

 Oscar se dedica  a la agricultura oficio que aprendió de sus padres,  para llegar a la parcela camina 5  Km y trabajan durante la mañana y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y en la tarde se dedica a cuidar las vacas.

El préstamo que  esta  solicitando, es para comprar una vaca que necesita para incrementar la producción de leche para la venta y obtener mejores ingresos.

Oscar planea que con los ingresos que obtenga  comprara más animales.
texts.en:
Oscar is 42 years old. He works farming, a trade he learned from his parents. He walks five kilometers to reach his plot of land and works during the morning while his wife takes care of the home. In the afternoons he works taking care of his cows.

He will use the loan he is requesting to buy a cow, which he needs in order to increase his milk production and sales and to obtain better income.

Oscar plans to use the income he makes to purchase more animals.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Gulruhsor

texts.en: Gulruhsor is 36 years old. She is not married. Gulruhsor is a teacher of small grades in a school. She always tries to improve her knowledge. She entered to the Pedagogical Institute four years ago. She studies in the Faculty of Russian Philology. Now, she must pay her tuition but she doesn't have enough money. She is asking for a loan of 600 USD to pay her tuition. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 43 years old. He is friendly, hardworking and lives with his wife and their four children in Mpulungu, a town in the Northern province of Zambia. Currently, all his children are attending school. 

Moses provides financial services to people in his community through mobile money transfers. He starts his day early in the morning and leaves his shop in the late hours, making sure he does not turn away any potential customers. 

This is the first time Moses is taking out a loan. He has requested a Kiva loan to boost his working capital. This will help him to serve more customers by providing a safe way to send, receive, and pay bills through his shop; it will also help him earn more profits. Moses plans to expand his business by opening additional outlets in the future.

Moses feels fortunate to be connected to Kiva lenders. He explains that it is very difficult to access micro-loans in Zambia and interests rates are very high. He anticipates his profits will increase by having more working capital to serve customers. This will improve his familiy's standard of living. Moses says his biggest goal in life is to support all his children through school so they can be well educated.

loans.use: to increase the money he uses to serve customers so that he can offer a better service.

loans.name: Bardhe

texts.en:
Bardhe needs your financial help again, but this time to cover her medical surgery expenses.

She practices agriculture, caring for livestock, and she sells baby calves, piglets and raw milk to the locals. Her husband has machinery that treads out the grain, particularly corn, and he offers services to other people in the neighboring villages.

Bardhe’s village is known for a high volume of grain production, and the villagers sell their produce to nearby food processing factories. The grazing in their village is a good food for animals, particularly cows, sheep and pigs. Hence, the main source of income for them is the animals and grains.

loans.use: to cover her medical surgery expenses

loans.name: Indira

texts.ru: Индире 32 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Индиры - среднее образование, социальный портрет положительный, целеустремленный, ответственный человек. Всегда и во всем старается видеть только положительное. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Индира занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав 13 лет назад, с 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Индиры, на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 2 овцы, также арендует 3,0 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает фасоль для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Индира обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом для закупа минеральных удобрений в количестве 20 мешков по 1250 сом (KGS) для обработки земли. Индира намерена получить хороший урожай, что непременно приведет к улучшению жилищных условий путем реализации фасоли по хорошей цене, в хорошем качестве и количестве. Дети смогут хорошо питаться и хорошо одеваться. Семья сможет улучшить свой социальный статус. Доходы от кредита Индира планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, улучшить урожайность и купить в собственность землю в своем селе.
texts.en:
Indira is 32 years old, married, and together with her souse is raising four children. Indira has a secondary education and a social portrait as a positive, purposeful, and responsible person. Always and in everything, she trie to see only the positive.

As a main source of income for her family, Indira raises crops and livestock, having begun 13 years ago with 20,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Indira currently has: two dairy cows, two sheep, and also rents 3.0 hectares of land, on which annually she grows beans for sale. Monthly income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS). With the aim of further developing her homestead, Indira applied to the bank Bai-Tushum for a loan to buy mineral fertilizers in the quantity of 20 bags for 1250 som (KGS) to prepare the land.

Indira intends to get a good harvest, which certainly will bring improvements in living conditions with the sale of beans at a good price, in good quality and quantity. The children will be able to eat well and dress well. The family will be able to improve their social status. Indira plans to invest income from the loan in propagating the number of domestic animals, improving the crop, and buy her own land in the village.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for a good harvest

loans.name: Teriya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe TERIYA ont en moyenne  28 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à KIMPARANA/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, voisinage et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers.  Les femmes du groupe TERIYA sont à leur 1er  prêt solidaire. SALI,   femme   debout au milieu   sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 250 paires de chaussures en plastique, 25 paires de chaussures cuir. Elle s’approvisionne sur place. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,   à l’habillement, au logement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the TERIYA Group have an average age of 28 and an average of two children each. They all live in traditional families in KIMPARANA/SEGOU, which is the fourth-largest administrative region in the Republic of Mali.

The women know each other because they are related and are neighbors. They work buying and selling a variety of products. The women of the TERIYA Group are on their first group loan.

SALI is the woman standing in the middle of the photo. She plans to use this loan to buy 250 pairs of plastic shoes and 25 pairs of leather shoes. She buys her supplies in the area where she lives. She sells to both men and women, in cash and also often on credit. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 15,000 XOF, which will be used for health, clothing, housing and school expenses. She will reinvest the rest in her business.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Damacia Diolaguita

texts.es:
En el cantón Pichincha cada quince días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito Grupo En Acción, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación surcada por un gran rio lo cual lo hace propicia para los cultivos.
En este lugar vive la señora Damacia, tiene 44 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos 17 y 6 años que estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido es docente. 
Doña Damacia es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta ganar algo  para así darles lo mejor a sus hijos, ella trabaja de maestra en una institución privada  en la localidad pero además de esto también se dedica al comercio, vende productos naturales de Nature Garden y tiene mucha clientela ya que son productos muy buenos. Ella lleva 2 años dedicada a sus ventas mientras que de maestra mucho más.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más productos naturales ya que tiene muchos pedidos para entregar. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan en la institución. Sus sueños son  seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Every 15 days, the credit group "group in action" meets in the Pichincha canton. This place is known for being very dynamic. Most of its inhabitants are engaged in agriculture and animal husbandry because it is an area crossed by a large river which makes it favorable for crops. 

Damacia lives in this area. She is 44 years old and is in a common-law marriage. She has two children aged 17 and 6 years studying in high school and elementary school. Her husband is a teacher.

Damacia is a hardworking woman who likes to earn something and provide the best for her children. She works as a teacher in a private school in town but is also engaged in commerce, selling Nature Garden natural products. She has a lot of business because they are very good products. She has been in sales for two years.

This loan is going to be used to buy more natural products because she has many orders to deliver. She has been in this action group from the beginning and she likes the help she gets from the institution. Her dream is to keep moving forward.

loans.use: to purchase natural products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a stock of beans, rice, sugar, cooking oil, and potatoes

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura es una joven activa y emprendedora, con un espíritu de superación que la ha impulsado a buscar alternativas para ganarse la vida; por ello, a sus 21 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar en el campo de la belleza, realizando cortes, cepillados, peinados y alisados a domicilio, el oficio lo aprendió en un curso de capacitación que realizó y lleva 3 años prestando sus servicios, así genera los recursos suficientes para aportar a la economía del hogar.
El propósito del crédito es invertirlo en la compra de insumos al por mayor (químicos y tratamientos capilares), esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y prestar un buen servicio a sus clientes, satisfaciendo oportunamente los requerimientos; esto dará como resultado un incremento en los ingresos que percibe por la prestación de sus servicios.
Laura, trabaja cada día proyectándose hacia el cumplimiento de su mayor anhelo que es tener una cadena de salas de belleza, que le garanticen una rentabilidad y estabilidad económica para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su grupo familiar y ser una empresaria exitosa.
texts.en:
Laura is an active and enterprising young woman, with an indefatigable spirit that has pushed her to look for alternative ways of making a living. Therefore, at just 21, she works in the beauty sector, doing styling, hair cuts and hair straightening from home. She learnt this job on a training course, and she has now been providing these services for 3 years. In this way she earns enough money to help out with the household costs.

She is asking for a loan to buy wholesale goods (chemicals and hair treatments). This will allow her to carry on with her work and provide a good service to her customers, meeting their needs at the right time. This will result in an increase in her income.

Laura works every day trying to achieve her greatest wish: to have a chain of beauty salons, which would guarantee her profitability and an economic stability . This would provide a better quality of life to her family and make her a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy wholesale items (chemicals and hair treatments).

loans.name: Alpha Lom. Group

texts.en:
Zamdeihching is 30 years old. She appears in the picture with her right hand raised. She belongs to Alpha Lom Group. She has one son and two daughters. She is hard working and at this time, she does things cautiously. Her husband is engaged in carpentry work. She weaves traditional wrap-arounds and supplies her products to shops in the market. She does not weave alone but engages professional weavers. Some of her products, as shown in the picture, are beautiful and costly too.

Zamdeihching had two handlooms. When she first took the loan, she bought another handloom. With three handlooms, she was able to engage weavers and increase the number of products. In a week, she was able to earn good money and with the profits she made, she bought one more handloom. Now she has all together four handlooms. 

Though Zamdeihching faces many difficulties in earning an income for the family while she is looking after her young children, she somehow can afford to buy essential materials like cooking gas, blankets and others for the family. She wishes to make sure her children have the best education and to own land and farm for herself. With her dedication and the tremendous help from WSDS through the loan, she believes that she will be successful. The rest of the group members are also engaged in weaving, tailoring and grocery shops.

loans.use: To buy yarn for weaving

loans.name: Adila

texts.en:
Adila is 44 years old and married. She has four daughters and a son. Her family are refugees, and they have lived in an IDP settlement for a long time. Adila is a farmer; she raises fruits (e.g., apples, pears) and vegetables (e.g., cucumbers, onions, potatoes, greens). She sells the produce at the local bazaar. She has worked in this field for 12 years, earning 150AZN monthly.

People like eating fruits and vegetables. They know that fresh fruits and vegetables are useful for health. They use fruit to prepare juice or jam, and they cook different kinds of soup and other dishes using vegetables. They prefer buying fruits and vegetables from private gardens, because it’s cheaper.

Adila doesn’t earn enough money to cover her big family’s demands. She applied for a 2,000AZN loan, in order to buy new fertilizers and new kinds of fruit tree seeds. She wants to provide a good education for her children and make their life as easy as possible.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizers and new kinds of fruit tree seeds

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Мунира уроженка села города Истаравшан, ей 50 лет. У нее есть муж и сын. Мунира трудолюбивая сельская женщина с добрым и отзывчивым сердцем. Она любит животных и на протяжении 10 лет при дворе своего дома разводит коров и телят. Ремесло животноводство передано ей от отца и матери. Мунире в ее деятельности активно помогает муж. Сейчас в ее скотном дворе имеется всего одна корова. Для развития своего бизнеса Мунире необходимо закупить пару коров, однако для реализации цели ей не хватает 1000 долларов США. Эту сумму она берет в кредит и надеется что кредиторы KIVA окажут ей финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Munira is a 50-year-old native of a village near Istaravan. She is married and has a son. She is a hardworking villager with a kind and sympathetic heart. She loves animals and has bred cows and calves for a period of 10 years. She learned the livestock trade from her mother and father, and her husband helps her with the animals. Munira only has one cow in her barn right now, but in order to expand her livestock business she needs to purchase a pair of cows. However, she does not have the $1000 necessary to achieve her goal. She is taking out a loan for this amount and is grateful for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy a pair of cows to develop her livestock business

loans.name: Martha Del Carmen

texts.es:
En el cantón Pichincha cada quince días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito Nueva Alianza, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación surcada por un gran rio lo cual lo hace propicia para los cultivos.
En este lugar vive la señora Martha, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 16, 13 y 6 años, los dos mayores  estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es ganadero.
Doña Martha es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito para ella y también para las actividades de su marido con la finalidad de sacar adelante su hogar, mientras que ella se dedica a la cría de chanchos y gallinas el se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, el vende por toda la ciudad leche y quesos que Doña Martha elabora, también actualmente tienen muchas hectáreas sembradas de maíz razón por lo cual necesitan de urgencia de los créditos.
Este crédito es para comprar alimento para los animales y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Lleva más de 12 años en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Su sueño es darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The credit group Nueva Alianza meets every two weeks in the canton of Pichincha. This place is known for being very dynamic. Most of its residents work farming and raising animals because it has lots of vegetation and a big river runs through it, which makes it suitable for crops. 

This is where Martha lives. She is 37 years old and married. She has three children form this relationship, who are ages sixteen, thirteen, and six. The two oldest are in high school and the youngest in elementary school. Her husband works with livestock.

Martha is a very good wife, and she is getting this loan for herself as well as for her husband's business in order for the family to get ahead. While she raises pigs and chickens, he works farming and raising livestock. He sells milk all over the city, as well as the cheeses that Martha makes. They also have many acres of corn planted, which is why they urgently need the loans.

She will use this loan to buy feed for the animals and fertilizer for the crops. She has been in her credit group for over twelve years and she enjoys it because of the help they offer through lending. Her dream is to give her children a good education.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en: Sylivia is a twenty year-old married woman who has five children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She grows cocoa and beans to sell and has been in the business for three years. She hopes to grow the crops on a large scale for better yield and high profits so as to educate her children.  She faces a challenge of seasonal changes, especially in the dry season where the harvest is so low.  Sylivia has asked for a loan to buy cocoa and beans to sell.

loans.use: To buy cocoa and beans to sell.

loans.name: Carmen Jazmin

texts.es:
En el cantón Pichincha cada quince días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito Nueva Alianza, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación surcada por un gran rio lo cual lo hace propicia para los cultivos.
En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 24 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 5 y 3 años, el mayor estudia en escuela. El marido trabaja talando y aserrando arboles. 
Doña Carmen es una mujer que siempre busca el bienestar de su familia y para esto ella se dedica a la cría de animales en su casa, ella invierte parte del crédito para esto pero también con cada uno de los créditos ella va de a poco mejorando su casa, por eso está muy agradecida con la institución  ya que le permite mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, con este crédito espera terminar una parte de un cuarto que le falta para sus hijos.
Este crédito es para comprar materiales de construcción y alimento para los pollos. Esta desde hace 5 años en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella  mejora cada día más su hogar. Su sueño es terminar por completo su casa.
texts.en:
The credit group Nueva Alianza meets every fifteen days In the canton of Pichincha. This is a dynamic area where most of its inhabitants work in agriculture and animal husbandry. It is a region with a lot of vegetation, with a river running through it which is favorable for crops.

This is where Carmen lives.  She is 24 years old and is in a committed relationship from which she has two children, 5 and 3 years old. The elder one is in school.  Her husband works as a lumberjack.

Carmen is a woman who is always concerned about the well being of her family and that is why she raises animals. She does this from her house.  She invests some of the loan in this, but with each loan she is slowly making improvements to her house.  She is most grateful to the institution for this because it allows her to improve her family's quality of life. With this loan she plans to finish part of a room that she needs for her children. This loan is for the purchase of construction materials and feed for her chickens. She has been with the credit group for 5 years and likes it because the loans allow her to improve her house every day.  Her dream is to finish fixing up her house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and chicken feed.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru: Манзура активная, трудящаяся сельская женщина из района Шахритус. Она замужняя женщина в возрасте 31 года, воспитывающая троих детей. Манзура вместе с семьей занимается растениеводством, как и многие жители села. Это ремесло им передается от предков из поколения к поколению. Еще с детства они вовлекаются в работу земледелия и животноводства. Сейчас в доме Манзуры имеются два дойных коров для нужд семьи. Она ухаживает за коровами сама. Манзура решила превратить свое любимое дело в бизнес и заняться куплей и продажей скота. Тем самым она хочет улучшить жизненные условия семьи. Но для осуществления цели Манзура просит кредит, так как собственного начального капитала не хватает. Манзура планирует закупить четверых молодых бычков и после откорма 30-35 дней перепродать на том же скотном рынке, где будет покупать. У нее есть все условия для ведения данного бизнеса, и ей сейчас нужна только финансовая поддержка, чтобы начать бизнес.
texts.en:
Manzura is an active, toiling village woman from the Shahrituz region. She is a married women of 31 years, raising three children. Manzura and her family grow crops, just as many rural residents do. This craft is passed to them by their ancestors from generation to generation. Still in childhood, they get involved in working the land and with livestock. Now at home, Manzura has two dairy cows for the family's needs. She cares for the cows herself.

Manzura decided to turn her favorite activities into a business and to engage in the buying and selling of cattle. In this way, she wants to improve the family's living conditions. But to realize her goals, Manzura is requesting a loan, since her own starting capital is not sufficient.

Manzura plans to purchase four young steers and after fattening them for 30-35 days to resell them at the cattle market. She has all the conditions for running this business and now she needs financial support to start the business.

loans.use: to buy four small steers

loans.name: José Norberto

texts.es:
José de 52 años de edad, esta acompañado y estudio hasta sexto grado. Se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. Junto a su esposa que le apoya en la actividades agrícolas y en el ordeño de las vacas.

José se dedica  a la agricultura, oficio que aprendió de sus padres;  para llegar a la parcela camina 3  Km y trabajan durante la mañana y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y en la tarde se dedica a cuidar unas vacas.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar una yunta de bueyes que necesita para poder arar la tierra donde cultiva y podrá obtener un ingreso adicional por arar otras parcelas lo que le ayudara a mantener a su familia.

José planea  comprar un terreno para sembrar y donde tener sus animales.
texts.en:
Jose, 52, has a partner and studied through the sixth grade. He gets up at 5 am every morning when he and his wife, who helps him farm, milk the cows.

Jose is engaged in agriculture, a craft he learned from his parents. He walks 3 kilometers to get to his plot to work in the morning. His wife also devotes herself to domestic chores and helps with the cows in the afternoons.

He is requesting a loan from CREDICAMPO to buy a team of oxen he needs to plow the land where he grows. He can earn additional income by plowing other fields. This income will help support his family.

Jose plans to buy land to plant near where he keeps his animals.

loans.use: to purchase a team of oxen for plowing.

loans.name: Nosethu

texts.en:
Nosethu is a Business Management student at the Maharishi Institute. Nosethu is 25 years old and was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute:

What do you study at the Maharishi Institute and what classes do you enjoy most?
“I am studying for a Bachelor of Business Administration. The classes I enjoy the most are the Science of Creative Intelligence classes as they develop the self, which helps me to focus on my other classes.”

What are your goals after Graduation?
“After graduation I would like to work in Human Resources, eventually becoming an HR Manager, as I love working with people. I would like to initially work in Johannesburg but I would love to travel one day too.”

Tell us about your background?
“I was born in the rural area of Port St John’s in the Eastern Cape. I am the third born of four children. My oldest brother is working in a shop but my other two siblings are not working. My sister just completed Grade 12, but at this stage, she can’t afford to study further. My mother works in a local hotel and my father is a merchandiser in a wholesale shop. I am not married, but I have a 5-year old daughter.”

What do you do in your spare time?
“I enjoy reading and writing poetry during my free time. I also love just spending time thinking with no one around, as that keeps me calm and allows me to think about my life in general.”

How will the Kiva Loan change your life?
“Due to my disadvantaged background, a Kiva loan will relieve the stress caused by my financial problems. It will enable me to focus better on my studies.”

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Bulelwa

texts.en:
Bulelwa is a Business Management student at the Maharishi Institute. Bulelwa is 20 years old and was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute:

What do you study at the Maharishi Institute and what Classes do you enjoy most?
“I am studying for a Bachelor of Business Administration. The classes I enjoy the most are Algebra and the Science of Creative Intelligence. Through the SCI classes, I am able to know myself from within and that reflects on my studies as I can implement all that I have learned.”

What are your goals after Graduation?
“I would initially like to work in the financial sector as I love numbers. But one day, I would love to run my own business, in fact a few businesses, in Johannesburg.”

Tell us about your background?
“I was born and bred in Dobsonville, Soweto. I am the fourth born of eight children (five brothers and two sisters). We are a family of 11 people as my uncle also stays with us. My mother works at a major retailer as a packer but my father in unemployed. All of the children are studying – four of us in tertiary studies, three at senior school and one at junior school. I am not married and do not have children.”


What do you do in your spare time?
“In my spare time I like studying and looking for creative things to do. But most of all I like going to church.”

How will the Kiva Loan change your life?
“With a Kiva loan, I will be able to come to school daily as I’ll have enough money for transport. I’ll also be able to buy all the study materials that I need and will be able to happily continue with my studies.”

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Maftuna

texts.en:
Maftuna is not married. She lives with her parents in a village.

She always wanted to be a successful business woman. One month ago, she began her sewing business. She sews women’s national dresses very wonderfully. Maftuna offers her service to her neighbors from her house.

She wants to buy a new sewing machine to increase the working capital of her new business. She is asking for a loan of 850 somoni with this aim. In the future she wants to open her own atelier. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to increase working capital of new business

loans.name: Mavlyuda

texts.en: Mavlyuda was born in 1968. She is married and has five children. She is a very careful mother for her children. Mavlyuda’s husband is a farmer. He grows vegetables. She has worked in a local hospital as a cleaning woman for more than a year. Mavlyuda’s two children are adult and three of them are younger. Mavlyuda’s son has no job in Tajikistan, so he is going to Russia to find a job. She is asking for a loan of 1,500 Somoni to buy an air ticket for her son. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy an air ticket for her son

loans.name: Ramona Dolores

texts.es:
En el cantón Pichincha cada quince días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito Nueva Alianza, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación surcada por un gran rio lo cual lo hace propicia para los cultivos.
En este lugar vive la señora Ramona, tiene 32 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 8, 5 y 1 año, los mayores estudian en escuela. El marido es agricultor. 
Doña Ramona es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta trabajar para ayudarle a su marido a sacar adelante el hogar ya que el no gana mucho en sus faenas en el campo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos. Trabaja todos los días más que todo en las mañanas ya que a esa hora dos de sus hijos están en la escuela y así se le hace más fácil salir ya luego ella regresa a ayudarles en sus tareas de la escuela. Tiene 4 años  que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual sale adelante.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Lleva 4 años en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos empezó este negocio que le permite salir adelante. Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Nueva Alianza Communal Bank meets every 15 days in Pichincha canton. This is known as a very dynamic place where a majority of the inhabitants farm and raise animals because the area has copious vegetation, split as it is by a large river that makes it favorable to crops. 

Sra. Ramona lives here. She is 32 years old and lives in a common-law relationship from which she has three children, who are 8, 5 and 1 years old. The older ones attend school. Her husband is a farmer.

Doña Ramona is a very feisty woman who enjoys working to help her husband move the household ahead since he does not earn much in farm work. She sells all kinds of clothing, going door to door. She also sells from home to well known customers. She works every day, mainly in the mornings because her children are in school then and it is easier for her to leave the house and then return in time to help them with their school work. She has had this business for four years and she is making progress.

She will use this loan to purchase more merchandise, such as pants, blouses, T-shirts and children’s clothing. She has been a member of this communal bank for four years and she likes it because the loans have enabled her to start her business and get ahead. Her dream is to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, T-shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is from Candura, San Juan, Siquijor. She  is 46 years old and is married. She has three children who are adults.

In 2013, Lorna applied for her membership with PMPC.  Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become one. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Recently, Lorna has asked for financial assistance of Php 10,000 to purchase additional canned goods, beverages, noodles and soft drinks. Through this she hopes to increase her more income and be of help in the expansion of her business.  She has found assistance for their financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: To purchase additional canned goods, beverages, noodles and soft drinks.

loans.name: Paola Viviana

texts.es:
En el cantón Pichincha cada quince días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito Grupo En Acción, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación surcada por un gran rio lo cual lo hace propicia para los cultivos.
En este lugar vive la señora Paola, tiene 30 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 1 año y 3 meses de nacido. El marido se dedica a la agricultura. 
Doña Paola es una mujer que le gusta pensar en el futuro, por eso está estudiando terminando la secundaria, ella piensa que la educación actual está muy difícil y quiere estar preparada en conocimientos para cuando le toque ayudarle a su hijo en las tareas de la escuela. Ella utiliza parte del crédito para gastos relacionados con sus estudios pero también le da parte del crédito para que su marido lo utilice en el campo, el siembra maíz, maní entre otros cultivos en la época invernal, actividad con la que el gana lo necesario para sacara adelante a su familia. 
Este crédito es para comprar libros, abonos y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Lleva tres ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan para salir adelante. Su sueño es  terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Every 15 days, the credit group "group in action" meets in the canton of Pichincha. This place is known for being very dynamic. Most of its inhabitants are engaged in agriculture and animal husbandry because they are in an area crossed by a large river which is very favorable for crops. Paola, 30, lives here. She is in a common-law marriage and is the mother of a child who is 1 year, 3 months old. 

Paola is a woman who likes to think ahead so she is considering finishing high school. She thinks that education today is very hard but she wants to be prepared to teach her child skills and to help her child in school work. She used some of the loan for expenses related to her studies and also to help her husband with planting corn, peanuts, and other crops in the winter. It's an activity that allows them to earn for their family.

This loan is to purchase books and fertilizers for crops. This is her third loan and she likes the help she gets to get ahead. Her dream is to finish her studies.

loans.use: to purchase school books and to buy fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Snooky

texts.en:
Snooky is married and has four children. Snooky is 41 years old and lives in Sta.Cruz, Sinacaban, Philippines. She sells gasoline to earn a living and has had this business for two months.  Each month, she earns PHP 1500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 to purchase additional gasoline for retail.
Snooky has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Snooky hopes to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase additional gasoline for retail

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a thirty-five year old married man with three children, two of whom go to school. He has been in the agriculture business for fourteen years and works six days a week. He went into this business with an aim of helping his family but is challenged by fluctuations of agricultural products. His dream is to become a great farmer in his area, growing cash crops.  Drought is the challenge he faces. Moses has asked for a loan to buy fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement and sand for home improvements.

loans.name: Felquer

texts.en:
Felquer is 37 years old, single, and is a resident of Candura, San Juan, Siquijor. He earns a living through raising pigs. 

He has been a member of PMPC for almost one year and enjoys the privileges being a member of the Cooperative. Now he is applying for a loan of Php 5,000 to purchase additional feeds and piglets.

Felquer deeply wishes to maintain a membership in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: To purchase additional feeds and piglets.

loans.name: Angeli

texts.en:
Angeli is 31 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has two children. 
Angeli has been engaged in selling RTW’s, relief goods “okay-okay”, and from the selling of dressed chicken for two years.  She earns approximately PHP1,500 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional stock of RTW's and  "okay-okay" (used clothing).  Angeli has been a member of PMPC for almost a year. In the future, Angeli hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of Ready-To-Wear and  "okay-okay" (used clothing)

loans.name: Delinda

texts.en:
Delinda, a 59-year-old married mother of four, is happy tending her little store in support of her family.  Fortunately, it is located in a populous neighborhood, so she makes good daily sales.  Delinda continues running her enterprise well even though there is increased competition from other stores.  Delinda believes that with PMPC's support, as one family they will sustain and beat the competition.  

A member to Paglaum MPC for the past year, Delinda has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional inventory to increase her income. She has confidence that she can maintain the label of member in good standing.

loans.use: To purchase additional canned goods, beverages and sofft drinks

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena, a 39-year-old widow, lives in Tulapos, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor, Philippines where she raises pigs. Through Paglaum MPC she obtained the capital to purchase her piglets and feed.

In order to earn more, Rowena is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy additional piglets and feeds. She really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family. In the future, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to provide more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets and feeds

loans.name: Adolfo Damián

texts.es:
El joven Adolfo Damián  habita en el municipio de Achuapa departamento de león, una ciudad donde los habitantes se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio.

Es un joven de 47 años de edad con 3 hijos bajo su cargo, dos de ellos estudian en la primaria y el otro va para la universidad,  con lo poco que el percibe de su salario a duras penas ayuda a mantener el sustento diario a sus tres hijos que tanto ama y estima.
 
Desde hace dos años ejerce el trabajo como bodeguero, pero son de sus sueños llegar a preparar a sus tres hijitos, por lo que solicita el crédito a Ceprodel y Kiva para la compra de: Mochilas cuadernos, lápices, pago de universidad y el vestir de sus hijos. 
Es de su gran necesidad que Ceprodel y Kiva le financie este crédito. 
Se siente a gusto con este tipo de empleo porque le ha ayudado mucho con su familia. 

Agradece mucho por la mano amigable  que Ceprodel y Kiva le ha brindado y espera en Dios seguir recibiendo este privilegio, de estos pequeños créditos que le ayudan mucho.
texts.en:
The young Adolfo Damian lives in the town of Achuapa in the Department of Leon. In his town, the inhabitants are engaged in various business activities. He is a young 47 years old. He has three children in his charge. Two of them are studying in primary school and the other is in high school. What little he earns barely helps maintain the daily support his three children need. He loves them and holds them in high regard.

For two years he has worked as a winemaker but his dream is to prepare his three young children so he has requested this loan from CEPRODEL and Kiva to purchase backpacks, notebooks, pencils, and paying for school tuition for his children. 

CEPRODEL and Kiva will finance this loan because of his great need. He is comfortable with this loan because it will help his family a lot. 

He is grateful for the helpful hand that CEPRODEL and Kiva have provided. He has hope in God that he will continue to receive these opportunities and small loans that help a lot.

loans.use: to purchase school supplied and pay tuition for his four children's educations.

loans.name: Germay

texts.en: Germay is 31 years old and lives in Candura, San Juan, Siquijor. In order to help the family, she sells a variety of goods. Aside from selling rice cakes, she operates a sari-sari store. In 2013, she became an active member of Paglaum MPC with a good credit standing. She wants to obtain financial assistance in the amount of PHP 10,000 to purchase more goods for her sari-sari store because selling rice cakes is not sufficient for her daily needs. She plans to repair their house and to send her children to college so that they can help her in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional canned goods, noodles and beverages.

loans.name: Sabrin

texts.en:
Sabrin is a 53 year-old widow from Jericho. She is a mother of seven sons and four daughters. For the past five years, Sabrin's son has worked in his own auto repair workshop. This is the only source of income to the family. Its is a good business and provides a good income to the family. 
Sabrin took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her son to buy new tools for his auto repair workshop. By taking this loan, he will be able to increase his productivity and also his income
Sabrin appears in the photo

loans.use: to  help her son to buy new tools for his auto repair workshop

loans.name: José Leonel

texts.es:
El joven José Leonel  habita en el municipio de Achuapa un pueblo  religioso, donde se mantiene la educación y la humildad. 

Es un joven de 45 años de edad con 3 hijos bajo su cargo, dos de ellos estudian en la primaria,  con lo poco que el gana de su salario a duras penas ayuda a mantener el sustento diario a sus tres hijos que tanto ama y estima y le está brindando una mejor educación.
 
Desde hace 10 años ejerce el trabajo como colector de impuesto para una institución del estado, pero son de sus sueños llegar a preparar a sus tres hijitos, por lo que solicita el crédito a Ceprodel y Kiva para la compra de útiles escolares tales como: Mochilas cuadernos, lápices y una computadora para sus estudias. 
Es de su gran necesidad que Ceprodel y Kiva le financie este crédito. 

Agradece mucho por la mano amigable  que Ceprodel y Kiva le ha brindado y espera en Dios seguir recibiendo este privilegio y así poder obtener el sueno de su vida llegar a preparar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
José Leonel lives in the Achuapa municipality, which is a religious community where education and humility are important. He is a young man of 45 years and has 3 children in his care, two of whom are in primary school. With the small amount that he earns, he takes great pains to help support his three children whom he loves and appreciates. He is providing them with a better education.
