Ten years ago, he began working as a tax collector for a government institution, but his dream is to adequately prepare his young children, which is why he has requested a loan from Ceprodel and Kiva. He will use the loan to purchase supplies like backpacks, notebooks, pencils, and a computer for their studies. Due to his great need, Ceprodel and Kiva will be providing him with financing.

He is very grateful for the helping had that Ceprodel and Kiva have provided and he has faith in God that he will continue to receive this privilege so that he can achieve his lifelong dream of providing his children with an education.

loans.use: to pay for school supplies.

loans.name: Mery Isabel

texts.es:
En el cantón Pichincha cada quince días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito Nueva Alianza, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación surcada por un gran rio lo cual lo hace propicia para los cultivos.
En este lugar vive la señora Mery, tiene 52 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 8 hijos mayores de edad, tres de ellos aun viven en su casa. El marido es comerciante. 
Doña Mery es una muy buena mujer que realiza el crédito para que su marido lo utilice en sus actividades comerciales, el se dedica a la compara y la venta de gallinas criollas para lo cual se desplaza hasta los campos cercanos a compara las gallinas faenadas las mismas que luego ofrece en la ciudad ya sea en restaurantes o casas de la localidad, el lleva más de 30 años dedicado a esta actividad con la cual saca adelante a su familia. 
Este crédito es para comprar gallinas. Lleva dos años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella ayuda a su marido. Su sueño es  tener una tienda de víveres.
texts.en:
The credit group Nueva Alianza meets every fifteen days In the canton of Pichincha. This is a dynamic area where most of its inhabitants work in agriculture and animal husbandry. It is a region with a lot of vegetation, with a river running through it which is favorable for crops.

This is where Mery lives. She is 52 years old and is in a committed relationship from which she has eight grown children, three of whom still live with her. Her husband is in business. Mery is a very good woman who is requesting the loan so that her husband can use the money for his business. He buys and sells chickens.  He travels to the nearby countryside to buy slaughtered chickens which he then sells in the city to restaurants or local individuals.  He has been doing this for 30 years and it has allowed him to raise his family.  

This loan is for the purchase of chickens. Mery has been with the Credit Group for two years, and she likes it because the loans allow her to help her husband. Her dream is to have a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Mashkhura

texts.ru: Машхура замужняя женщина в возрасте 30 лет. Она живет в районе Спитамен. Ее муж фермер и директор земельного комитета. Сама Машхура швея. Она дома занимается пошивом женских национальных платьев. Так как у ее мужа имеется дехканское хозяйство, он в этом году запасся большим количеством соломы. Машхура и ее муж собираются открыть бизнес по откорму и продаже крупнорогатого скота. Но для купли скота им не хватает 2500 долларов США. У них во дворе дома есть старый сарай, где они будут держать коров. Машхура очень надеется на поддержку. Начав прибыльный бизнес, они смогут улучшить жилищные условия.
texts.en: Mashkhura is a married, 30 year-old woman.  She lives in the Spitamen district. Her husband is a farmer and a director of the land committee.  Mashkhura is a seamstress.  She is involved in sewing women's national dresses at home.  Because her husband has a farm, this year he stocked up on a large amount of hay.  Mashkhura and her husband are planning to open a business in fattening up and reselling cattle, but they are short 2500 US dollars to buy livestock.  They have an old barn in their yard, where they will keep cows.  Mashkhura hopes very much for the support.  After starting a profitable business, they would be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy three heads of good-breed cattle in order to start a business in fattening up and reselling livestock

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 37 year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is housewife and looks after her family of five. Her husband is a car mechanic by profession. He has been running a vehicle repair shop for the last ten years in the market. He is a good car mechanic. For many days he has needed some spare parts for his shop to provide services. So, Farzana made contact with Kiva partner, Brac Pakistan, for a loan.  This will help her husband to continue the business of car repairing.
 Farzana is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, Brac Pakistan

loans.use: to buy spare parts for car repairing

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 28 years old; he lives with his family in Gaza.

He has a poultry farm, and he earns a monthly income of US$ 650. He started his business in 2012.

He needs this youth loan to expand his yard, and buy chickens, which will help him to improve the family's financial conditions and to support the needs of his family and reinvest in his business.

Mohammad is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to expand his yard and buy chickens.

loans.name: Habil

texts.en: Habil is a 40-year-old married man. He has six children with ages ranging from 7 to 22 years old. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a welding business where he makes metallic doors, chairs and other items. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are regular customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be transport. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy a welding machine. His business goal is to be the best within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children to a higher level. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to clear school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy a welding machine

loans.name: Murodgul

texts.en: Murodgul is married and has two children who are one and four years old. She always wanted to provide them with good living conditions. With this aim, she decided to start new business by cooking and selling cakes and sambusa in order to generate an income which she can contribute to her home’s finances. She studied at the course of ‘To Get Ahead’ of women organization and got enough skills about business.  She will manage the business alone. She will be a very successful business woman as she is hardworking and smart. She is asking for a loan of 2000 Somoni buy flours, sugar, butter and etc. for organizing the new business. She will get through, using the loan, and her business will be a source of income so that her family can have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy flours, sugar, butter, etc. for organizing new business

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente is 38 years old and from Talibon, Bohol. He is married and has three children between the ages of 4 and 13. For two years now, he has been making candies for a living to support his family. He makes candies from sweet potato, peanuts, and tamarind. This business help him earn 5,000 PHP per month for his children. He is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy peanuts, sugar, and sweet potatoes.

He hopes that with a loan, he can continue to expand his business. In the future, Vicente would like to be successful in educating his children.

loans.use: to buy peanuts, sugar, and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Sabina Esperanza

texts.es:
En el cantón Pichincha cada quince días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito Nueva Alianza, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación surcada por un gran rio lo cual lo hace propicia para los cultivos.
En este lugar vive la señora Sabina, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen siete hijos, seis mayores de edad y el último de 12 años que  estudia en colegio, con ella viven tres de sus hijos. Su esposo es agricultor.
Doña Sabina con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante en el hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo,  su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa. Trabaja todos los días más que todo en las mañanas, ella  deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Tiene 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad  con lo cual sale adelante.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ternos de baño. Lleva 4 años  en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio. Su sueño es  seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Every 15 days, the New Credit Alliance Group meets in the canton of Pichincha. This place is known for being very dynamic. Most of its inhabitants are engaged in agriculture and animal husbandry because it is an area crossed by a large river which makes it favorable for crops.

Sabina, 52, lives here. She is married and has seven children. Six are already adults and the youngest is 12 years old and in school. Three children still live with her. Her husband is a farmer. 

Sabina has the the intention of earning on her own to get ahead. She sells clothing of all kinds in her home and door-to-door. She works mostly in the mornings. She gives her customers credit and charges them every two weeks. She travels to Guayaquil every two weeks or every month to buy her merchandise depending on her needs. She has done this work for 4 years. 

This loan is going towards the purchase of more merchandise such as pants, blouses, shirts, and bathing suits. This is her fourth year in the credit group and she likes that she began her business with her first loan. Her dream is to keep moving forward.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, t-shirts, and bathing suits.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Mrs. Janet, 50, is married with four adult-age children. She is a private employee for one of the flower shops in the city. Her primary duty in the shop is to arrange flowers whenever there are orders for weddings, birthday celebrations, funerals, and other occasions. She has been in this job for 10 years. She became a member of Paglaum Multipurpose Cooperative in March 2010 and has availed more products and services of the coop already, especially loan products. Now, she applied for another loan to redeem her pawned real estate property (land title) from another institution before she became a member of the coop. The loan can help her in the redemption because it has lower interest rates than the other institution. Her next plan is to renovate their house after fully repaying her current loan.

loans.use: To redeem her pawned land title.

location.town: Dipolog-Gulayon, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Geogracia

texts.en:
Geogracia is married and has three children. Geogracia is 38 years old and lives in Malintuboan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.
Geogracia raises pigs to earn a living and has had this business for six years. Each month, she earns 4000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 15,000 for additional capital.
Geogracia has been a member of PMPC. In the future, Geogracia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs

loans.name: Gali Sara's Group

texts.en:
Gali Sara is a 35-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a housewife and looks after her family consisting of eight persons.  Her husband has been running his own business of clothes-selling for 20 years.  He is the only breadwinner, responsible for financially supporting  the entire family and managing the household. He needs to purchase different types of clothes for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial resources he is unable to purchase new varieties of  clothes. 

Therefore Gali Sara is applying for loan from BRAC Pakistan, so that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes for his business. He can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount. 

Gali Sara is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy clothes for her husband to resell

loans.name: Joackim

texts.en:
Joackim is a twenty-eight-year-old man, married with four children, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has an electronics repair shop along side a cocoa garden to cover his family's cost of living. He dreams of having a large scale cocoa garden which would enable him to supply to the leading agents, however, seasonality is a big challenge. 

Joackim intends to use the loan to buy  cocoa to sell.

loans.use: To buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
This is Jovita, 50, a resident of Caloocan 5, Philippines. She is a widow and she has children. She and her children manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jovita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php 30,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Jovita dreams of having another store in a crowded place and hopes to have a better living.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
This is Rosalinda, 39, a resident of Caloocan 5, Philippines. She is married to Ariel and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rosalinda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php 12,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Rosalinda hopes that her business will grow bigger and hopes that her family will have a good future.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es:
En el cantón Pichincha cada quince días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito Grupo En Acción, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación surcada por un gran rio lo cual lo hace propicia para los cultivos.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 27 años de edad, está casada pero aun no ha tenido hijos. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña María y su esposo se dedican al comercio, ellos todos los días recorren varias ciudades entregando pan en tiendas y locales de dichas ciudades, tienen un carro en el cual realizan estos recorridos, el pan lo reciben de una fabrica de la ciudad de Santo Domingo y luego de esto ellos realizan su labor visitando ciudades como El Empalme, Balzar, Quevedo y también su propia ciudad en la cual tienen mucha clientela.  Llevan 8 años realizando esta labor con la cual esperan forjar un mejor futuro para cuando vengan sus hijos.
Este crédito es para comprar pan. Lleva tres ciclos en el Crédito Grupo y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho para financiar su negocio. Su sueño es  tener su primer bebé.
texts.en:
The credit group En Acción [In Action] meets every fifteen days in the Canton of Pichincha. It is noted for being a very vibrant area where most of the people work in agriculture and raising livestock; and for being an area of vast vegetation through which a great river flows, making it favorable for farming. This is where María lives. She is 27 years old and she is married, but she does not yet have children. Her husband is a vendor.

María and her husband are vendors, and every day they travel to various cities, delivering bread to stores and businesses within each city. The have a car which they use to follow their routes—they receive  the bread from a factory in the city of Santo Domingo, and then they carry out their work, visiting cities such as El Empalme, Balzar, Quevedo, and also their own city, in which they have many customers. They have been doing this work for eight years, and through it they hope to build a better future for when they have children. 

This loan is for the purchase of bread. This is her third cycle in the credit group, and she likes it because the loans help her very much to finance her business. 

Her dream is to have her first baby.

loans.use: to purchase bread.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 24-year-old single man from a small village near Nablus city. He lives with his family in a small simple house. For the past five years, Mohammad has been working with a musical band. They participate in parties and social events. It is a good business and the band is well known in his city. 

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new guitar for his work. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to improve the band and increase the demand for their services.
 
Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new guitar for his work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies and pay the rent on his farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise wholesale (lotions for men and for women).

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.ru:
Мухайё родилась в Спитаменском районе и по сей день проживает там. Ей 42 года.Мухайё многодетная мать у нее шестеро детей. У Мухайё очень дружная семья. Всегда поддерживают друг друга во всем. Муж Мухайё работает в районной железнодорожной  станции грузчиком. Иногда старшие сыновья тоже идут туда на подработку, таким образом добавляют свою долю в семейный бюджет. 

Сама Мухайё с детство увлекалась шитьем национальных платьев. Она всегда для  сестер и соседок вышивала разные нарядные платья. На сегодняшней день Мухайё профессиональная швея с большим опытом. У нее очень много клиентов, кроме вышивание национальных платьев Мухайё еще шьет постельное белье на заказы. Мухайё постоянная клиентка ООО МДО "Арванд", вот уже несколько лет подряд она сотрудничает с организацией.  С финансовой поддержкой организации Арванд Мухайе намного расширила свою деятельность.
 
Мухайе в очередной раз подала заявку на кредит но на этот раз для другой цели.  Ее сын   собирается уехать в РТ она планирует купить ему авиабилет, так как на данный момент у нее на руках нету достаточной суммы.  Мухайё заранее благодарит организацию Кива  за многолетнюю поддержку и  конечно же за доверия.
texts.en:
Muhayo was born in Spitamen and still lives there today. She is 42 years old and the mother of six children. She has a very close-knit family who always support each other. Her husband loads freight at the regional railroad station. Sometimes her older sons can also work there part-time and add their share to the family budget.

Muhayo has enjoyed sewing traditional dresses since she was young. She always embroidered elegant dresses for her sisters and neighbors, and now she is an experienced professional seamstress. She has many customers and sews linens to order in addition to her traditional dresses. She has been a client of MDO Arvand for a few years, which has enabled her to expand her business activities.

Muhayo has applied for a loan again, but this time it is for a different purpose. Her son is getting ready to go to Russia and she is going to buy him a plane ticket, although she does not have enough money right now. Muhayo thanks Kiva in advance for the support over the years and, of course, for their confidence.

loans.use: to buy a plane ticket

loans.name: Raeda

texts.en:
Raeda is a 41-year-old widow from Jericho. She is a mother of three sons and one daughter, all of them attending school. For the past five years, Raeda works at making traditional sewing products. This is the only source of income for the family. It's a good business and provides a good income but the raw materials are expensive. 

Raeda took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more raw materials for her sewing workshop. By taking this loan, Raeda will be able to provide good living conditions especially the education expenses for her kids. 

Raeda appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her sewing workshop

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro tiene 67 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la compra y venta de animales de menores patos, gallinas y cuyes desde hace 6 años, por lo que cuenta con clientela considerable, Alejandro ha solcitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 67 years old. He lives in the Oyotún district, located two hours from the city of Chiclay, of the Lambayeque region along the northern coast of Perú. This community thrives on farming, trade, and livestock.

Alejandro, for the last six years, has made a living by buying and selling small animals such as ducks, chickens, and guinea pigs. He has a considerable customer base. Alejandro has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 500 Peruvian soles in order to buy nutritionally balanced feed to fatten his animals. In this way, he will generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced feed to fatten his animals.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a 58 year old married woman.  She has 6 children, ranging in age from 20 years to 35 years.  She describes herself to be a visionary.  She operates a retail business where she sells cereals.  She has been involved in this business for 5 years.  Her business is located within a shopping centre and her primary customers are regular customers. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in season.  She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stocks of maize, beans, millet, groundnuts for resale.  Her business goal is to be the best within 5 years.  She hopes that in the future, she will grow her business to greater heights.  This is her third loan with SMEP DTM.  Previous loans of KES 20,000 were repaid successfully.  She will use the anticipated profits to clear school fees for her child in college.

loans.use: buy more stocks of maize, beans, millet, groundnuts for resale

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is a single lady of thirty eight years.  She is the mother of three children and she sells spare parts and also has a taxi business.  She has been in this business for three years and gets monthly income of thirty thousand shillings.

This will be Carolyne's second loan with VisionFund Kenya, she plans to use the entire loan to buy more spare auto parts for sale. In the future she wants to be a successful business woman.

loans.use: To purchase spare auto parts for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of tomatoes, charcoal and potatoes.

loans.name: Orfelinda

texts.es:
Orfelelinda tiene 44 años de edad, vive junto a sus dos hijos en el distrito de Callayuc una comunidad que se caracteriza por sus paisajes verdes, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de cafeto, sus hijos le apoyan en las labores de mantenimiento y cosecha, Orfelinda es una madre que se esfuerza en la labor que realiza, ha solcitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para darle mantenimiento a su cultivo de café y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Orfelinda is 44 years old.  She lives with her two children in the Callayuc district, located in Cutervo province, which belongs to the Cajamarca region, in the northern sierra of Peru.   The community is known for its green landscapes and the people are engaged in farming, business, and cattle raising.
Orfelinda is engaged in agriculture, particularly coffee cultivation.  Her children help her with the maintenance and harvest. Orfelinda is a mother who works hard at her job.  She is requesting a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to purchase fertilizer to maintain her coffee and, in this way, generate higher income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for coffee crop maintenance.

loans.name: Deo

texts.en: Deo is a 43 year old man, married with six children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda.  He  started his business selling clothes and textiles to supplement his income from farming that depended on demand and supply to determine price.  He faces challenges of customers who fail to pay their debts and seasonal demand for clothes.  His aspiration is owning a wholesale boutique.  Deo is requesting for a loan to buy more clothes to sell in his boutique.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell in his boutique.

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en:
Hanifa is a woman who works hard in sowing the land.  She is divorced and has a son.  Her son is an adult.  Hanifa has been busy with growing crops and vegetables for more than 25 years.  She grows crops and sells her harvest in a local market. 

She has a great experience in this field.  Her business is the only source of income for her family.  Her son and daughter-in-law help her with managing the business.  She is asking for a loan of 2,500 USD to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.  She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Hun

texts.en:
Hun, 61 years of age, is married and has two adult children. She currently lives with her spouse and children in a rural village of Bakan, Pursat province. She grows and sells rice, which she has been doing for more than 30 years. Farming is the important source of her income.

Besides the hardships of living, Hun also wants to focus on improving sanitation practices for her entire household. That’s why she has applied for a loan amounting to USD 300, which will be used to build a hygienic latrine for the health of her family members. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Hun is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of her family members.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Kheeneth

texts.en:
This is Kheeneth, 34, a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Randy, a businessman, and they have children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Kheeneth operates a meat stall. They buy meat from suppliers that deliver the meat to the respective market stalls. Her products are pork, beef and processed meat products. There are many patrons who prefer her products since they are assured of freshness and cleanliness.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 1000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies of pork and chicken needed in her business. 

Kheeneth dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes to have a happy family. She hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more pork and chicken meat needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more foods to stock (rice, oil, peppers, fish and meat) and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Annastasia

texts.en:
Annastasia is a lady of 26 years. She is married and a mother of one child. She runs a business selling rice, toothpaste, spaghetti, etc. She has been in this business for six years now and earns a monthly income of 40,000 KES.

This will be Annastasia's second loan with VisionFund Kenya. She plans to use the entire loan to buy more inventory of rice, spaghetti, toothpaste, etc. In the future she wants to be successful in business and also educate her child.

loans.use: To purchase rice, toothpaste, spaghetti, etc.

loans.name: Bweyogerere School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Ismail. He is the head teacher of Bweyogerere Secondary School, a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Bweyogerere in Wakiso district with 800 students. Bweyogerere Secondary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the students. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Bweyogerere Secondary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. This will be supplemented by the sale of carbon credits, which the school will generate from using the water tank. Ismail ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Azarius

texts.en:
Azarius is a sixty-two-year-old married man with eight children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the agriculture business for sixteen years and also deals in a motorcycle transport business for additional income. He ventured into this business to look after his family and pay school fees for his children.

He is faced with a challenge of limited capital to expand his business, but dreams of becoming a model farmer. Azarius has asked for a loan to pay for fertilizers, pesticides and labour.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers, pesticides and labour.

loans.name: Marino

texts.es:
Marino tiene 38 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos y esposa en el Caserío San Juan Bautista, una zona rural de distrito de Callayuc, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de café, desde hace 8 años por lo que cuenta con experiencia en el negocio, su esposa le apoya cocinando para los trabajadores que dan mantenimiento a sus fincas, son una familia unida, Marino ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 501 nuevos soles para la compra de abono para su cultivo de café y de esta manera protegerla y ofrecer una cosecha oportuna para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Marino is 38 years old and lives with his children and wife in the hamlet of San Juan Bautista, a rural district in Callayuc. Its population is engaged in agriculture, animal husbandry, and trade. It is located in the province of Cutervo in the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru. 

Marino is engaged in farming, especially cultivating coffee. He has 8 years of experience in this business. His wife supports him by cooking for the workers that maintain their farms. They are a close family. Marino has requested a loan of 2,501 Peruvian soles to purchase fertilizer for growing coffee. It will protect his crops and provide a timely harvest for his customers.

loans.use: to fertilize his coffee plants.

loans.name: Luis Humberto

texts.es:
Luis Humberto, es soltero, vive en casa familiar en la parroquia de San Roque, perteneciente a Atuntaqui, San Roque es un lugar donde la costumbre es de indígenas que se dedican a las artesanías como por ejemplo a realizar atrapa sueños, tapices, blusas de indígenas entre otros.
Luis Humberto se dedica al alquiler de un DJ móvil para diferentes ciudades, viene realizando esta actividad algunos años la cual ha sido su fuente de ingreso para realizar cualquier actividad y cualquier necesidad y gastos que tiene, el realiza alquiler para fiestas del barrio y sus alrededores, está presente en matrimonios, bautizos, confirmaciones y otros.
Da servicios a domicilios con música y aparte de eso realiza animación para que las fiestas sean agradables, para que los clientes puedan recomendar en otras ocasiones y así seguir ejerciendo más esta actividad y seguir teniendo más clientes para brindar sus servicios.
Esta actividad aprendió de su padre que se dedicaba a lo mismo y hoy en día Luis tiene todas las ganas de seguir con esto, el realiza los eventos desde las horas que lo contraten normalmente tardes y noches, los contratos son de 10 horas en adelante y es por eso que tiene la necesidad de comprar amplificadores con más capacidad para un mejor servicio y va realizar la compra de ello con el crédito que está solicitando.
Luia agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a KIVA por la oportunidad que le brindan de mejorar su negocio y hacerlo prosperar.
texts.en:
Luis Humberto is single and lives in the family home in the parish of San Roque, which is part of
Atuntaqui. San Roque is a place where indigenous people make handicrafts such as dream catchers, tapestriess and local blouses.

Luis Humberto works as a mobile DJ in different cities and has been doing this for some years. This has been his source of income to cover any need or cost he has had or any activity he has needed to carry out. He does this work at parties in the local neighbourhood and surrounding areas, and he also performs at events such as weddings, baptisms and confirmations. He provides musical entertainment to homes, and apart from that he adds life to parties to make them pleasant and to encourage his customers to recommend him to others. In this way he can continue his work and attract more customers for his services. Luis learnt his work from his father, who did the same job, and today he really wants to carry on doing it. He works at events from the time he is contracted, typically during evenings and nights. His sessions last 10 hours or more and that's why he needs to buy amplifiers with more power output so he can provide a better service. He is going to buy them with the loan he is requesting. Luis is grateful to Fundación Alternativa and to KIVA for the opportunity they are providing to improve his business and make it prosper.

loans.use: to buy amplifiers in order to provide a better service.

loans.name: Eli

texts.es:
Eli tiene 36 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el Caserío de San Luis una zona rural del Distrito de Santo Tomás que cuenta con servicio de luz y agua, la comunidad se caracteriza por tener un relieve accidentado, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio, ganadería, ubicado en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El tiene un pequeño taller donde se dedica a la carpintería, confeccionando mesas, sillas, reposteros entre otros que lo comercializa en su caserío y zonas aledañas, Eli ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de madera y herramientas que permitirá implementar su carpintería y de esta manera seguir vendiendo sus trabajos, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Eli is 36 years old and lives with his wife and children in the hamlet of San Luis, a rural area in the district of Santo Tomas. The area has electricity and water services. The community is characterized by its rugged hills. Its population is engaged in agriculture and commerce. It is located in the province of Cutervo which belongs to the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands in Peru.

He has a small shop where he works in carpentry. He makes tables, chairs, cabinets, and others. He has sold his products in his village and surrounding areas. Eli has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,500 Peruvian soles to buy wood and tools that he will use to work in his business. It will allow him to continue to sell his work, generating more income for his family.

loans.use: to invest in tools and wood for his carpentry shop.

loans.name: Vantha

texts.en: Vantha is an experienced farmer from the village of Trapeang Chong, Bakan, Pursat. She is a married woman and the mother of two dependent children. To meet the family’s daily needs, Vantha, together with her husband, has been working on two hectares of farmland, growing rice. Vantha has been an honest client of HKL for two previous loans. She had a good credit history and repaid her loans successfully. She is asking for a new loan of USD 1,000 to build a hygienic latrine for her family members, as she doesn't have one at home. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate that is offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Vantha has been encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine for her family members.

loans.name: Luis Carlos

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre trabajador y pujante de 60 años de edad, que ha sobrepasado diversos obstáculos en la vida, entre ellos, la separación de su esposa hace ya varios años. Durante su vida productiva se ha desempeñado en diferentes actividades como empleado, pero desde hace 15 años comenzó a vender frutas y jugos naturales de manera ambulante, el oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica y surgió de la necesidad de generar ingresos para solventar los gastos familiares, luego de haberse quedado sin empleo. 
Su espíritu de superación y el amor por sus dos hijos lo motivaron para buscar alternativas que le permitieran salir adelante, fue por ello que solicitó el apoyo del crédito, ya que requiere comprar insumos al por mayor (frutas, malteadas, azúcar, vasos desechables, entre otros), esto le permitirá darle continuidad a su labor y podrá ofrecer más variedad de productos para satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes, obteniendo como resultado, un incremento favorable en las ventas e ingresos.
Luis manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es pagar las deudas que tiene pendientes  para así, lograr ver la rentabilidad real de su negocio y hacerlo crecer, pues esta es su única fuente de ingresos, con la cual pretende mejorar las condiciones de vida y el bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
Luis is a strong worker of 60 years who has overcome many obstacles in life including his separation from his wife several years ago. During his life, he has served in various capacities as an employee but 15 years ago he began selling fruit juices as a street vendor. He learned this craft through observation when the need to generate income to meet family expenses arose after he lost his job. 

His spirit of excellent and his love for his two children motivated him to seek alternative that would allow him to succeed. This is why he requested the support of a loan. He needs to buy supplies in bulk (fruits, malt, sugar, disposable cups, and more). This loan will allow him to continue his work and offer a wider range of products to suit the tastes of his customers, resulting in a favorable increase in sales and profits.

Luis says that his greatest desire is to pay his outstanding debts so he will be able to see real profitability and make his business grow. It is his only source of income and his way to improve the living conditions and welfare for his family.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale supplies to expand his juice business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items such as rice, oil and pepper for her business,

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BADEGNA ont en moyenne  44 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à KONDALA/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits alimentaires.                                                                                            Les femmes du groupe BADEGNA sont à leur 1er prêt solidaire. MARIAM, 2ème femme debout à droite  sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 500Kg de mil. Elle s’approvisionne sur place et dans les villages environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en: The women of the Badegna group are on average 44 years old, have children and all live in large traditional families in Kondala/Segou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know one another through parentage and neighborhood ties, and run their business buying and selling food products. The women of the Badegna group are on their first group loan. Mariam, the second woman standing to the right of the photo, expects to use her loan to buy 500 kilograms of millet. She stocks up at home and in the surrounding villages. She makes her sales from her home, to a clientele made up of men and women for cash and often for credit. She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA which will be used for the relative expenses of health, food, clothing and educational costs, with the rest to be reinvested in the businesses.

loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Sanavbar

texts.en: Sanavbar is a kind woman. She is married and has a son. Her husband is a carpenter. She has a pedagogical degree and works in a school. She has a small salary, which is not enough to permit her to improve their living conditions. She decided to organize a new business, a pharmacy. Her son graduated from the Medical University. He will help Sanavbar to manage the business. Sanavbar is applying for a loan of USD 3,500 to buy medicine for the new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy medicine and set up a new pharmacy business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 29 years old and is a tailor in Mariakani, Kenya. He is a married father of two whose spouse helps in the tailoring shop. He has been in this business for the last five years and has a great income.
This marks his third borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance his business after paying the previous loan successfully. 
He will use the loan to purchase sewing threads and clothing material for his stock and the anticipated profit to service his loan. He hopes to have a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sewing threads and clothing material

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: Mohamed is 46 year old, and is a carpenter in Mariakani, Kenya. He is a married father of five; his spouse is a housewife.  He has been in this business for the last five years doing well, with a great income. This marks his fifth borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance his business after repaying the previous loan successfully.  He will use the loan to purchase timber, nails, and wood vanish for his workshop. He will use the anticipated profit to educate his children. Mohamed hopes to have a prosperous business and a happy family life.

loans.use: to purchase timber, nails and wood vanish for his workshop.

loans.name: Segundo Santiago

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 30 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Lagunas, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposa se dedican a la crianza y venta de animales menores patos, cuyes y cerdos desde hace más de 02 años, son una familia emprendedora, Segundo también se dedica a labores agrícolas, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera ofrecer a un mejor precio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Segundo is 30 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the district of Lagunas, whose population makes a living from agriculture, trade, and raising livestock. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the region of Lambayeque on the north coast of Peru.

He and his wife have made a living by raising and selling minor species, such as ducks, guinea pigs, and pigs for more than two years. They are an enterprising family. Segundo also does farm work. He has requested a loan of 1,000 PEN in order to purchase feed for fattening their animals so they obtain a better price.

loans.use: to purchase feed for fattening his animals

loans.name: Elki Rubi

texts.es:
Elki Rubi tiene 32 años de edad, vive junto a sus dos hijos y esposo en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente de arroz, maíz, algodón, ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposo se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores, patos, gallos, gallinas, pollos, pavos, cerdos desde hace más de 10 años, Elki Rubi ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera ofrecerlo a un mejor precio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Elki Rubi is 32 years old. She lives with her two children and her husband in the district of Oyotún, a community which makes a living from agriculture, especially from planting rice, corn, and cotton. It is located two hours away from the city of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.

She and her husband have made a living by breeding and selling minor species, such as ducks, roosters, hens, chickens, turkeys, and pigs for more than ten years. Elki Rubi has requested a loan of 3,000 PEN in order to purchase feed to fatten her animals and offer them to her clients at a greater price.

loans.use: to purchase feed for fattening her animals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an air compressor and supplies for the tire-changing business he started

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es:
Samuel tiene 33 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el Caserío de El Pueblo Lo Hizo, una zona rual del distrito de Santo Tomás, una comunidad que se caracteriza por un relieve accidentado, lo que le ha permitido desarrollarse mediante la agricultura, cultivo de café, caña , maíz entre otros, tmabien se dedican al comercio y ganadería, ubicado en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de cafeto de la variedad catimor, tiene sembrando 2 has de cafeto de su propiedad, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 12 años, junto a su esposa también se dedica a la cría y venta de ganado vacuno, son una familia emprendedora que se esfuerza en la labor que realiza.

Samuel ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para su cultivo de cafe y pago de mantenimiento de su finca y de esta tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes, generandole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Samuel is 33 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the rural community of El Pueblo Lo Hizo in the district of Santo Tomás. The community is characterized by an uneven topography, which has allowed it to flourish through agriculture and its crops of coffee, sugar, corn, and other plants. The community also makes a living from trade and rearing livestock. It is located in the province of Cutervo, which belongs to the region of Cajamarca in the north of Peru.

Samuel makes a living from agriculture, specifically by planting the Catimor variety of coffee trees.  He owns two hectares of planted coffee trees. He has been doing this for twelve years together with his wife. He also breeds and sells cattle. They are an enterprising family who put effort into the work they do.

Samuel has requested a loan of 2,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa in order to purchase compost for his coffee crop and pay for the maintenance of his farm so he has good output to offer his clients and he can generate greater earnings for his family.

loans.use: to purchase compost and pay for workers to maintain his coffee crop

loans.name: Sekela

texts.en:
Sekela is 30 years old. She is friendly and works very hard to take care of her family. She is happily married with two children, aged three and one. She lives in a town called Chipata, located in the eastern part of Zambia.

Sekela runs a Zoona mobile money transfer business. She offers financial services to people in her community. Before running her own mobile money business, Sekela worked as a data operator for one of the breweries in the country. This previous experience has helped in the day-to-day running of her current business. 

Sekela says the community benefits from her business of mobile money transfers because people do not have to pay large sums of money or travel to the city of Lusaka to access financial services. She is very pleased with the business because it allows her to have a livable income at the end of the month to pay for her house rentals and provide for her family.

Sekela is requesting her first Kiva loan to expand her business and boost her working capital. This will increase her revenue by allowing her to provide service to more customers. 

Sekela’s biggest dream is to someday build her own house for her family. She thanks the Kiva lenders for their assistance.

loans.use: to expand her business by boosting her working capital so that she can serve more customers.

loans.name: M.mateen

texts.en: M. Mateen is a 45-year-old married man, living with his family in the area of Multan, Pakistan. He has been running a general store for eight years and generating income for his family. He sells general store items such as flour, sugar, milk packs, eggs, rice, cookies, etc.  M. Mateen is a business minded man. Recently, demand for more quality products has increased, but the demanded items are unavailable, so he has to refuse his valued customers. He does not have enough savings for further investment into the business. In fact, his generated income is spent on household and family miscellaneous expenses. Therefore, M. Mateen requested a loan for his business, to be empowered to buy the demanded items. He hopes that now he can grow this business, can cope with the increasing demand, and can generate more income as per his family needs. M. Mateen thanks Kiva and this field partner for this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy inventories for his general store.

loans.name: Ismat

texts.en:
Ismat is 55 years old and married with two daughters. His wife is a housekeeper, and the family lives in an IDP settlement because they are refugees. Ismat raises seasonal fruits and vegetables in his garden and sells them at a local bazaar. He has worked in this field for 15 years and earns 100 AZN monthly. 

Azerbaijan cuisine is various and very rich. People use vegetables to prepare such dishes as badimjhan dolmasi from eggplant, fried tomato with meat, etc. They also cook different kinds of pies, cakes and cookies from fruits (pear or apple pie, fruit cakes for birthdays, etc.).

Ismat needs to increase his income in order to support his family. Besides that, the weather where he lives is very cold. He applied for 2000 AZN in order to build a small greenhouse for his fruit trees and vegetables. This is his second loan, and he has a positive client history.

loans.use: to build a small greenhouse for his garden

loans.name: María Ester

texts.es:
María, a sus 62 años de edad, es una mujer carismática, activa y servicial. Ser madre de dos hijos, fue el principal motivo para luchar incansablemente día a día, buscando alternativas para ganarse la vida y llevar el sustento a sus hijos.
Desde hace aproximadamente 20 años, comenzó a comercializar calzado para todo tipo de clientes, de muy buena calidad y a excelentes precios, lo que le permitió darse a conocer en el sector y lograr la trayectoria que tiene. Esto la impulsa a solicitar el apoyo del crédito para fortalecer sus inventarios, pues comprará calzado al por mayor, así podrá satisfacer la demanda que aumenta en la temporada escolar, pues cuenta con la ventaja de vivir en un barrio donde hay mucha afluencia de estudiantes; esto le ayudará a mejorar los ingresos que percibe por su labor.
María manifiesta que su edad no le impide seguir haciendo lo que le apasiona, por ello siempre se propone nuevas metas y entre ellas está el de convertirse en una gran distribuidora de calzado y generar oportunidades de empleo, así podrá mejorar la calidad de vida y el bienestar tanto  de su familia, como la de aquellas personas que le ayuden a realizar su labor diaria.
texts.en:
Maria, at 62 years old, is a charismatic, active, and helpful woman. Being the mother of two children was her principal motive for fighting tirelessly day after day, looking for ways to earn a living and provide for them. Approximately 20 years ago she began selling footwear for all kinds of customers at excellent prices and good quality, which allowed her to become well-known in the area, and to attain the career that she has. This inspired her to request the support of a loan to boost her inventory, with which she will buy footwear wholesale so she can meet the demand that increases during the school year. Maria has the advantage of living in an area with an abundance of students, and this will help her increase the income she earns for her work. 

Maria says that her age does not stand in the way of continuing to do what she is passionate about, for which she is always thinking of new goals. One is to become a large distributor of footwear and be able to offer employment opportunities. That way she can improve the quality of life and well-being both of her family and the people who help her do her daily work.

loans.use: to buy footwear wholesale.

loans.name: Washington

texts.en: Washington is a 27-year-old single man. He describes himself to be visionary. He operates a welding business where he makes metallic doors, gates, chairs, and other items to sell. He has been involved in this business for five years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be power shortages, which affect his business. He will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy stocks of metal sheets, and bars for making doors, gates and other items. His business goal is to have world-class premises within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a bigger business. He also does farming, and keeps livestock to earn extra income. A previous loan of KES 30,000 was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business and create job opportunities.

loans.use: to buy stocks of metal sheets and bars.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more oil, flour, sugar, charcoal, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, pepper, corn, cassava, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts, percussion drills and compressed-air guns to install windows and cabins.

loans.name: Yoeurm

texts.en:
Yoeurm, aged 43, is married and has six adult children. She realizes that it’s quite a big family and a lot of necessities need to be supplied for the household. That’s why she always gives her best to her farming work, in order to meet the family’s daily needs. Yoeurm has been farming for more than 20 years, and it is her main source of her income.  

Yoeurm has been an honest client with a good credit history. She obtained four loans from Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) and repaid her loans successfully. She is asking for a new loan of USD700 to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of her family members as she doesn't have a proper one. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by HKL, Yoeurm is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of her family members.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more toothpaste, soap, salt, oil, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Ashurbiby

texts.en:
Ashurbiby was born in 1960. She is widow. Her husband died four years ago, and she lives with her mother and sister. 

Ashurbiby has worked for more than four years in a hospital as a cleaning woman. She has a small salary, so that’s why she began her business of selling clothes some years ago. 

She is a repeat client of IMON and has a good credit history. She is going to repair her house, and with this aim, she is asking for a loan of 2,000 Somoni to buy building materials such as cement, wood, etc. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement, wood, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her son’s tuition fees.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 41 years old and from Nyahururu. He is married to Susan, and they are blessed with six children, aged 12, 10, 8, 6 and 4 years old, and a 10-month-old baby.

Paul is a carpenter, a business he has been running for the last 14 years. To enable him to buy timber and other carpentry materials, he has applied for his first loan of KES 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya.

His monthly income right now is KES 10,000, and his intention is to use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to educate his children and to pay back his loan to VisionFund Kenya.

In the future, he hopes to buy a plot and construct some rental houses.

loans.use: to buy timber and other materials used in carpentry.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 40-year-old electrical hardware dealer in Mariakani, Kenya. She is a married mother of three whose husband provides additional income. She has been in the business for the last seven years.

This marks Lucy's first borrowing from Vision Fund Kenya to finance her business. She will use the loan to purchase electric cables, screws, binding tapes and power bulbs to sell.

She plans to use the anticipated profit to expand her business further. She hopes to own an expanded business and have a financially stable family.

loans.use: to purchase electric cables, screws, binding tapes and power bulbs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, rice, biscuits, candy, sardines, etc. to expand her business.

loans.name: Gloria Belén

texts.es:
Ella es gloria belén, se está preparando para desempeñarse como auxiliar en servicios farmacéuticos, todos los días asiste a las clases con la ilusión de adquirir nuevos conocimientos y afianzar los ya obtenidos. Quiere trabajar para ayudar a la familia y en el campo laboral  colaborar a las personas a satisfacer las necesidades en la farmacia, brindándole en el servicio al cliente, una excelente atención basada en la ética, suministrándole la información completa y así ayudar con el esfuerzo y dedicación a que las personas, para que se sientan mejor y quieran seguir el tratamiento y también conozca la prevención para mejorar la salud y lograr un mundo más comprensivo y humano.  
Escogió esta carrera de servicios farmacéuticos porque le apasiona conocer sobre los medicamentos y el uso adecuado, compartirle a los demás los conocimientos y ayudar a mejorar la salud y calidad de vida. 
Quiere formar la propia empresa y así generar más empleo, pero en este momento no cuenta con los recursos necesarios  para sacar adelante los proyectos, por eso acude al subsidio del convenio kiva  ya que gracias a dicha ayuda podrá cumplir las metas, ella agradece la ayuda y que puedan seguir mejorando la vida de muchas más familias.
texts.en:
This is Gloria Belén.  She is preparing to work as an assistant in pharmaceutical services.  Every day she goes to class eager to gain new knowledge and to strengthen that which she has.  

She wants to work in order to help the family.  In the workforce she wants to collaborate with people to meet the needs in the pharmacy.  She wants to provide service to the customer.  She wants to give excellent attention to the customer based on ethically supplying the complete information.  This way she will help people with effort and dedication so that they feel better and want to continue their treatment.  Also, she will know about prevention in order to improve health and make the world more understanding and humane.

She selected this career of pharmaceutical services because she is passionate about knowing about medicine and its adequate use, sharing her knowledge with others, and helping to improve health and quality of life.

She wants to form her own company and, in this way, generate more employment.  However, at this time she does not have the resources needed to get ahead with her projects.  That is why she turns to a Kiva loan agreement.  Thanks to this help, she will be able to meet her goals.  She is grateful for the help.  May Kiva be able to continue improving the lives of many more families.

loans.use: to pay for registration for one semester.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is married with four children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (children of her late brother in law). She has a business of poultry farming and has been in this business for six months. She applied for a loan of 900000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of chicken feed and chicks.  She generates additional income from rental rooms. She works from home and sells wholesale only seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges includes transportation of bags of Irish potatoes seasonally and poultry diseases. She aspires to be a large poultry farmer and also to own a delivery van to ease the transportation of chicken feed. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more coal, soft drinks, cold water, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Sary

texts.en:
Sary, 33, is a borrower from Battambang province. She is a mother of three dependent children who are in school. The main source of her family’s income is from rice farming and maize planting. Besides this agribusiness, she also raises pigs to supplement her income.  

Now, the main challenge for her family is the lack of working capital to improve her business, specifically her cornfield. With this new loan, she is in her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan, which she has fully repaid, has helped her to generate a decent income to keep her kids in school. 

Now, she is seeking a new loan of 4,000,000 KHR in order to buy fertilizers and seeds for her corn farm. She hopes that her corn will gain a good yield, so she can make extra income in order to improve her family’s living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her corn farm.

loans.name: Matokwani

texts.en:
Matokwani is 31 years old and married with one child. He operates a mobile money transfer business in the border town of Sesheke, located in the Western province of Zambia near the Zambezi River.

This is Matokwani’s fourth loan from Kiva. He would like to take this opportunity to thank his lenders for helping him grow his business. The previous loans allowed Matokwani to serve his customers more efficiently because of an increase in his working capital. He also has been able to grow the number of outlets he currently operates from one to two. Furthermore, Matokwani has been able to purchase a laptop and internet modem with his profits to help him serve his customers much faster and manage his accounts better. 

With some of the profits from his business growth, Matokwani has been able to enroll himself to study part-time at a college institution. He also continues to pay for his niece’s school fees. He has fully repaid two of his loans and continues to do well in his business. 

Matokwani has requested another loan from Kiva in order to boost the working capital float at his second outlet. He is now offering bill payments and needs more money at his second outlet to service these additional customers. He will also use part of the money to pay for his mobile money trading booth. 

He thanks all the Kiva lenders for their continued financial support through the years which has enabled him to grow his business and better provide for his family.

loans.use: to grow his mobile money business and to service more customers in his community who need financial services.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Sokha is a local villager from Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is 41 years old and a married mother blessed with four children. Presently, only one daughter is relying on her, as she is studying in a local school in the area. 

To support her family, she grows rice as the main source of income and works for others for a fee to earn extra income. To respond to her demand to better support her crop, she joined a group of two to get a new loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Sokha is not a first-time borrower, but her joint borrower is. With a successful repayment of her past loans, Sokha was able to uplift her living condition in a timely manner. 

Now, she and her co-borrower are seeking 1,400,000 KHR and 1,000,000 KHR respectively. As a leader, she will spend her loan portion for fertilizers for her crop and use a portion of it to spend on plowing the field. 

She believes that this purchase will help her to better grow her rice with a good yield in return.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers for her crop and plowing the field.

loans.name: Khayala

texts.en:
Khayala is 29 years old and married with a son. She and other members of her family are refugees, and they live in an IDP settlement. Her husband is a laborer and gets additional earnings for their family. The main source of income for her family is gardening. She grows seasonal fruits and vegetables and sells them at the local bazaar. She has gained good skills working in this field for the past nine years. Her monthly income is 140 AZN.

Local people have high demands for food, especially fresh fruit and vegetables. They visit the local bazaar every day and attend Khayala’s green grocery every morning. They know that Khayala doesn't use pesticides for growing her fruits and vegetables. 

Khayala’s family settled in an IDP settlement recently, and they need to build their house. Unfortunately, her monthly income isn't enough to do this. She applied for 2,000 AZN in order to buy new fertilizer for her garden and increase her income as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizer for her garden.

loans.name: Thon's Group

texts.en:
Thon is a farmer from Cherng Prey district of Kampong Cham province where she lives and her paddy rice is grown. She is 47 years old and a mother of three children. Two children are in school. 

Thon has been in her current business since she was 20 years old. Besides helping with the rice farming, her husband also works as a house builder to help her supplement her income. 

This is the second loan for Thon with VisionFund Cambodia, Kiva’s partner. She has repaid back her past loan with success and with it has improved her living conditions and provided sufficient food for her kids. For this cycle, she wants to focus on her house's condition. Therefore, she will spend her entire loan portion to renovate her house. 

Thon hopes that this loan will enable her to own a decent shelter for her kids so that she does not need to worry about her house's condition.

loans.use: to renovate her house.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a man of thirty seven years who is married to Esther and is a father of three children. He is a dairy farmer and a crop farmer, and he has been in this business for thirteen years. He earns a monthly income of six thousand one hundred shillings.

This will be Julius' third loan with VisionFund Kenya, and he plans to use the entire loan to buy a dairy cow. In the future, he wants to expand his business and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Chroeun

texts.en:
Chroeun is 32 years old, married, and is a loving father of two children who are attending school. He farms in the Bakan district of Pursat where he grows rice both for sustenance and to sell. He also works as a paid laborer in addition to his farming activities to earn additional income for his family.

This is his seventh loan with Hattha Kaksekar Limited. He has a good history and has never made any late payments before. He is taking out this loan to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of his family members. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by HKL, Chroeun is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of his family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of his family members.

loans.name: Sokhan's Group

texts.en:
Sokhan is a resident from Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. She is a widowed mother of four children. Currently, two of her kids still depend on her as one child is in school and one is too young for schooling. Her entire family relies solely on rice farming and a grocery selling business. 

Sokhan has been involved in the current business for more than 10 years, and now she is able to earn up to 30,800 KHR per day.

She has never been with VisionFund Cambodia, Kiva’s partner, before. Sokhan currently leads a group of three to obtain a new loan. All of her co-borrowers are second-time borrowers with VisionFund. The total loan amount for her entire group is 2,100,000 KHR. Sokhan's loan portion will be 500,000 KHR. 

As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes her farmland will produce a better yield so she is able to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Voeut

texts.en:
Voeut is 50 years old and works as a teacher for a local public school in Bakan district, Pursat province. He is able to earn a decent salary to support his living expenses. He has been teaching for over 30 years. Voeut is married and has three children, all single and working in various careers. 

This is his eighth loan cycle with Hattha Kaksekar Limited. He has a good history and has never made any late payments. After paying off his prior loans, he has applied for a new loan to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of his family members. 

Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by HKL, Voeut is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of his family, and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra is a 32 year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She looks after her family at home as she is a good housewife. Her husband provides services in painting work to buildings and shops.  In this regard, her husband was in need of some painting-related items such as paints of different colors, brushes, distempers, etc. for increasing his work.  So Bushra made contact with Brac Pakistan for a loan. Brac Pakistan issued her loan.
 Bushra is very thankful to Kiva and field partner Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy paints, brushes, distempers etc.

loans.name: Sinat's Group

texts.en:
Sinat is a borrower from Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. She is 35 years old and a mother of a schoolchild. 

She struggles for her daily cost of living. Sinat works for others for a fee and has a vegetable growing business. For several years, she has been involved in her current business. She is able to earn up to 16,600 KHR per day. 

This new loan becomes the third loan for her. She has fully repaid back her past loan, and it has helped her to support her living expenses. She was able to purchase a decent household appliance for her family. 

Now, she joints a group of two to get a new loan with VisionFund Cambodia, Kiva’s partner. She is seeking 400,000 KHR while her co-borrower would receive 100,000 KHR. Sinat, who is the group leader, will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her vegetable garden. 

She hopes to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her vegetable garden.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La socia Silvia se sigue dedicando al negocio de confeccion de muñecas de tela,ella vende en forma ambulatoria en las diferentes calles de la ciudad,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las muñecas.La socia solicita el credito para comprar telas e hilos de colores.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Silvia still has the same business making rag dolls. She sells in the various streets of the city. She works from 8 am to 6 pm. She has had this business for several years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to have a storefront where she can sell her dolls. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of fabric and coloured thread.
She is happy to have this loan and promises to repay her quotas.

loans.use: to buy fabric and coloured thread.

loans.name: Malahat

texts.en:
Malahat is 43 years old.  She is married and has two daughters. The family is IDP and lives in IDP settlement. Her husband is a laborer.  She is a gardener and raises fruit trees (figs and quince) and has sold fruits at  the local bazaar for 15 years. Her monthly income is 150AZN. 

Azerbaijan people know that figs and quince are very useful for health. They like to eat these fruits fresh and use them to prepare quince or figs jam or pie.  People drink quince with hot milk when they catch a cold, and recover after this drinking. 

Malahat’s fruit assortment for selling isn’t wide enough and that’s why her income doesn’t increase. She applied for a 2000AZN loan in order to buy new fruit tree seeds and make an assortment of her greengrocery at the bazaar wider.  She hopes that one day she will be able to recover her previous happy life.

loans.use: to buy new fruit tree seeds and make her assortment of greengrocery wider

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
La socia Felicitas sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “Mujeres Unidas”, la socia continua dedicándose a su negocio de venta de fruta, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia vende platanos, manzanas entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
   La socia Felicitas en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar naranjas, papayas entre otros. La socia Felicitas está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Felicitas continues to belong to the “Mujeres Unidas” communal bank. She still has her fruit business. She has had this business for some time now, and it satisfies her personally and economically. She sells bananas, oranges, and other items. She wants to be able to continue working in order to continue to support her family. 
Felicitas needs this loan for the purchase of oranges, papayas, and other items. She is happy to have this loan and promises to repay her quotas.

loans.use: to buy oranges, papayas, and other items.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia Victoria sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “Mujeres Unidas”, la socia continua con su negocio de kiosco escolar donde vende todo tipo de golosinas como chizitos, galletas, dulces, chicles, chupetines entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
