La socia Victoria en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar galletas, chocolates entre otros.
La socia Victoria está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Victoria continues to be a member of the Community Bank "Mujeres Unidas" (United Women), she still has the school kiosk where she sells all types of snacks such as cheese puffs, cookies, candies, gum, lollipops, and other items. She has had this business for a while and does well because of the effort she gives each day to her business, she wants to continue working to be able to support her family.
She is taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy cookies, chocolates and other items.  Victoria is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her loan repayments.

loans.use: to buy cookies, chocolates and other items.

loans.name: Liliana Del Socorro

texts.es:
Liliana es una mujer emprendedora y activa de 26 años de edad, vive con su pequeño hijo de 3 años y su esposo; quienes son su mayor motivación para luchar cada día.
Durante su vida productiva, ha trabajado como vendedora en diferentes panaderías y tiendas, así obtuvo la experiencia necesaria para motivarse a iniciar su propia tienda de abarrotes que está ubicada en un local familiar; pero requiere comprar surtido al por mayor (mecato, granos, galletería, chocolate, entre otros), así podrá continuar con su nuevo proyecto productivo, con el que generará mejores ingresos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar y para ofrecer una educación de buena calidad a su hijo.
Liliana es una mujer joven, activa y con un espíritu de superación que la impulsa para luchar por sus sueños, es por ello que trabaja arduamente para que, en un futuro a mediano plazo, pueda adquirir una casa propia y disfrutar en ella de una mejor calidad de vida en compañía de sus seres amados.
texts.en:
Liliana is an active and entrepreneurial 26-year-old woman who lives with her small 3-year-old son and her husband, who are her biggest motivation to work hard every day. During her working years she has worked as a salesperson in different bakeries and stores, which is how she gained the experience necessary to motivate herself to start her own grocery store in a family home. It needs to be stocked with wholesale items (snacks, grains, pastries, chocolate, among others) so she can continue with her new business endeavor that will generate more income to help her husband with the household expenses, and to offer a high quality education to her son.

Liliana is a young, active woman with the spirit to succeed and the inspiration to fight for her dreams; that is why she works arduously so that, in the near future, she can buy her own home in which to enjoy a better quality of life in the company of her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies (snacks, grains, pastries, chocolate, among others).

loans.name: Magdalena De Jesús

texts.es:
Magdalena, a sus 39 años de edad, es casada y madre de 4 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con mucho amor y empeño.
Actualmente se dedica a trabajar como comerciante independiente, vendiendo mercancía de todo tipo, la idea surgió mientras le colaboraba a una amiga a realizar esta labor y, con el ánimo de apoyar a su esposo a solventar los gastos del hogar, decidió iniciar como independiente desde hace aproximadamente un año. Sus principales clientes son vecinos, familiares y amigos del municipio donde reside; adicionalmente y, de manera alterna, complementa sus ingresos trabajando por días en casas de familia como empleada doméstica; esto le ha permitido mejorar las finanzas en el hogar.
El crédito que solicita lo destinará para comprar mercancía al por mayor (lociones, cremas corporales y ropa para mujer, hombre y niños), así tendrá más variedad de artículos disponibles para ofrecer a sus clientes y satisfacer los diversos gustos y requerimientos, logrando mejorar las ventas e ingresos.
Magdalena manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es montar un almacén en su casa, en el que pueda prestar un mejor servicio a su clientela y lograr una mayor rentabilidad, que le garantice una estabilidad económica para dar una mejor educación a sus hijos y disfrutar junto a su familia, de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Magdalena, age 39, is married with 4 children, whom she has raised with a lot of love and effort. 

She is an independent retailer, selling merchandise of every kind. The idea came to her while she was doing this work with her friend; and about a year ago she decided to begin working independently, with the goal of helping her husband pay for household expenses. 

Her main customers are neighbors, relatives, and friends in the municipality where she lives. She also supplements her income by working during the day as a housekeeper in the homes of relatives, and this has allowed her to improve the household finances.

The loan that she is seeking will be used for the purchase of wholesale merchandise such as lotions, body creams, and clothing for women, men, and children. Thus she will have a greater variety of items available to offer to her customers and satisfy diverse needs and tastes; and she will be able to improve sales and income.

Magdalena declares that her biggest desire is to set up a store in her house, where she could provide better service to her customers and achieve increased profitability, in order to give a better education to her children, and have a better quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase lotions, body creams, and clothing for the business she started

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover tuition fees for her son

loans.name: Farhat

texts.en: Farhat is a 32-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is housewife and looks after her family, which consists of seven persons.  Her husband is a car repair mechanic by profession. He has been running a vehicle repair shop for the last three years in the market.  He is good car repair mechanic.  For the past many days, he has needed some spare parts for his shop to provide repair services. So, Farhat made contact with Kiva partner, BRAC Pakistan for a loan.  This will help her to continue her husband's business of car repairing. Farhat is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband buy spare parts for his car repair shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more spaghetti, eggs, and Otis.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan.  She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a 24-year-old and a mother of four children.  Her husband has been working as a wood carpenter for fifteen years.  He is responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. 

Saima's husband wants to buy  pieces of wood and other tools for his business, but due to insufficient financial means he cannot afford to buy this merchandise. Therefore, Saima has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan her husband can purchase the relevant items needed for his business and earn a profitable income to meet the daily needs of his family and business.

Saima is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy pieces of wood and other tools for her husband's furniture business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new tools and spare parts for his auto repair workshop

loans.name: Olian

texts.en:
Olian  is a 35 year-old married man from Gaza city. He lives with his wife and three kids in a small simple house. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. Olian has a problem in his leg and he needs to do a surgery urgently
Olian took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the hospital expenses for doing an urgent surgery for his leg. by taking this loan, Olian will be able to go back to work. 
Olian appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay the hospital expenses for doing an urgent surgery for his leg.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 31 year-old married man from Deir al Balah city. He lives with his wife in a small simple house. For the past four years, Hussein has been working in his services center where he does some formal applications and forms. Hussein would like to improve his business. 
Hussein took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new furniture for his services office. By taking this loan, Hussein will be able to improve the office conditions to attract more clients. 
Hussein appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy new furniture for his services office

loans.name: Khosiyat

texts.en:
Khosiyat is widow and is raising a son. She is very sociable woman.

She has had her own business for 12 years. She cooks and sells biscuits and sambusa. Khosiyat sells her product in a local market at her own booth.

Khosiyat began her business selling industrial goods. Then, she changed her business. Now, her business is going well. She is going to increase working capital and maximize profit. 

Khosiyat is asking for a loan of 8,000 TJS to buy flour and butter for cooking more biscuits and sambusa. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy flour and butter for producing biscuits and sambusa

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
La socia Maria Mercedes se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,la socia vende arroz,azucar,leche y aceite,la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.

La socia se siente agradecida con el prestamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir sus cuotas en la plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Maria Mercedes continues to run her grocery store. She sells rice, sugar, milk, and oil. She works from 7 am to 8 pm. She has had this business for several years and it is going very well. Her dream is to expand her grocery store. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of milk, sugar, oil and rice.
She is grateful for this loan and promises to repay her quotas on time.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, oil and rice.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en: Madina is 28 years old. She is divorced and has no children. She works in an organization. Madina has worked here more than ten years. She is a good worker. Madina uses her salary for buying food products. She wants to repair her house as her house is in bad condition. She is going to repair the living room, kitchen and bathroom. She is asking for a loan of 1500 somoni to buy building materials such as cement, wood, etc. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement, wood, etc.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
La socia Nieves continúa con su negocio de venta comida, la socia vende en su restaurante ricos potajes como arroz con pollo, saltado, entre otros, la socia desea seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia. 
En esta oportunidad Nieves requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como sacos de arroz, aceite entre otros.
  La socia Nieves agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en: The communal bank member Nieves continues to run her business selling food; in her restaurant she makes delicious stews like chicken with rice, sirloin, and others. She wishes to continue working in this way to support her family. At this time Nieves requests the loan to buy supplies like sacks of rice, oil, among others.Nieves appreciates the support offered to her, and also promises to be disciplined with her payments.

loans.use: to buy supplies like sacks of rice, and oil, among others.

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia Maria Elizabeth se sigue dedicando al negocio de venat de comida,la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollos al horno,bocaditos entre otros platos,la socia trabaja llevando a diferentes lugares como empresas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant.La socia solicita el credito para comprar verduras,carne y pollo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Maria Elizabeth continues to work in her business of food sales, she makes different dishes such as roasted chicken, appetizers and other dishes, she sells the food in different places such as work centers, she starts working at 8:00 A.M. and ends at 6:00 P.M., she's been in this business for 5 years and does very well, her dream is to have a restaurant.  She needs the loan to buy vegetables, meat and chicken.

The member is happy with the loan and commits to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat and chicken.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin tiene 57 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en su propia casa del distrito de La Matanza, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino, su esposa prepara chicha de jora que lo ofrece en su domicilio, cuenta con cliente considerable por la venta de esta bebida que es típica de la zona norte del país, Martin ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de ventanas y colocar el falso piso de su vivienda, dado que en los próximos meses es temporada de lluvias y de esta manera poder protegerse de esta época.
texts.en:
Martin is 57 years old and lives with his wife in their own home in the District of La Matanza. His town is known for agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding. This area is located in Morropon Province, which is part of the region of Piura on the northern coast of Peru.

Martin raises sheep. His wife prepares “chicha de jora” (a beverage made from corn). She sells this product from their home since she has a considerable clientele for selling this beverage since it is traditional in the northern area.

Martin is requesting a loan of 3,000 PEN so that he can buy windows and install a subfloor in his home. The rainy season will be coming in the next few months, so these improvements will provide protection during this time.

loans.use: to renovate his home by purchasing windows and installing a subfloor.

loans.name: Johanny

texts.es:
Ella es Johanny, tiene 26 años nació el 3 de abril, se trasladó a la ciudad de Bogotá hace cuatro años para buscar otras posibilidades y buenas oportunidades para el futuro.

Es una joven emprendedora y con muchos valores, la cual quiere lograr muchos sueños para así tener otras opciones de vida tanto para ella como la familia, teniendo como resultado mejores ingresos económicos.

Decidió estudiar Cosmetología y Estética porque le gusta todo lo relacionado con la belleza ya que es una de las formas de consentirse y de ayudar a otras personas que así lo desean, como también es una de las carreras que le daría una forma de trabajar como independiente  teniendo un buen desempeño y además de la labor a realizar es otra entrada económica.

Necesita el convenio porque es de gran ayuda para terminar de estudiar lo que tanto ha deseado ser una excelente cosmetóloga y esteticista, ya que esta carrera es de bastantes gastos y cree que con la ayuda de Dios y con el apoyo que le está dando kiva será posible cumplir parte de los sueños.  
 
A futuro se ve con una especialización en Fisioterapeuta o Maquillaje profesional ya que son las dos ramas que más le llaman la atención, como también ser una administradora del propio negocio, brindando así lo obtenido a la sociedad que tanto lo necesita.
texts.en:
This is Johanny. She is 26 and was born on April 3rd. She moved to the city of Bogota four years ago in order to look for other possibilities and good future opportunities.
She is a young entrepreneur with many values. She wants to achieve many dreams in order to have more options in life for herself and her family. As a result, she will make a better income.
She decided to study aesthetics and cosmetics because she likes everything to do with beauty, because it's a great way to spoil people and to help people. This is also a career that will allow her to work independently and have good performance. 
She needs this loan because it will be a great help to her in finishing school. She so wants to be an excellent cosmetician and aesthetician. This career is very lucrative and she thinks that with God's help and the support of Kiva it will be possible for her to achieve part of her dreams.
In the future she sees herself specializing in physical therapy or professional makeup, because these are the two branches that most catch her interest. She would also like to run her own business, and to use it to provide her society with what it so greatly needs.

loans.use: to pay for one semester's tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more oil, meat, flour, pepper, etc. for the business.

loans.name: Mery's Group

texts.en:
Mery is a 32-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of two sons. She properly maintains her household. 

Mery has been running a beauty salon for the last few years. She is a good and trained beautician. Due to her efficient and good work, her number of clients increases day-by-day. So, she requires more beauty salon-related items such as facial creams, combs, furniture, dressing chairs, and mirrors.

Mery made contact with Kiva field partner, BRAC Pakistan. BRAC staff visited her business and issued a loan. She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy beauty salon tems such as facial creams, dressing chairs, and mirrors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Nifreda

texts.en: Nifreda is a married woman who has six children. She describes herself to be visionary. She operates a retail business where she sells bricks for building houses. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the low season. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to hire laborers for making the bricks for sell. Her business goal is to be the best within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to a higher level. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to hire laborers for making the bricks

loans.name: Kosar

texts.en: Kosar is a 35-year-old married woman who has been running a business selling milk with her husband for many years. She has one cow and two buffaloes which she uses for milk, selling to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. Kosar has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently, she is in her 6th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 45,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow.  Kosar is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice for her business.

loans.name: Khurasheed

texts.en:
Ms. Khurasheed is a 29-year-old married woman who has run a business of milk selling with her husband for the past many years. She sells their milk to many of their neighbors, along with butter and cheese that they make from the milk.  She looks after the cattle and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her husband sells it to different places on a daily basis. They are happily doing it together to support their family.

She has three children. She needs to earn much more to meet her everyday expenditures that includes food, clothing and education. In order to earn huge profits, they requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy one more cattle to cater to more customers. They hope to have an increase in their production capacity, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy one more cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, cold water, and candy for her business.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is a 42-year-old woman who resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four children. Her husband is an electrician and he has been running his electric store for the past 30 years.  He is responsible for feeding his entire family and fulfilling their needs.

Musarat's husband has to purchase electric merchandise, e.g. wires, tube lights, plug shoes and other electric devices, but due to insufficient financial means he cannot afford to purchase these items for his business.

Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase this merchandise for his business needs. This loan will also enable her husband to increase the size of his business and earn a maximum profit.

Musarat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy electric merchandise for her husband's business.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is a single mother of four children, and two of her children go to school.  She takes care of additional family members (sister and brother). She has a business of a pub and has been in this business for ten years. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 of Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more crates of beer, soda, whiskey, spirits and jerrycans of local gin.  She works in the shop seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and credit sales of people who end up not paying their debts. She is aspiring to own a fully stocked pub and also to start selling at wholesale only. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.  .

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer, soda, whiskey. spirits and a jerrycan of local gin.

loans.name: Nelly Florencia

texts.es:
La socia Nelly Florencia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de vinos y piscos,la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hsta las 8:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los vinos y piscos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar vinos y piscos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The bank member Nelly Florencia continues running her business selling wine and pisco. She works from 7:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m.; she has been in this business for many years and it has gone very well. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell wine and pisco. She requests the loan to buy wine and pisco.

loans.use: to buy wine and pisco.

loans.name: Bendia Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BENDIA ont en moyenne  44 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à KONDALA/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits alimentaires, des condiments et de poisson.                                                                                            Les femmes du groupe BENDIA sont à leur 1er prêt solidaire. ADAMA, 2ème femme assise à droite  sur la photo   compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 200Kg de mil. Elle s’approvisionne sur place et dans les villages environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Bendia group are on average 44 years old, and have an average of four children. They all live in traditional extended families in Kondala/ Segou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

These women met through bonds of kinship, and neighborhood ties. Their activity is the purchase and sale of foodstuff, condiments, and fish. The women of the Bendia group are on their first group loan. 

Adama, the second woman seated on the right of the photo, is planning on using her loan to buy 200 kg of millet. She gets her supplies locally and in the surrounding villages. She makes her sales locally to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash and often on credit. 

She is planning on making an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover expenses related to healthcare, food, clothing and education. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy millet

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice and oil to attract her customers.

loans.name: Seema

texts.en: Seema is a 41-year-old married woman. She has one cow, which she uses for milk, selling to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. Seema has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently, she is in her 9th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 45,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. Seema is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DANAYA ont en moyenne  39 ans, 6 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à LAFIABOUGOU  dans La ville de  SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des condiments et des produits divers.  Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leur  2ème  prêt solidaire. BINTOU 1 ère femme de la  gauche vers la droite sur la photo,  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter  250Kg de sel de cuisine, 200Kg d’oignon et 15 douzaines de paquet de cube Maggi. Elle s’approvisionne sur place. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  28.500FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, à l’habillement, au logement  et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Danaya group are on their second group loan. 

Bintou, the first woman from left to right on the photo, intends to use her loan to buy 250 kg of table salt, 200kg of onions and 15 dozens of packets of Maggi cube. She gets her supplies locally. She makes her sales, to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash and often on credit. 
She is planning on making an average monthly profit of 28,500 francs CFA that will be used to cover expenses related to healthcare, food, clothing and housing. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu is a 35 year-old fish monger in Mariakani, Kenya.  She is a married mother of three whose spouse provides her with additional income. She has been in this business for the last fifteen years with a great income.

This marks her fifth borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business, after repaying her loans successfully. She will use the money to purchase sacks of small dried fish for her stock, and the anticipated profit will be used to pay her loan and improve her family's living standards.  She hopes to own a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks small dried fish

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en: Hamida is married with six children and only one of her children goes to school. She has a business selling roasted maize and green bananas. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas and bags of fresh maize to roast.  She has been in this business for 10 years and works at the market six days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She is aspiring to buy a plot of land to start growing maize and to build her own house. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of the low interest charged.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity

loans.use: To buy more green bananas and fresh maize

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a lady who is 31-years-old.  She is married to Benson and is a mother to three lovely children.  She owns a food kiosk in Makina in the outskirts of Kangemi.  She has been in this business for seven years now and earns a monthly income of six thousand shillings.

This will be Rose's first loan with VisionFund Kenya.  She plans to use the entire loan to buy equipment for making chips and a sack of potatoes. She wants to be a successful business lady.

loans.use: to buy equipment for making chips and a sack of potatoes

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en: Shehnaz, age 50, deals in a business of animal sales. She buys baby goats and calves at low prices, brings them up and sells them out near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation.  Currently, she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase two more goats. She is in her seventh loan cycle with a good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en: Najma is a 41 year-old, married woman and the mother of four children. The man shown in the photo is Najma’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, she has applied for a loan of Rs 50,000, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Yoni

texts.es:
La socia Yony se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de muebles y tambien sigue vendiendo ropa como blusas y polos,la socia vende los muebles desde las 8:00 a.m hasta als 5:00 p.m,la socia por medio de estos negocios quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de muebles y tener una tienda donde pueda vender la ropa.La socia solicita el credito para comprar polos y blusas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Yoni continues working at her furniture sales business, and she also continues to sell clothing such as blouses and polo shirts. She sells furniture from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m., and she hopes to make progress by means of these businesses. 

Her dream is to expand her furniture business and to have a store where she could sell the clothing. She is seeking a loan in order to purchase polo shirts and blouses.  She is happy for the loan, and she is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to purchase polo shirts and blouses.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is a single mother of three children, two of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.  She has a business selling used clothes. She has applied for a loan of 1,200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She has been in this business for 20 years selling to all categories of people on a retail basis and works in the market six days out of every week.   Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She generates additional income from renting rooms.  She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and to educate her children up to university.  She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en: Prisca is a 31-year-old married woman. She has two children. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a good area with lots of customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to buy stock. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy stock of fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to expand within five years.

loans.use: to buy stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Hayk

texts.en:
Hayk is young cook from Gyumri town where he lives with his mother and two brothers. Hayk is 23-years-old young man and works at a local hotel as a cook. He also receives orders for special events (weddings, birthday parties) and provides culinary service there. Hayk is a skilled and talented young man who gathers enough income and sustains his family's living as an elder son. 
Hayk applied for this loan to be able to purchase tools and materials needed for his work. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Hayk and he hopes for lenders' support and goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials for providing culinary service

loans.name: Synthia

texts.en: Synthia is a 28-year-old married woman who has five children. She describes herself to be polite. She operates a retail business where she sells cosmetics. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are both men and women. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cosmetics. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more plates, spoons, bowls, pans, tubs, etc. to resell

loans.name: Suria

texts.en: Ms. Suria is a 53 year-old married woman. She has been running the business of rearing goats for the last eleven years. She buys animals (baby goats) at low prices, raises them, and then her husband sells them out in the market. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She needs to improve her business to bear her share of household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 50,000 to purchase animals (baby goats). She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: To purchase animals (baby goats)

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en: Zubaida, age 31, deals in the business of animal sales. She buys animals such as baby goats & calves at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She needs to improve her business to bear her share of household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase two more calves. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Ulugbek

texts.ru:
Улугбек, мужчина в возрасте  39 лет. Он родился  и по сей день живет в  сельской местности Дж. Расуловского района.  Он женат, имеет двоих детей.  Улугбек в молодости не учился так как у них в семье были трудности по финансовой части, поэтому он с самого детство помогал отцу выращивать скот. Жена у него домохозяйка и занимается воспитанием детей но и в свободное время помогает мужу. 

Улугбек занимается разведением скота. Кроме этого он дополнительно подрабатывает плотником в частных стройках. Так как он сам не учился и по жизни ему очень трудно приходится без образования он очень хочет чтобы его дети учились и в будущем работали на достойных работах. Для этого Улугбек работает день и ночь. Недавно его друг который работает в Российской Федерации сообщил что там нужны плотники и позвал его туда.  Теперь Улугбек планирует уехать в РТ на заработки. Так как на руках у него нету достаточно денежных средств он подал заявку на кредит,чтобы купить авиабилет. 
Он очень надеется,что там он сможет заработать больше денег и отправлять своей жене.   Улугбек заранее благодарит Кива за поддержку в трудную минуту.
texts.en:
Ulugbek is a 39-year old man. He was born in a rural area in the J. Rasulov region, where he still lives. He is married and has two children. In his younger years, Ulugbek was not able to study because his family had financial difficulties. This is why he used to help his father raise livestock from childhood on. His wife is a homemaker and dedicates herself to raising their children, but when she has time she also helps Ulugbek.

Ulugbek raises livestock. In addition, he earns extra money by working as a carpeting contractor at private building sites. Since he did not study himself and faced many hardships in his life due to lack of education, he would really like his children to study and   obtain decent jobs in the future. Ulugbek works night and day to achieve this goal. Recently, a friend of his who works in the Russian Federation told him that there is a need for carpenters there, and encourage Ulugbek to come. Now Ulugbek plans to go to Russia as a migrant worker. Since he lacks the necessary cash, he has applied for a loan in order to buy an airline ticket. He very much hopes to be able to increase his earnings and send money to his wife. Ulugbek thanks Kiva in advance for supporting him  during a difficult time.

loans.use: to buy an airline ticket.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 38 years old, married to Beth and a father of three children. He farms crops and raises dairy cows. He has been in this business for 14 years and earns a monthly income of 8,700 shillings.

This will be Charles' second loan with VisionFund Kenya. He plans to use the entire loan to buy manure and seedlings. He wants to educate his children in the future and expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase manure and seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more biscuits and candy to sell

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en: Kousar is a 32-year-old married woman who has been running a business selling animals with her husband for many years. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them in the market for a higher price. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family's income. She needs to improve her business to pay her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs 45,000 to purchase two more goats. She is positive about her future earnings and will spend part of her income to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add more float to her M-pesa money-transfer business

loans.name: Dembe Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DEMBE ont en moyenne  36 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à KONDALA/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits alimentaires.                                                                                            Les femmes du groupe DEMBE sont à leur 1er prêt solidaire. FOUNE, 2ème femme debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 100Kg de mil et 80Kg de fonio. Elle s’approvisionne sur place et dans les villages environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
NB/ Mamou  est absente de la photo pour raison de maladie.
texts.en:
The women of the Dembe group are on average 36 years old and have an average of five children. They all live in traditional extended families in Kondala/ Segou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

These women met through bonds of kinship, neighborhood ties and their business is the purchase and sale of foodstuff.
The women of the Dembe group are on their first solidarity loan. Foune, second woman standing up from left to right on the photo, intends to use her loan to buy 100 kg of millet and 80 kg of fonio. She gets her supplies locally and in the surrounding villages. She makes her sales locally to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash and often on credit. 

She is planning on making an average monthly profit of 10,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover expenses related to healthcare, food, clothing and education. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

NB: Mamou is absent from the photo because of illness.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Ms. Razia is a 33-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. The man shown in the photo is Razia's husband--they both work together to grind flour for the community. They started this business many years ago. Now they have a good clientele in the area. They are known for providing high quality flour and earn enough to support the needs of their family. In order to purchase wheat Razia contacted the Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of Rs. 50,000. This loan will help them to serve more customers which ultimately will help in generating more cash. Razia wishes to spend part of the improving the lives of her family members.

loans.use: To purchase wheat.

loans.name: Naik

texts.en:
Ms Naik is 45 years old, a married woman and mother of five children. The man shown in the photo is Naik's husband who is a driver by profession, providing transportation services with his three-wheeled rickshaw. 

He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to pay the family's expenses. The rickshaw now requires proper maintenance to keep it functioning. For this reason, Naik has applied for a loan of Rs 45,000 for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and pay for maintenance for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. 

Naik is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: To buy new tires and maintain their rickshaw.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a responsible mother of a daughter and three sons. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a rickshaw for fourteen years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of entire family. Her husband needs to maintain his rickshaw because the current condition is not good as it requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means he is unable to maintain his rickshaw. Therefore Zahida has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Zahida's husband can easily afford the maintenance cost and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. She also plans to accrue savings from the profits to meet her family's needs in the future.

Zahida is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to maintain her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Ms. Naseem is a 43-year-old married woman.  She has been running a business of selling and purchasing animals for many years. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and sells them out at a good profit. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation.  Currently, she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more cattle. 

She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Sardari

texts.en: Sardari is a 41-year-old, married woman and the mother of seven. She has been running a business selling cloths for many years. She purchases a variety of cloths from the main city and then sells it to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloths in her community. Sardari requested a loan of PKR 45,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different cloths for the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different cloths for the summer season.

loans.name: Kotognogotala Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe KOTOGNOGOTALA ont en moyenne  46 ans, 7 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à LAFIABOUGOU l’un des quartiers de SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers.                                                                                            Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe KOTOGONGOTALA sont à leur 8ème prêt solidaire. FATOUMATA, 2ème femme à gauche  sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 50 robes, 30 pagnes wax et 25 foulards. Elle s’approvisionne chez les grossistes à San. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 45 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, de logement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Kotognogotala group are on average 46 years old and have an average of seven children. They all live in traditional extended families in Lafiabougou, one of the San/Segou neighborhoods (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

These women met through bonds of kinship, and their business is the purchase and sale of various items.
After having successfully repaid their previous loans, the women of the Kotognogotala group are on their 8th solidarity loan. Fatoumata, second woman on the left on the photo, intends to use her loan to buy 50 dresses, 30 pagnes Wax and 25 scarves. She gets her supplies from wholesalers in San. She makes her sales locally to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash and often on credit. 

She is planning on making an average monthly profit of 45,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover expenses related to healthcare, food, clothing, housing and education. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicándose al negocio de librería y a la vez continua trabajando como asistenta social, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio de librería gracias el empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar mercadería para su librería como cuadernos, libros entre otros.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues working in her bookstore as well as working as a social worker. She has had the bookstore for a good while due to her determination which she puts forth each day. She is a responsible and diligent person and being this way is how she gets her family ahead.

The member is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise for her bookstore such as notebooks, books among other items.

She is happy for the loan and is committed to making her monthly payments.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her bookstore such as notebooks, books among other items.

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
Roman lives in Jermuk town with his parents, wife and 1-year-old child. He has been providing water pipe welding and installation services for three years. Roman feels very responsible for earning a good income and sustaining his family's living. 

Because of hard financial conditions Roman is now unable to save money or purchase the tools and materials needed for his work. That's the reason he has applied for this loan. 

Roman has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will greatly assist this hardworking and responsible man to continue providing the service. He is sure that with new tools his work will be more effective.

loans.use: to pay for tools and equipment for providing water pipe welding and installation services.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bed linens for her business

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en:
Jameela is a 56-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. Her husband is a government servant. He is the guardian of the family and manages the entire household. One of her sons has been running his own business as a rice wholeseller for the past five years.

Jameela's son needs to buy rice bags in bulk and other commodities to resell, but due to his financial constraints he is unable to purchase these commodities. Therefore Jameela has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will assist her son to buy these commodities to resell to earn a profitable income. The profits will also help him to save to meet the needs of his family and business.

Jameela is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of rice in bulk for her son's business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy locks, nails, hinges, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Garik

texts.en:
Garik lives in Dalarik village with his wife and two little kids. Garik's wife doesn't work as she has to take care of their children. So as the only breadwinner in the family, Garik does his best to gather a high income. He breeds cattle and sells the meat and milk produced. For tackling financial hardships and enlarging the business, Garik has applied for this loan. The loan will assist him to purchase materials (desks, tools, etc.) for starting yogurt production. Taking into consideration the current market demand, Garik is sure that his start up business will have success. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 
Let's help this enthusiastic young businessman to accomplish his goals.

loans.use: to pay for materials (desks, tools, etc.) for starting yogurt production.

loans.name: Aynur

texts.en:
Aynur is 24 years old and married with two sons. She is a refugee as are all members of her family and they live in an IDP settlement.  Aynur is a gardener and has worked in this field for five years. She raises seasonal fruits (apples, pears, figs, quince, etc.) and vegetables (greens, onions, potatoes, tomatoes). Her monthly income is 180 AZN.

Azerbaijan people have a high demand for fruits and vegetables. They prepare different delicious national dishes from vegetables for everyday life and for holidays and parties.

Aynur plans to increase her income from selling vegetables. She needs money to repair her old house. She applied for a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy new garden tools and fertilizers. She wants to earn enough money to repair her old house and provide her sons a good education.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothes and slippers for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more coal, oil, clothes, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Sameena

texts.en:
Ms. Samina is a 24-year-old married woman. She has been running a private school for many years. She is very passionate about her work and enjoys helping children in their education. She is a good school administrator and manages to earn a reasonable amount of money to support her family. She has been working with Kashf for the last three years with a good repayment history. 

Ms. Samina is a loving mother of one child. She is responsible for her child's food, health and education and tries hard to provide the basic necessities through her profession. For the improvement for her business she contacted the Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 40,000 for new chairs, benches and a chalkboard. In this way she will be able to accommodate more students in her school.

loans.use: To purchase new chairs, benches and chalkboard.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a 36-year-old married woman who has been running a business selling milk with her husband for many years. She has two cows and two buffaloes, which she uses for milk. She sells to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. 

Samina has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently, she has applied for a loan of PKR 45,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. Samina is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Nazreen

texts.en: Nazreen is a 48-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has 7 years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Lesly Silvana Senyhasen

texts.es:
Lesly es una joven orureña que vive en Cochabamba desde sus 5 años de edad. Vive camino a Quillacollo, en una zona alejada del centro, junto a su mamá, abuelos, tíos y primos maternos, ellos son el apoyo y soporte de su vida.
Lesly es ingeniera química graduada en la universidad estatal, ella manifiesta que su mamá es su ejemplo de vida pues siendo madre soltera y que sólo pudo realizar cursos cortos de secretariado y repostería, con mucho esfuerzo logro sacar adelante a su familia.
Lesly desde muy joven efectua trabajos esporádicos en ventas y es gracias a estos trabajos que se mantiene y ayuda en los gastos de su hogar. 
Ella no pudo tener un trabajo estable relacionado a su carrera profesional dado a la falta de una especialización, los cursos que desea realizar tiene un alto costo para ser solventados por ella misma o su familia, por lo que solicita un crédito educativo para poder realizar el Curso de Especialista en Normas ISO, el cual complementará sus actuales conocimientos y así poder cumplir su sueño de tener un trabajo estable y que le permita mejorar la estabilidad económica de su hogar.
Lesly de antemano agradece a las personas que a través de sus recursos económicos ayudan a otros y generan nuevas oportunidades de crecimiento, así como a ella se le están otorgando ahora.
texts.en:
Lesly is a young lady from Oruro who has been living in Cochabamba since she was 5 years old. She lives on the way to Quillacollo in an area far from the city center with her mother, grandparents, aunts, uncles, and cousins; they are the help and support in her life.

Lesly is a chemical engineer graduate from the state university. She says that her mother is her role model, being a single mother who could only do short courses on secretarial studies and pastry-making with much effort she managed to get her family ahead. Since Lesly was little she had sporadic jobs in sales and it’s due to those jobs that she can help with the household expenses. She can’t have a stable job related to her profession because of a lack of a specialization. 

The courses that Lesly wants to take are very costly for her and her family to pay that is why she is requesting a loan for education. She wants to take a Specialist Course in ISO (International Organization for Standardization) Regulations which will complement her current knowledge and therefore fulfil her dream of having a stable job. This will allow her to improve her financial situation at home.

Lesly thanks the people that through their financial resources help others and generate new opportunities for growth, like they are allowing her now.

loans.use: to pay for the specialization course in ISO(International Organization for Standardization) Regulations.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en: Balqees is a 36-year-old married woman, doing business selling milk for many years. She has 5 calves and also 2 cows in milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. She is the mother of five; one of her child is also shown in the photo with her. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet day to day expenses of life.  It’s her sixth year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through support of it. Now she requested for a loan of Rs 40,000 to purchase one more cow. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Guldasta

texts.ru: Гулдаста 39-летняя замужняя женщина, воспитывающая четверых детей. Она скромная, работящая, типичная сельская женщина родом из района Восеъ. Ее муж оставив детей и жену уехал на заработки в чужие края для того чтобы обеспечивать свою большую семью. Гулдаста тоже трудится чтобы прокормить семью. На протяжении 6 лет она занимается выращиванием маленьких бычков для перепродажи. Ей помогает ее старший сын, которому 19 лет. В данный момент Гулдаста хочет увеличить поголовье скота в своем скотном дворе, так как у нее остался всего один теленок. Она действительно нуждается в данном кредите для продвижения своего бизнеса, чтобы не остаться без источника дохода.
texts.en: Guldasta is a 39-year-old married woman, raising four children. She is a modest, hard working, typical village woman from the Vose' District. Her husband moved to a different region, leaving her and their children behind, to find work and support his big family. Guldasta also works to feed the family. She has been rearing bull-calves for re-sale for six years. She is helped by her oldest son, who is 19. At the moment Guldasta wants to increase the quantity of the livestock in her yard, since she only has one calf left. She really needs the requested loan on order to keep her business going and not be left without a source of income.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Saniya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe  SANIYA ont en moyenne  30 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à KONDALA/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits alimentaires.                                                                                            Les femmes du groupe SANIYA sont à leur 1er prêt solidaire.                  TESSO  femme debout au milieu  sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 100Kg de fonio. Elle s’approvisionne sur place et dans les villages environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Saniya group have an average age of 30 years and an average of 4 children each, and all live in traditional extended families in Kondala/Segou (the fourth administrative region of Mali.) These women came to know each other as relatives and neighbors and are in the business of purchasing and selling food products.

The women of the Saniya group are on their first group loan. Tesso (the woman standing in the middle in the photo) plans to use her loan to purchase 100kg of fonio (a type of millet.) She stocks up in the area and in the surrounding villages. She makes her sales in the area to a customer base made up of both men and women for cash and often for credit. Tesso hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 15,000 francs CFA, which she will use for the daily expenses for her health, food, and clothing, and for her children's education, while the rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: Achat de fonio (a type of millet)

loans.name: Gloria Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La socia Gloria Maria Del Carmen se sigue dedicando al negocio de elaboracion de pulseras,collares y aretes,la socia vende a diferentes personas en general,la socia tambien sigue trabajando como empleada en una empresa,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender pulseras,collares y aretes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar hilos,almbres y tijeras.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Gloria Maria Del Carmen, a member, continues with her business of making bracelets, necklaces and earrings. The member sells to different people. She also continues working as an employee in a company. Her dream is to have a place to sell her bracelets, necklaces and earrings. 

The member is requesting a loan to purchase thread, wire and scissors.

She is happy for the loan and is committed to making her monthly payments.

loans.use: to purchase thread, wire and scissors.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is 51 years old and a married woman and mother of 3 children. The man shown in the photo is Razia‘s son who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for 4 years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Razia has applied for a loan of Rs 40,000, for her son. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Razia is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her son's vehicle.

loans.name: Imomali

texts.ru: Имомали пожилой житель города Куляб, ему 62 года. У него жена, трое сыновей и одна дочь. Имомали имеет высшее медицинское образование. Он в течение 15 лет работает главным врачом в больнице своего села. В данный момент он собирается параллельно начать фармацевтическую деятельность. Имомали решил открыть аптеку в селе, чтобы обеспечивать жителей медикаментами. Он видит как жителям трудно найти необходимое лекарство и чтобы приобрести лекарство они едут в город, что отнимает много времени. Для осуществления своего плана Имомали нуждается в 1800 долларов США. Эту сумму он просит в кредит. Имомали уже приобрел помещение для аптеки, на сумму кредита он собирается привезти товар оптом с города. Этот кредит очень важен для Имомали и жителей его села!
texts.en: Imomali is a 62-year-old resident of the city of Kulob in Tajikistan.  He is married and the father of three sons and one daughter.  Imomali has a medical degree, and for the past 15 years, he has been working as the main physician at a local hospital.  He is now also planning to launch a new business in the field of pharmacy.  He would like to open a pharmacy in his neighborhood, in order to provide access to medication to the local population.  He knows how difficult it is for the local residents to purchase essential medications.  They often have to go into the city, which is very time-consuming.  In order to realize his project, Imomali needs 1,800 USD and he is taking a loan in this amount.  He has already found commercial space for his pharmacy, so he will use his loan amount to buy medicines in bulk from the city and transport them into his shop.  This loan means a lot to Imomali and the residents of his neighborhood!

loans.use: to buy medicines and open a pharmacy.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Agripina, la socia continua con su negocio de venta de complementos alimenticios como batidos para el cuidado de la salud, la socia lleva buen tiempo con este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de suplementos alimenticios para su negocio.

La socia agradece a los inversionistas de kiva por el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Agripina still has her business selling nutritional supplements such as health shakes. She has had her business for a while now, and it’s going very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work every day. Agripina is a responsible, hardworking person and has therefore been able to improve her family’s situation.
She is requesting this loan so she can buy supplements for her business.

She is grateful to Kiva’s lenders for the loan they are giving her and is committed to paying it off on time.

loans.use: to buy nutritional supplements for her business.

loans.name: Elsa Teodocia

texts.es:
La socia Elsa continua dedicándose al negocio de lavandería en su domicilio, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia lava ropa, manteles entre otros para los distintos  hoteles y restaurantes qué solicitan sus servicios, a la vez continua dedicándose a brindar el servicio de enfermería de forma eventual, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para realizar el mantenimiento de su lavadora.
La socia Elsa pertenece al banco comunal “Los Andes” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Elsa continues to run her laundry business out of her home. She has had the business for a while now, and it’s going very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work every day. Elsa washes bedding, tablecloths, and other laundry for the different hotels and restaurants that request her services. She also continues to offer occasional services as a nurse. She hopes to continue working in this business so she can support her family.

At this time Elsa is requesting the loan so she can carry out maintenance on her washing machine.
Elsa belongs to the Los Andes village bank with Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco.

loans.use: to carry out maintenance on her washing machine.

loans.name: Gor

texts.en: Gor is from Lernagog village where he lives with his wife and two school age children (ages 13 and 11 years old). Gor's wife teaches at local village school and Gor himself runs a small general store. He has been running his store for 5 years and during those years was able to run it in a sustainable way ensuring appropriate life for his family. Now, Gor applied for this loan to be able to purchase supplies and refrigerator for his store. Gor received a loan from a local financial institution in the past but was not able, unfortunately, to pay it back on time. However, thanks to his recent hard work, Gor was able to ensure that he will be able to cover the monthly payments. Consequently, he has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. The loan will be a big support for this businessman and he hopes for your help.

loans.use: to pay for supplies and a refrigerator for his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more lapa (traditional West African cloth) for her business.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is a 35-year-old married woman. She has four children. She has been running business selling milk with her husband. She has one cow, which she uses for milk selling to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. 

Nusrat has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her 4th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. Nusrat is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 41-year-old married woman and the mother of six children. She has been running a business selling tea with her son who is also shown in the photo. She buys tea of various sorts from the wholesale market and then sells it to the people of her community. 

Through her business she makes enough income to contribute to the family. She is able to provide her children with good food, health and education so she needs more income to support her family well. She applied for a loan of Rs. 40,000 to buy more tea to increase her sales. She is in her fifth loan cycle with the Kashf Foundation. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend her profits on providing a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy more tea.

loans.name: Arnulfo Jose

texts.es: El señor Arnulfo, continua con sus planes de mejorar sus condiciones de vida, su esposa lo apoya incondicionalmente, sus hijas asisten al colegio, el labora para una empresa privada, a ellos se les complica bastante comprar de una sola vez los materiales que necesitan por los diferentes gastos que se le presentan, el credito lo solicita para comprar cemento, ventanas, puertas, acondiconar bien el baño, muy agradecido don Arnulfo nos dice que esta bien contento con el apoyo que Kiva y Afodenic le han brindado.
texts.en: Arnulfo continues to strive to improve his quality of life. His wife supports him unconditionally. His daughters are in secondary school. He works for a private company. They find it challenging to buy the materials they need all at once because of the cost. He is requesting this loan to buy cement, windows, and doors and to fix up his bathroom. Arnulfo is very grateful and tells us he’s quite happy with the support Kiva and Afodenic have offered him.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma  is married with 10 children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She has applied for a loan of 900000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. She generates additional income from selling piped water.  She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to educate her remaining children up to university level.  She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because she wanted to acquire more capital for her business. She resides in the family business and the family has access to electricity and now to piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en: Samina is a 20-year-old married woman. She, along with her husband, is been in business of making artificial jewelery. The business has great potential for growth and Samina is actively helping her husband as this business is the only source of income for them.  In order to meet the orders on time and boost their sales, Samina requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase raw material such as silver, gold and dozens of artificial gems and pearls. She hopes to increase her net income and wishes to spend it on providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase raw material such as silver, gold and dozens of artificial gems and pearls.

loans.name: Franciscar

texts.en: Franciscar is a 26-year-old married woman. She describes herself to be determined to work. She operates a beauty salon where she offers hair dressing services. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of qualified staff. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy salon equipment to enable her to operate smoothly. She hopes that in the future, she will own a cosmetics company. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy salon equipment.

loans.name: Gurgen

texts.en:
Gurgen lives in Khanjyan village with his wife. Near the house where the couple lives, Gurtgen owns arable land where he cultivates wheat, tomatoes, eggplant, watermelon and grows 15 apricot trees. The harvest that he gathers is sold to local wholesalers.
The income of this family comes only from this agricultural activity so it is very important for them. Gurgen has now applied for this loan to be able to purchase fertilizer, apricot seeds and also to pay for workforce for gathering harvest. The loan is very important for Gurgen and his wife as it would be very difficult for them to cover these costs with current financial conditions. 
As this is Gurgen's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history. Gurgen ensures that he will make payments on time and hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for workforce, fertilizer and apricot seeds.

loans.name: Maqsood

texts.en:
Ms Maqsood is a 45-year-old married woman. She is running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has 11 years of experience in this field. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts in the market. 

She is the mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 50,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits, soaps beverages and rice in bulk to cater the requirement of her clients. She is expecting improvement in her earnings so that she can live a decent life with her family.

loans.use: To buy packs of salts, biscuits, soaps, beverages and rice.

loans.name: Emma

texts.es: La Señora Emma sigue con la misma actividad de venta de comida, cuenta que le fue muy bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra insumos para elaboración de comida,  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como abarrotes, se siente agradecida con kiva por esta oportunidad que le brindan para mejorar su negocio y por ende su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Señora Emma continues with the same work, selling food.  She says that it is going really well for her with her previous loan, because she used it to buy supplies to make food.  

At this point, she is asking for a loan to buy supplies such as groceries.  She feels grateful to Kiva for this chance that they have given her to improve her business and therefore her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es:
La socia Fanny continua dedicándose hacer asesora jurídica y trabajando de forma independiente asesorando a clientes que solicitan sus servicios.la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma salir adelante.

 Ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar útiles de escritorio como papel, lapiceros, entre otros.

 La socia Fanny pertenece al banco comunal “Los Andes” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en: Fanny continues working as a legal advisor, working independently and advising clients who request her services. The member has been working doing this work for some time and it is going well, thanks for the effort she puts into it each day. She wishes to be able to continue working and succeed in this way. Fanny belongs to the "Los Andes" communal bank in Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco.

loans.use: To buy office supplies such as paper, pens and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks and cold water to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to improve his home

loans.name: Christopher
