texts.en: Christopher is a married man. He has 4 children ranging in age from 7 to 12 years old. He describes himself to be determined and focused. He operates a carpentry business where he makes wooden chairs, beds and other items. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a fast growing area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the lack of funds to buy more stock of carpentry materials. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy timber, nails and other materials to make the items he sells. His business goal is to have a bigger carpentry business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children. He will use the anticipated profits to buy a piece of land for his family.

loans.use: buy timber, nails  and other materials

loans.name: Maxwell

texts.en:
Maxwell lives in Malava, a small town near Kakamega County. Kakamega County is located in Western Kenya and is famous for its rain forest. Many farmers in the area grow maize, sugar cane and bananas, with maize being the primary crop. The density of the old growth trees in the Kakamega forest, and the variety of crops grown in the area, make this an excellent area for beekeeping.

Maxwell is married and has eight children. His wife is a teacher. Both he and his wife farm their land. They have been farming for 40 years now and they are currently growing sugarcane, maize, and vegetables and they raise cows and poultry. Maxwell is looking forward to beekeeping because it will provide him with honey for medicine.

This is Maxwell’s first loan with Honey Care and he intends to use the proceeds from his beehives to pay University fees for his children. Maxwell’s hope for the future is to be able to live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Ishmael

texts.en: Ishmael is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be ambitious and hardworking. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be theft. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy motorcycle spare parts to enable him operate his motorcycle smoothly. His business goal is to be prosperous within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will achieve his goals. He will use the anticipated profits to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: buy spare parts for a motorcycle.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is a single mother of four children and two of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling used shoes and has applied for loan of 900000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used shoes. She has been with this business for 14 years working six days out of every week and selling on a retail basis and moves door to door selling used clothes. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring to get a permanent business premise and also to become a wholesaler. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used shoes.

loans.name: Diana

texts.es: Diana de 34 años, habita en el municipio de Soledad, donde tiene una peluquería y un punto comercial de productos varios, como cosméticos, accesorios y otras mercancías.  Ella desde hace 4 años y en su condición de mujer separada, quedó sin recursos para sostener a sus dos pequeños, hoy en las edades de 8 y 12 años; cuando dejó de vivir con su cónyuge, su hermano la apoyó para que estudiara belleza en una academia, y ella sola con sus dos hijos, convirtió la  crianza de ellos  en su propia inspiración, con el fin de sacarlos adelante. Cuando  Diana aprendió a cortar cabello,  alisarlo, peinarlo y en general a hacer tratamientos capilares, empezó a ofrecer sus servicios entre sus mas cercanos vecinos, amigos y familiares. Poco a poco avanzó en su negocio  y hoy tiene una miscelánea de productos, que vende y que son coincidentes con su trabajo de belleza. Diariamente da apertura a su negocio desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche, definiendo un par de horas de descanso  para su alimentación.  En la actualidad está aplaneando acceder a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará tinturas capilares, cremas masajeadoras, artículos escolares etc , con el fin de incrementar sus ventas, pues cuenta con muy poco capital para reinvertir. Con ello su credikiva seria productivo, pues tendría inventarios que rotan el dinero prestado y estos es justamente el éxito de su credikiva.
texts.en:
Diana, age 34, lives in the town of Soledad, where she has a beauty salon and a retail shop selling various products such as cosmetics, accessories, and other merchandise.  For four years she has been separated; she was left without a means to support her two little ones.  Today her children are 8 and 12 years old.  

When she left her husband, her brother supported her so that she could study at a beauty academy.  Left alone with her two children, she made caring for them her main inspiration, with the goal of getting them ahead.  

When Diana learned to cut, straighten, and style hair and give hair treatments, she began to offer her services to her close neighbors, friends, and family members.  Little by little she advanced her business and today she has a variety shop with products that she sells, that works well alongside her beauty work.  She opens up her shop each day from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m., setting aside a couple of hours as a break to eat.  

She is currently planning to ask for a Kiva loan, her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy hair dyes, massage creams, school supplies, etc., with the goal of increasing her sales, because she doesn’t have much capital to reinvest.  She will be productive with her Kiva loan because she would be able to have inventory to repay the loaned money and thus make her Kiva loan successful.

loans.use: to buy hair dyes, massage creams, and school supplies.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Lunga Lunga, a small town in Kwale County. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, and borders Tanzania to the south. Inconsistent rainfalls make farming difficult, and contribute to the area's high poverty rates. Despite the unreliable rainfall, bees in the region have two excellent sources of food, from wild mangrove forest and local passion fruit plantations. Beekeeping is relatively new to the area, but many farmers are very interested in owning hives.

Margaret is married and has three children. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for sixteen years now and they are currently growing passion fruits in their farm. Margaret is excited about beekeeping as the bees will help in pollination which will increase her passion fruit production.

This is Margaret’s first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to build a water reservoir. Margaret’s hope for the future is to start an irrigation project at her farm.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Pacamache 1 Group

texts.es:
Dora (cuarta de derecha a izquierda en la  fotografía) es una señora de 36 años de edad, casada, tiene  cuatro hijos, ella vive junto a su familia en Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan, Sololá.
Ella se dedica a la producción y venta de banano, lo cual lo realiza en la comunidad donde vive; esta actividad la aprendió de sus padres, quienes se dedicaban a lo mismo desde muchos años atrás. Esta labor le genera a ella los ingresos necesarios para su sostenimiento familiar. Ella comenta que le gusta esta actividad porque es honesta y la ayuda a sentirse útil a su comunidad. Tiene más de 24 años de experiencia en esta actividad.
Ella decidió organizar un grupo con el objetivo de ayudarse mutuamente con su compañeras y asi mejorar sus niveles de vida. Utilizará el préstamo para la compra de insumos (fertilizante y pago de mano de obra) para mantenimiento de las  plantaciones de banano.
Dora sueña con incrementar la extensión de sus plantaciones de banano y asi incrementar sus ingresos para darle la preparación académica a sus hijos y prepararlos para el futuro.
texts.en:
Dora, fourth from the right in the photograph, is a lady who is 36 years old and married with four children. She lives with her family in Santa Catarina Ixtahuacán, Sololá.

She is engaged in the production and sale of bananas, which she carries out in the community where she lives. She learned this occupation from her parents, who had been engaged in it for many years. This work generates the income that she needs to support her family, and she comments that she likes this occupation because it is honest, and it helps her to feel useful to her community. She has more than 24 years’ experience in this occupation.

She decided to organize a group with her friends, with the goal of helping each other and thus improving their living standards. She will use the loan for the purchase of supplies such as fertilizer, and for the payment of workers, in order to maintain the banana plants. 

Dora dreams of increasing the area of her banana fields, and thus increasing her income, in order to provide her children with an academic preparation, and prepare them for the future.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as fertilizer and to pay workers.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita lives in Masis. Her daughter studies at Yerevan State University. Margarita has applied for the loan last year when she was asking the loan for paying back her daughter's tuition. Now, after responsibly paying the loan, she would like to ask one more loan for paying her daughter's university tuition for the second semester. Margarita is very satisfied with the cooperation with Kiva and SEF and she would greatly like to continue it.
She hopes for lenders' support once more.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's university tuition fees.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima lives in Gumbato, a small town in Kwale County. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, and is the southernmost Kenyan county. Though some of the towns along the beach see benefits from tourism, the majority of people living inland are farmers, and the region's inconsistent rains can make agricultural yields unpredictable. Beekeeping is a relatively new activity in the area, but many farmers here are enthusiastic at the prospect of owning their own hives.

Halima is single with two children. She is a farmer. She has been farming for fifteen years now and she is currently growing peas and maize in her farm. Halima is excited about beekeeping as it will earn her some income. 

This is Halima’s first loan with Honey Care and she intends to use the proceeds from her beehives to expand her cultivated land.  Halima’s hope for the future is to establish an irrigation project at her farm.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Jumanazar

texts.ru:
Чуманазар ответственный и позитивный мужчина в возрасте 39 лет. Он женат и имеет пятерых детей. Вместе со своей семьёй Чуманазар живёт в небольшом посёлке. С юных лет он помогал своему отцу, который занимался выращиванием сельхозкультуры, этим самым зарабатывая деньги на проживание. Чуманазар таким образом научился от отца этому делу и по сей день занимается своим бизнесом, чтобы иметь постоянный доход для своей семьи. 

Так как Чуманазар живёт в сельской местности бизнес выращивание сельхозкультуры более присущ для живущего там населения. Вот уже несколько лет Чуманазар занимается этим бизнесом, и это приносит ему хороший доход. Так как у него много детей, ему необходимы денежные средства, чтобы обеспечивать своих детей всем необходимым. На сегодня Чуманазар имеет небольшую площадь земли, где и выращивает свой урожай, а потом в сезон сбора продаёт его. Совсем недавно он собрал много урожая и сейчас желает заново посеять семена и удобрить землю для следующего урожая. Но все полученные денежные средства, Чуманазар потратил на потребности своей семьи. Поэтому сейчас Чуманазар обратился в Арванд и желает получить кредит на покупку семян и удобрения для земли. Он надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Jumanazar is a responsible and a positive man of 39 years.  He is married and has five children.  Together with his family, Jumanazar lives in a small town.  From a very young age, he earned money by helping his father grow crops.  Jumanazar learned a lot about the trade from his father and was able to continue his business and use it to earn for his family.  The climate in the area where he lives is conducive to growing crop, and he is able to earn a nice income.  His many kids, however, also require necessities which cost money.

Currently, Jumanazar has a small plot of land which he uses to grow crops.  Recently he collected a large harvest and now, wishes to sow for the next season.  However, he spent all of the money on providing his family with necessities. Jumanazar turned to Arvand for help.  He is asking for a loan to purchase seed and fertilizer.  He is hoping to succeed and thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Gerevasio

texts.en:
Gerevasio is an old client in UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) aged 56 years and lives Rukungiri District – Western Uganda. He is a married man with six children and two of his children attend school.
He has been a good client, he is a civil servant where he earns monthly income and he also has additional income with his dealings in pottery where he gets income to support his family as a parent.
He wants to use this loan given to him to supplement on his income through purchasing more pigs so as to increase on his earnings and pay tuition for his children.

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Furkat

texts.ru:
Фуркат жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый мужчина в возрасте  42 лет. Он  женат  и имеет четверых детей, и  живет со своей семьёй в сельской местности. Фуркат очень любит природу, поэтому привязался с юного возраста к делу, которое также любил его отец. Его отец занимался выращиванием  селхозкультуры (лук,пшеница, кукурузное зерно, помидор и другие овощи). Сам Фуркат не имеет высшего образования, и поэтому решил заняться таким же видом бизнеса, чтобы иметь постоянный доход в своей семье. 

На сегодняшний день Фуркат имеет небольшую площадь земли вблизи своего дома. На этой земле он и выращивает сельхозкультуру. Также Фуркат имеет несколько голов скота, которых также выращивает и потом продаёт. Ещё дополнительный доход он имеет от своей работы. Иногда он принимает заказы на построение дома, он является помощником мастера. И от этой работы он также имеет дополнительный доход, что очень помогает его семье. Каждый раз когда Фуркат получает доход от своего бизнеса, он тратит деньги на нужды своей семьи. Он сделал хороший ремонт в своём доме, также помогает финансово своим родителям. Сейчас Фуркат хочет закупить семена для очередного посева, но у него недостаточно денежных средств. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку семян для посева. Фуркат заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Furkat is a cheerful and a hard-working man of 42 years.  He is married and has four children.  Together with his family he lives in a small town in the countryside.  Furkat's father made a living by growing crops.  From a very young age, Furkat loved the outdoors and loved working in the field helping his father grow onions, wheat, corn, tomatoes and other vegetables.  Owing to his lack of a university education, Furkat decided to go in his father's footsteps and start growing crops himself, to be able to provide for his family.  

Currently, Furkat has a small plot of land near his house, where he grows vegetables.  Furkat also has a few heads of cattle which he raises and sells.  In addition, he makes supplementary income as a builder.  Sometimes, he works on building houses as an assistant to the foreman.  Fukrat is spending all of the money that he makes on providing for his family and financially helping his parents.  Today, Fukrat needs to buy seed for the next sowing, but he does not have enough money.  To get help, Fukrat turned to Arvand for a loan to purchase seed.  He thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy seed

loans.name: Munir

texts.en:
Munir is 40 years old. She is the mother of four children and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, and biscuits among other items. He manages his household necessities from his own store as well and his relatives like to purchase from his general store. He speaks with an impressive tone, and he easily wins the trust of others. Thanks to this, he has built up very good relations with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town and that is the reason his business is running well. Due to good relations, his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to meet the demand. Therefore, Munir requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soap, shampoo, detergents, and biscuits.
She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy general store items such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, and biscuits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fuel in bulk.

loans.name: Ninoska

texts.es:
La socia Ninoska pertenece al banco comunal LAS HIJAS DE MARIA;la socia sigue dedicándose a su negocio de venta de licores, la socia lleva años dedicándose a su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de cerveza entre otros.
La socia agradece el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Ninoska is part of the Communal Bank “Las Hijas de Maria” (The Daughters of Mary). She continues to manage her business where she sells liquor. Ninoska has been in this business for years and it has brought her both financial and personal satisfaction. She is a responsible and industrious person who helps her family move forward in this manner.

Ninoska is requesting a loan so that she can buy beer and other products. She appreciates the loan that has been provided and promises to complete her monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy beer and other products.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy is a forty-year-old, divorced female with four children who all go to school. She deals in a tailoring business and also does farming as additional income.  She works eleven hours a day and is located on a busy street.  She started the business to cater for her family and to pay school fees for her children after the divorce.  She dreams of becoming a great business woman, however, defaulters and inadequate capital are challenges being faced. Dorothy is asking for a loan to buy clothing materials to make uniforms to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothing materials to make uniforms to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in Mwapala, a small town in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast near the border of Tanzania. While beekeeping has not historically been a major activity in the region, the mangrove swamps closer to the coast and large passion fruit farms inland provide bees with robust sources of nectar. Though most farmers in the area are new to beekeeping, many are very enthusiastic about keeping bees.
Ruth is single and has three children. She is a farmer. She has been farming for 15 years now, and she is currently growing mangoes in her farm. Ruth is excited about beekeeping as it will earn her some income from the sale of honey.
This is Ruth’s first loan with Honey Care, and she intends to use the proceeds from her beehives to establish a tree plantation. Ruth’s hope for the future is to establish a commercial apiary.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Dúo Herencia Del Rey Group

texts.es: Dúo Herencia del Rey, representado por Hilda de 31 años, soltera, tiene un salón de belleza desde hace 4 años frente a su casa una amiga le alquila el local donde ella atiende, de lunes a domingos horarios varios ya que por la mañana atiende una tortillería de su mama ella la ayuda medio día, por la tarde abre su local, desea  comprar más artículos de belleza y faciales ya que solo así agrandara un poco más su negocio y de la misma forma ayudar a su familia ya que aún tiene hermanos pequeños, ella ya trabajo un primer crédito y no callo en mora.
texts.en: The “Herencia del Rey” duo includes 31 year old Hilda.  She is single and has had a beauty salon in front of her home for four years.  She rents the space from a friend and works Monday through Friday on a variable schedule because she works at her mother’s tortilla shop in the mornings.  She opens her own shop in the evenings and wants to buy beauty and facial supplies.  This is the only way she will be able to grow her business a bit and help her family at the same time because she has younger brothers.  She has had a loan before and she didn’t fall behind in her payments.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Caleb

texts.en: Caleb is a 25-year-old married man. He has two children, aged one and five. He describes himself as being a visionary. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in an urban area, and his primary customers are regular customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be theft. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy a stock of vegetables, fruits, and other groceries to enable him to open a grocery store. This will enable him to increase his income. His business goal is to be the best within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of KES 10,000 was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to buy a dairy cow for his family.

loans.use: to buy a stock of vegetables, fruits, and other groceries to enable him to open a grocery store

loans.name: Yahal Tangni Group

texts.es:
Sebastiana: Es una señora emprendedora y amistosa, líder del Banco Comunal Yahal Tagni que significa flor de chaparro (especie de arbusto cuyas hojas son utilizadas como paste para lavar trastes y pisos de madera); es madre soltera de 9 hijos (6 mujeres y 3 varones), siete son mayores de edad y 2 son adolescentes que se encuentran estudiando. Tiene 57 años de edad, dirige a diez mujeres que se organizaron con el propósito  DE buscar alternativas de financiamiento mediante crédito en Pana Pana, para poder mejorar sus negocios e ingresos, que les permitan mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus familias, para poder cubrir necesidades básicas de alimentación, educación y vivienda.

Las integrantes del Banco Comunal se dedican a la venta de repostería, panadería, venta de ropa usada.  Con el préstamo que solicitan 4 quieren invertirlo en construir hornos artesanales para hornear pan, otras para vender pescados y otras para su venta de ropa usada, bastimento y el negocio de una pequeña pulpería.


El sueño de Sebastiana es construir su vivienda de concreto, con divisiones para los cuartos, actualmente solo tiene dos habitaciones y viven 5 adultos y 7 niños en la casita de madera que desde hace 3 años no ha podido mejorarla. También, su sueño es construir en su terreno pequeños módulos  de madera para ofrecer el servicio de alquiler a precios accesibles.

Celia: es integrante del Banco comunal, tiene 64 años, es casada, tiene 3 hijos. Desde hace 9 meses se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa usada en el patio de su vivienda, comenzó su pequeño negocio con capital propio. Solicita financiamiento para comprar 2 pacas de ropa usada en Managua. Su sueño es mejorar las condiciones donde ofrece sus productos, actualmente no dispone de un lugar cómodo, ocupa el patio de su casa para ofertar la ropa que vende, pero no tiene techo y para cubrirse del sol utiliza bolsas de poliuretano.

Benalicia: Es otra integrante del banco, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada, tiene 5 hijos; el préstamo que solicita es para construir el horno artesanal, para vender pan de coco, pan simple, empanadas, rosquillas, que las ofrecerá a domicilio. Su sueño es ampliar su pequeño negocio.

Emilia: Tiene 43 años, es casada y tiene 8 hijos. Solicita financiamiento para construir el horno que necesita para hornear el pan y las empanadas que ella misma hace; también comprar insumos como harina, azúcar, levadura para elaborar pan empanadas y venderlas a domicilio. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y vender fritanga

Eufenia: Tiene 47 años de edad. Solicita financiamiento para construir el horno y comprar insumos como harina, azúcar, levadura para elaborar pan, queque y venderlas en su vivienda. Su sueño es construir su vivienda de concreto (cemento), ampliar su negocio y ofrecer carne de res, cerdo y pollo.

Benancia: Tiene 51 años de edad. Solicita financiamiento para comprar productos de bastimentos e insumos para la elaboración de pan. Su sueño es mejorar su vivienda.

Lila: Tiene 36 años de edad, es madre soltera de 6 hijos. Desde hace un año vende ropa usada en su vivienda, por lo que requiere de un préstamo para comprar más mercadería en Managua. Su sueño es que su negocio crezca. 

Sara: Tiene 53 años de edad, es madre soltera de 7 hijos. Vende ropa usada de manera ambulante. Solicita financiamiento para comprar paca en Managua para venderla a precios accesibles y mejorar sus ingresos.  Su sueño es que su negocio crezca.
 
Lidia: Tiene 34 años de edad, es casada, tiene 5 hijos. Vende frito de pollo en su vivienda Solicita financiamiento para mejorar su vivienda y comprar los insumos: filipitas, pollo, repollo, tomate y aceite. Su sueño es que su negocio crezca e instaurar una pulpería en su vivienda.

Xiomara: Tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y tiene 5 hijos. Solicita financiamiento para comprar pescados y mariscos en la comunidad de Bismona y venderlos a precios en Waspam. Su sueño es construir su vivienda de concreto.
texts.en:
Sebastiana is a friendly and enterprising woman; leader of the Yahal Tagni (which means small flower – a species of bush who’s flowers are used as soap to wash dishes and wooden floors) communal bank.  She is the mother of nine children (6 daughters and 3 sons).  Seven are adults and two are teen-agers who attend school.  She is 57 years old and directs seven ladies who are organized to look for alternative financing through a Pana Pana loan, so they can improve their businesses and incomes.  This will allow them to improve their families’ living conditions and cover their basic needs; food, education, and household.

The members of the Communal Bank sell pastries, bread, and used clothing.  The loan that four of them are requesting will be used to build bread ovens, to sell fish, clothing, and to stock a small store.

Sebastiana’s dream is to build a concrete house with separate rooms.  Right now she only has two bedrooms and 5 adults and seven children live in the small wooden house.  She has not been able to make any improvements for three years.  Her other dream is to build small wooden appartments on her land to rent out at affordable prices.

Celia is a member of the communal bank.  She is 64 years old, married, and has three children.  She has been selling used clothing for nine months from her patio and started her small business with her own capital and is asking for a loan to buy two packs of clothing in Managua.  Her dream is to improve the place where she sells her products.  At the moment it’s not a comfortable place.  She used her patio to sell her clothing, but it doesn’t have a roof and she uses polyurethane bags to provide cover from the sun.

Benalicia is another member of the bank.  She is 37 years old, married, and has five children.  She will use the money from this loan to buy an oven so she can sell coconut bread, simple bread, empanadas, and donuts from her home.  Her dream is to expand her small business. 

Emilia is 43 years old, married, and has eight children.  She is asking for a loan to build an oven that she needs to bake bread and empanadas that she makes and sells out of her home.  She also wants to buy supplies such as flour, sugar, and yeast.  Her dream is to expand her business and sell fried foods.

Eufenia is 47 years old and is asking for a loan to build an oven and buy supplies such as flour, sugar, and yeast to make bread and cake to sell out of her home.  Her dream is to build her house out of cement, expand her business, and sell beef, pork, and poultry. 

Benancia is 51 years old and is asking for a loan to buy supplies and ingredients to make bread.  Her dream is to make improvements to her home.

Lila is 36 years old and is the single mother of six.  She has been selling used clothing out of her home for a year and needs this loan to buy merchandise in Managua.  Her dream is to grow her business.

Sara is 53 years old and is the mother of seven.  She sells used clothing on foot and is asking for this loan to buy merchandise in Managua to sell at affordable prices and improve her income.  Her dream is to grow her business.

Lidia is 34 years old, married, and has five children.  She sells fried chicken out of her home and is asking for a loan to make improvements to her home and buy ingredients such as filipitas, chicken, cabbage, tomatoes, and cooking oil.  Her dream is to grow her business and set up a store in her home.

Xiomara is 48 years old, married, and has five children.  She is asking for this loan to buy fish and seafood in the Bismona community and sell then in Waspam.  Her dream is to build a concrete home.

loans.use: to buy ovens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy leather goods to start his own business

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen lives in Mangwei, a small town in Kwale County. Kwale County is located on the Kenyan coast, near Tanzania. Inconsistent rains, especially recently, have made farming difficult, and the poverty rates in the county are above the Kenyan average. Beekeeping is somewhat new to Kwale, but the passion fruit farms and mangrove forests throughout the area provide excellent sources of nectar for bee colonies. Many farmers in the area have expressed excitement at the prospect of owning their own hives and having a second source of income from their honey to help care for their families.

Stephen is married and has three children. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for 24 years now and they are currently growing maize and rice on their farm. Stephen is excited about beekeeping because it will earn him some income from his small amount of land.

This is Stephen’s first loan with Honey Care and he intends to use the proceeds from his beehives to purchase a mechanical tool kit. Stephen’s hope for the future is to establish a motor workshop.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 50 years old. She is married with 10 children. Her husband works as a businessman. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past seven years. With the loan, she would like to buy more cassava flour and corn flour for sale. With the profits from the business, she will pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more cassava flour and corn flour for sale.

loans.name: Ovsanna

texts.en:
Ovsanna lives in Armavir town with her husband and daughter-in-law. Her son is a migrant worker in a neighboring country. Ovsanna and her husband rent a small store in the center of the town where they trade clothing. The family has been engaged in this business activity for 13 years and that has become an important and only source of their income. Ovsanna now asks this loan to purchase new stock of clothing and satisfy her clients' demand. 

She has taken a loan from local financial institutions before, but because of very difficult financial conditions, wasn't able to pay it back on time. Now, by ensuring that her retail business is successful and she is able to provide monthly payments for this loan, Ovsanna has been approved for this loan. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. 

Ovsanna and her husband wait for your support and hope that this loan will greatly assist them.

loans.use: to pay for a new stock of clothing

loans.name: Luz Dary

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer activa y emprendedora, casada y madre de 3 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con mucha dedicación y esfuerzo.
Hace aproximadamente 10 años desarrolló la habilidad para fabricar accesorios de bisutería en murano y oro negro, aprendió el oficio por medio de la observación y poco a poco fue mejorando sus técnicas; los productos que fabrica los vende entre sus familiares y amigos del sector y así genera recursos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.
El crédito que solicita será destinado a la compra de insumos al por mayor (nylon, pedrería, murano, broches) lo que le permitirá continuar con su actividad y realizar nuevos diseños que cumplan los estándares de la moda actual; satisfaciendo así los gustos de sus clientes y mejorando los ingresos que recibe  por cada venta.
Todo esto le permitirá a Luz avanzar para cumplir el sueño de crecer su negocio y trasmitir el conocimiento a otras personas para así ampliar su mercado y mejorar la rentabilidad del negocio, dando como resultado una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Luz is an active, enterprising woman.  She is married and the mother of three children whom she is getting ahead through much dedication and effort.

About ten years ago she learned how to make costume jewelry out of murano and black gold.  She learned through watching and improved her technique little by little.  She sells her products to her family and friends in the area and generates income to help her husband pay the household expenses.

She is asking for this loan to buy supplies in quantity (nylon, rhinestones, murano, brooches) so she can continue her business and create new designs in the current styles, thereby satisfying her customers and improving her profits from each sale.

All of this will allow Luz to achieve her dream of growing her business and expanding her market by letting others know.  This will improve her profitability and provide a better quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Nona

texts.en:
Nona lives in Armavir with her parents. She has taken a loan from SEF last year and was able to pay for her tuition for the first semester. Now, Nona asks for this second loan to pay for her university tuition for the second semester. She is a very responsible and hard working young lady and hopes for Kiva lenders' support for the second time.

The loan is very important for her to complete her education and become a good specialist in the future.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition for the second semester.

loans.name: Nazil

texts.en:
Nazil is a new client of UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI). He is 35 years old and married with six children. He deals in a retail shop business where he gets his income to cater to his family as a married man.

He has additional income from agriculture, specifically farming and raising livestock. He hopes to use the loan given to him to purchase cows for fattening. He hopes to expand his retail shop into a wholesale shop and improve his cattle raising to become the biggest farmer in his village.

loans.use: To purchase cows for fattening

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en:
Josephat lives in Magodi, a small town in Kwale County. Kwale County is located on the Kenyan coast, and borders Tanzania to the south. Inconsistent rainfalls make farming difficult, and contribute to the area's high poverty rates. Despite the unreliable rainfall, bees in the region have two excellent sources of food from wild mangrove forests and local passion fruit plantations. Beekeeping is relatively new to the area, but many farmers are very interested in owning hives.

Josephat is married and has four children. His wife is a receptionist at an educational institution while he is a farmer. He has been farming for 16 years now and he is currently nurturing an orange orchard. Josephat is excited about beekeeping, as it requires minimum attention.

This is Josephat’s first loan with Honey Care and he intends to use the proceeds from his beehives to repair his grain crusher. Josephat’s hope for the future is to buy a new grain crusher.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 48-year-old man who is married with five children living in Kyenjojo,Uganda. He has been in a commercial agriculture business that has kept him move on for four years in the rural areas. He obtains additional income from retail trade. He started his business to get more income for providing the basic needs of his family. He is faced with a problem of unexpected weather changes that prevent him from meeting the required output as estimated through the season. His dream is to buy land and expand his tea plantation farm to a large estate. Patrick is requesting a loan to buy farm inputs.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Samalie

texts.en: Samalie is married with two children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She owns a restaurant and has been in this business for one year. She has applied for a loan of 700000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of Irish potatoes, cooking oil and charcoal. She works at the market five days a week and sells on retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring to own a fully stocked restaurant, and to buy a plot of land and build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of Irish potatoes, cooking oil and charcoal

loans.name: Hovhannes

texts.en:
Hovhannes is a farmer and father of two grown up children (aged 19 and 17 years old). Hovhannes has been running his farm for more than 10 years. He keeps four pigs and cultivates tomatoes. Hovhannes son greatly assists him with farming activities and that is big support for him.

Currently, by applying for this loan Hovhannes asks financial support from Kiva lenders to be able to enlarge his farm. The loan will help him to purchase a cow and forage for feeding the livestock. This loan is important for Hovhannes to have a chance to enlarge his farm and be more engaged in agribusiness. 

Hovhannes received a loan from a local financial institution in the past but was unfortunately not able to pay it back on time. However, thanks to his recent hard work, Hovhannes was able to run his small agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that he will be able to cover the monthly payments. Consequently, he has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and for forage to feed the livestock

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is married with six children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of rearing chickens and has been in this business for two years. She sells to all types of people but on retail basis seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves.

Joy has applied for a loan of 700000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of chicken feed and chicks. She is aspiring to own 2000 chickens and also to build more chicken houses. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of chicken feeds and chicks

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 24-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 3 years to 10 years. She describes herself to be energetic and hardworking. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for two years. 

Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be theft and shortage of stock. She will use the Kes 35000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables and fruits. Her business goal is to be prosperous within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will achieve her goals. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her agricultural farm.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Teriya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe  TERIYA ont en moyenne  39 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à KONDALA/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits alimentaires et divers.                                                                                            Les femmes du groupe TERIYA sont à leur 1er prêt solidaire.                  AWA, 1ère femme debout à droite  sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 50Kg de mil, 50Kg de maïs et 70Kg de riz. Elle s’approvisionne sur place et dans les villages environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Teriya group have an average age of 39 and, on average, 5 children and all live in traditional extended families in Kondala/Segou (the 4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women got to know each other via family and neighbourly relationships and they buy and sell various products including food. The women of the Teriya group are on their 1st group loan.

Awa, the woman standing on the far right in the picture, plans to use her loan to buy 50 kilos of millet, 50 kilos of maize and 70 kilos of rice. She gets her supplies locally and in the surrounding villages. She makes her sales locally, for cash and often credit, to a clientèle made up of women and men. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 20 000 francs, some of which will be spent on healthcare, food, clothing and educational expenses and the rest of which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe  SABOUGNOUMA ont en moyenne  30 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à KONDALA/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits alimentaires.                                                                                            Les femmes du groupe SABOUGNOUMA sont à leur 1er prêt solidaire.                  SOUTOURA, 1ère femme debout à droite  sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 550Kg de mil. Elle s’approvisionne sur place et dans les villages environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Sabougnouma group have an average age of 30 and, on average, 4 children and all live in traditional extended families in Kondala/Segou (the 4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women got to know each other via family and neighbourly relationships and they buy and sell food products. The women of the Sabougnouma group are on their 1st group loan.

Soutoura, the woman standing on the far right in the picture, plans to use her loan to buy 550 kilos of millet. She gets her supplies locally and in the surrounding villages. She makes her sales locally, for cash and often credit, to a clientèle made up of women and men. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 20 000 francs, some of which will be spent on healthcare, food, clothing and educational expenses and the rest of which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Pingdataaba Group

texts.fr:
Mme IRENE est  responsable du groupe PINGDATAABA. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 07ans et le moins âgé a 03ans. 01 va à l’école.
Mme vend des pagnes  depuis 11 ans. Elle s’approvisionne  au Mali. Ses clients sont dans le marché de son quartier.
Elle veut s’acheter 3pièces de pagnes, et 15 complets  Bazin.
Avec ses économies, elle veut améliorer son activité. Elle ambitionne toujours devenir une très grande commerçante et très renommée. Elle veut que ses enfants fassent de très grandes études à l’étranger.
texts.en: Irene is the leader of the Pingdataaba group. She is doing well. She is married and the mother of two children, the eldest of whom is 7 years old and the youngest, 3. One of her children attends school. Irene has been selling pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African clothing) for 11 years. She gets her supplies in Mali. She serves her customers at the market in her district. Irene would like to buy 3 pagnes and 15 damask outfits. She would like to improve her business using her savings. She still aims to become a large and well-known retailer. She would like her children to go abroad and get very well educated.

loans.use: 3 pagnes and 15 damask outfits.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Ella es Nancy, a ella le gusta estudiar atención a la primera infancia porque le gustan los niños y son muy lindos, tiene paciencia, dedicación y amor hacia los niños para enseñarle muchas cosas, a esa edad  es cuando más requieren atención y es la etapa más importante para ellos, también son muy tiernos, dulces, cariñosos además de todo, ellos tienen etapas en las cuales necesitan tener la mayor atención posible, la cual ella les podría brindar valores como el amor, respeto, tolerancia, responsabilidad, honestidad, sinceridad y también puede brindarles cosas significativas para el crecimiento y el desarrollo de los niños, preparar a los niños para cursar la escolarización, darle a experimentar el contacto con pinturas y colores, también que tengan en cuenta lo aprendido en esta etapa. 

Solicita el subsidio con kiva, ya que le parece que es una ayuda muy buena para todos los estudiantes que desean hacer ejercer esta carrera, le parece que es una ayuda con respecto a  la oportunidad de estudio que  ofrece este programa, esta carrera le ayudaría a mejorar la calidad de vida en cuanto a la experiencia con los niños y en cuanto a lo económico, también le ayudaría a brindar todo los conocimientos adquiridos en la institución. 
Para el futuro quiere  ejercer la carrera de atención a la primera infancia como siempre ha soñado y poder ser la persona que 
Acompaña a  los niños en un desarrollo adecuado a las capacidades teniendo en cuenta lo que aprendió. 
Piensa en un futuro poder terminar este técnico para poder tener el propio jardín y tener mejores ingresos económicos para poder ayudarle a la familia. 

El convenio con kiva le sería de gran ayuda ya que los gastos del semestre se incrementaron y no alcanza a solventar los gastos del estudio como los del hogar,
texts.en:
This is Nancy. She likes her studies in early childhood care because she likes children and finds them adorable. She is patient, dedicated, and loving toward children in order to teach them many things. At this age they need a lot of attention and it is the most important stage for them. At this age they are also very tender, sweet, and affectionate. This is when they need more attention then ever and Nancy can teach them values such as love, respect, tolerance, responsibility, honesty, sincerity, as well as other things that are important for their growth and development and for preparing them for school. She lets them experiment with paint and colors and encourages them to remember what they've learned during this stage.

Nancy is requesting a Kiva loan because she thinks it is of great help to students in this field of studies. She thinks it will help her to complete this program, and the career will improve her quality of life, both in terms of gaining experience with children and in economic terms. It will also help her to pass on all the knowledge she will acquire at the institution. 

In the future she wants to work in early childhood care, which is what she has always dreamed of doing. She wants to be a person that guides children through an adequate development and helps them to remember what they have learned. She plans to finish her studies so that she can have her own garden and obtain a better income in order to help her family.

The Kiva loan will be of great help to her since the tuition fee has been increased this semester, and she is not able to pay for both her studies and the household expenses.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fee

loans.name: Sebastián

texts.es:
Sebastián es un joven de 23 años de edad, que desde que terminó sus estudios secundarios, comenzó a trabajar en diferentes actividades y, actualmente tiene una tienda de abarrotes que un familiar le cedió para que la trabajara y generara ingresos para sustentar los gastos del hogar.
El negocio lo tiene hace 3 meses, trabaja todos los días de 7 am a 8 pm y, a pesar de la competencia que existe en el sector, ha obtenido buenos resultados, generando ingresos suficientes para que a su esposa y sus dos hijas no les haga falta nada.
El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para comprar surtido al por mayor (mecato, lácteos, galletería, granos, entre otros), esto le permitirá ofrecer mayor variedad de productos para satisfacer las necesidades inmediatas de sus clientes, aumentando las ventas e ingresos que recibe por su labor.
Sebastián, con su espíritu de superación y las ganas de salir adelante con su familia, lo impulsan a seguir luchando y avanzar para cumplir el sueño de adquirir una casa propia, en la que pueda disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida en compañía de su familia y brindar una buena educación a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Sebastián is a young man aged 23 who began working in different jobs after he finished his secondary education. Currently he has a grocery store that a family member handed over so he could work in it and make an income to cover his household expenses. He has had the business for 3 months, and he works every day from 7 am to 8 pm. In spite of the competition in the area, he has achieved good results, and has made enough money so that his wife and their two daughters lack for nothing.

He is asking for a loan to help him buy wholesale supplies such as snacks, dairy products, biscuits and grains. This will allow him to offer a wider variety of products to satisfy his customers' immediate needs. This will increase his sales and the income he earns from his work.

Sebastián's determined spirit and desire to help his family get on push him to continue fighting and making progress to achieve his dream of owning his own house. Then he could enjoy a better quality of life with his family and provide his daughters with a good education .

loans.use: to buy wholesale items such as snacks, dairy products, biscuits and grains.

loans.name: Wendyalgdo Group

texts.fr:
Mr  SALIFOU représente le  groupe WENDYALGDO. Il se porte bien ainsi que tout le groupe. Marié, Il est père de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 03ans et le moins âgé a 01an. Personne ne  va  à l’école et il a 03 personnes  en charge.
Mr  vend des plats et seaux en plastique depuis 04 ans.  Il s’approvisionne au marché de Sankaryaré. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.
Il veut s’acheter  02 douzaines de seaux, 03 douzaines de bouillards et 05douzaines de plats.
Il  veut épargner  ses bénéfices afin de réinvestir  dans son activité. Mr ambitionne améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et construire une maison d’habitation.
texts.en:
Salifou is the representative of the Wendyalgdo Group.  He is doing well, as is the whole group.  Salifou is married and has two children.  The eldest is three years old and the youngest is one year old.  He is financially responsible for three people, and none of his children currently attends school.

Salifou has been selling plastic dishes and buckets for four years.  He buys his merchandise at the market in Sankaryaré, and sells to both men and women.

He will use his loan to buy 2 dozen buckets, 3 dozen kettles and 5 dozen dishes.  Salifou will save his earnings in order to reinvest in his business.

In the future, he would like to improve the living conditions of his family and build a house.

loans.use: to buy 2 dozen buckets, 3 dozen kettles and 5 dozen dishes for resale.

loans.name: Yirigui I Group

texts.fr:
Mme BERTINE représente le groupe YIRIGUI I.  Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 25ans et le moins âgé a 23ans. Personne ne va  à l’école, elle a 03 personnes à sa  charge.
Mme fait la transformation (savons) depuis 07ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Tampouy. Ses clients sont les  hommes, les femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter 06litres d’huile de coco, 08litres de beurre  de karité et 06litres de soude caustique.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle désire réinvestir dans son activité. Mme ambitionne  agrandir son champ d’activité et mieux entretenir ses enfants
texts.en:
Bertine represents the Yirigui 1 Group.  She is doing well.  She is married and has two children, the eldest is twenty-five years old and the youngest is twenty-three years old.  She is financially responsible for three people, and neither of her children attend school.

Bertine has been making soap for seven years.  She buys her provisions at the market in Tampouy, and sells to men and women.

She will use her loan to buy 6 litres of coconut oil, 8 litres of shea butter and 6 litres of caustic soda.

Bertine will use her earnings to reinvest in her business.

In the future, she would like to expand her product range, and take better care of her children.

loans.use: to buy 6 litres of coconut oil, 8 litres of shea butter and 6 litres of caustic soda.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Doña Ana María labora como cocinera en un restaurante, su esposo es cadete de taxi, ambos luchan para apoyar a su hijo quien va a la escuela. Ella requiere de este crédito para empezar a construir el muro del lindero sur de su vivienda, así Ana María va avanzando con las mejoras en su hogar  para el bien común de  la familia.
texts.en: Ana Maria works as a cook in a restaurant, her husband is a taxi driver and they both strive to support their son who is in school. She needs this loan to start building a wall for the boundary of their home, this is how Ana Maria is making progress with her home improvements, for the common good of her family.

loans.use: to buy iron, cement, concrete blocks, sand and gravel.

loans.name: Fokaben Group

texts.fr:
Fokaben est un regroupement de femmes de Hamdallaye qui se connaissent bien et qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans, sont mariées et ont au moins 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, Pagnes, Sucres, Chaussures, Produits cosmétiques, Porte monnaies, de la Restauration etc. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur onzième prêt de groupe. 
Fanta est un membre du groupe Fokaben assise au bout et à  droite, elle est une vendeuse d’articles divers tels des chaussures, produits cosmétique, porte monnaies. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des Chaussures, Produits cosmétiques, Porte monnaies. Elle se procure de ces produits au marché de Koutiala et les vend à la maison et au marché à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Fokaben comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 95 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Fanta compte réaliser  98 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
Fokaben is a group of women from the Hamdallaye neighbourhood, who know one another well, and live in large, traditional families with their husbands, children and other family members.  They are, on average, thirty-eight years old, married and have at least four children.  

The women buy and sell various products, such as pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing), sugar, shoes, cosmetic products, purses and food.

In order to expand their businesses, the group members work with the field partner Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their eleventh group loan.

Fanta (sitting on the far right in the photo) is a member of the Fokaben Group, and sells products, such as shoes, cosmetic products and purses.  She will use her loan to buy shoes, cosmetic products and purses.  She buys her products at the market in Koutiala, and sells them from home and at the market, to a varied clientele.

While the other members of the group expect to earn an average of 95,000 francs CFA during the loan cycle, Fanta hopes to earn 98,000 francs CFA.  She will use her earnings to repay her loan, provide for her personal expenses and improve the working capital of her business.

loans.use: to buy various products for resale.

loans.name: Heimy Viviana

texts.es:
Viviana es una joven de 18 años, ella siempre ha querido ser un ejemplo de vida para las personas que están  alrededor de ella,  personas rodeadas de problemas y necesidades, pero a ella eso nunca le ha importado, siempre ha creído que puede ser diferente a los demás y sabe que ese medio para alcanzarlo es estudiar.
 Ella siempre ha soñado estar en la universidad, pero en este momento no es posible, en algún momento ella se desmoralizo porque veía que iba a ser muy difícil acceder a la educación superior, pero siempre creyó que había alguna oportunidad. Un día Viviana recibió a una amiga que le hablo de un lugar donde podía estudiar llamado Campo alto donde había muchos programas de salud, Viviana siempre le ha gustado ayudar y apoyar a las personas en las necesidades, en los problemas y sabe que  una oportunidad muy especial para hacerlo es la salud, al ver que la amiga la había llevado a aquel lugar se emocionó, a si que desde ese momento se encuentra estudiando en la institución.
Se decidió a estudiar una carrera llamada servicios farmacéuticos, y ahora está muy contenta estudiando porque sabe que va a conseguir un trabajo y que con ese trabajo llegará a estudiar a la universidad donde siempre soñó, ella nunca se va rendir tan fácil, aunque a veces se desanima porque no puede pagar a tiempo o no tiene para el transporte o un cuaderno, es por eso que ella necesita el convenio de kiva, para que ella pueda  conseguir los sueños, porque ella es una  persona que no desaprovecha las oportunidades, sino que aprovecha cada una al máximo, nunca se va olvidar de donde salió y todo lo que lo que debió hacer para alcanzar el sueño, siempre vivirá agradecida por todo lo que Dios le ha dado y con las personas que la ayudaron.
texts.en:
Viviana is a young woman aged 18 who has always wanted to act as an example to those around her; people with a lot of problems and many needs. However, this has never stopped her, and she has always believed she could stand out from the rest. She realises that her way of achieving this is by studying.

She has always dreamt of going to university, but this is not currently possible. At some point, she became demoralised because she saw it was going to be really difficult to access higher education. However, she always believed that an opportunity would present itself. One day, Viviana was visited by a friend who told her about a place called CampoAlto, where she could study and which offered a lot of health programs. Viviana has always liked to help and support people with various needs and problems, and she knows that a special way of doing that is via healthcare. When she realised that through her friend 's help she had managed to get to CampoAlto, she became quite emotional, and since that moment she has been studying at this institute.

Viviana decided to study a course called pharmaceutical services and is now very happy studying as she knows she will be able to secure a job and that with that work she will achieve the thing she always dreamt of: studying at university. She does not easily give up, although at times she does lose hope because she can't pay her fees on time or because she doesn't have the money for transport or for an exercise book. This is why she needs a Kiva loan, so she can achieve her dreams. She isn't a person to miss an opportunity, but rather she takes advantage of one to the utmost. She will never forget where she came from and everything she had to do to achieve her dream. She will be forever grateful for everything God has given her and to those who have helped her.

loans.use: to pay for a semester's tuition fees.

loans.name: Adrian Ramon

texts.es: El señor Adrian habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, soltero padre de dos hijos, el habita en casa de su mama, trabaja para una empresa privada desde hace 15 años, el tiene deseos de superacion y mejorar sus condiciones de vida, el credito lo esta solicitando para la compra de materiales como, cemento, bloques, hierro ya que ralizara modificaciones en la parte tracera de la vivienda, Agradece la confianza y apoyo que recibe de Kiva y Afodenic con este prestamo.
texts.en: Señor Adrian lives in the town of Ticuantepe, sand is a single father to two children. He lives in his mother's house, and has worked for a private company for 15 years. He dreams of bettering himself and improving his living conditions. He is requesting this loan to buy materials such as cement, blocks, and iron to make improvements to the back part of his house. He is grateful for the confidence and support placed in him by Kiva and Afodenic with this loan.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
Ella es Diana, tiene 17 años, estudia Cosmetología y Estética en Campo alto, actualmente tercer semestre, el sueño siempre ha sido estudiar y formarse lo mejor posible en este campo de la salud, ya que no solo le resulta interesante sino que también lo considera buena para ella, a ella siempre la encuentran leyendo e investigando cosas nuevas que puede aplicar en la vida diaria personal y laboral, ya que considera que siempre hay algo de lo que se puede aprender. 
Desde muy pequeña ella se ha visualizado estudiando lo que le gusta, aunque sabe que es complicado y requiere de mucho esfuerzo y que en la mayoría de veces se necesita ayuda económica, Pero por esta razón ella no ha dejado de luchar por lo que sueña y necesita, buscando oportunidades y sacando el mayor provecho de ellas. 
Los intereses de ella siempre se encuentran enfocados en lo que es mejor para ella y para los que la rodean, lo que resulta ser otra buena razón para formarse de la mejor manera y culminar las metas que tiene propuestas hasta ahora. 
A pesar de que ella sabe que existen obstáculos, sabe que siempre es posible encontrar la manera de solucionarlos, ya que cuenta con el apoyo suficiente que necesita para llevarlo a cabo. 
Finalmente, ella agradece el apoyo que le brida no solo la familia, sino al subsidio que ofrece kiva, ya que es un gran apoyo para ella, para que se siga instruyendo continuamente y así pueda ser una mejor persona y cosmetóloga en un futuro no muy lejano.
texts.en:
This is Diana, she is 17 years old and studying Cosmetology and Beauty Therapy in CampoAlto, now in her third semester. Her dream has always been to study and train as best she can in the field of health, not just because she finds it interesting but because she considers it to be good for her. She can always be found reading and investigating new things that she can apply in her daily personal and work life, as she believes there is always something to learn. Since she was very young, she saw herself studying something she liked, although she knew it would be complicated and require much effort and that in the majority of times, one needs financial support. But for this reason, she hasn't stopped struggling for what she dreams and needs, looking for opportunities and making the best of them. Her interests are always focused on what is best for her and for those who surround her, which results as another good reason to study in the best way and reach the goals she has set up until now. 

Despite knowing that obstacles exist, she knows that it is always possible to find a way to get around them, and she has the support she needs to be able to make it. Finally, she thanks all the support from not only her family but also the help that Kiva offers, as it is a great support to her, so that she can continue constantly training and be able to become a better person and cosmetologist, in the not too distant future.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru: Татьяне 51 год. Она занимается растениеводством в своем районе Яван. Ей в сельском хозяйстве помогают муж и сыновья. У Татьяны трое сыновей в возрасте 27, 22, 18 лет и трое дочерей в возрасте 30, 20 и 13 лет. На протяжении 18 лет Татьяна и ее семья занимаются посевом сельскохозяйственных культур. Они на большом участке земли выращивают помидоры, огурцы и другие виды овощей. Сейчас Татьяна активно готовится к посеву. Ей сперва необходимо обработать почву. Для этой цели она запрашивает кредит, на сумму которого собирается приобрести минеральные удобрения. Татьяна и ее семья с нетерпением ждут начало посевных работ и надеются на поддержку.
texts.en: Tatyana is 51 years old.  She is involved in agriculture in her district of Yavan.  Her husband and sons help her with the agricultural business.  Tatyana has three sons, aged 27, 22 and 18 years old, and three daughters, aged 30, 20 and 13 years old.  Tatyana and her family have been involved in sowing agricultural crops for 18 years.  They grow tomatoes, cucumbers and other types of vegetables on a large land plot.  Now Tatyana is actively preparing for the next sowing.  She first has to treat the soil.  She is requesting a loan for this purpose and plans to purchase mineral fertilizers with the loan amount.  Tatyana and her family are anxiously awaiting the sowing work and hoping for the support.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Husnoro

texts.ru: Хусноро опытный фермер из района Яван. Ей 52 года. Она жена и мать пятерых детей. В своем селе на большом участке земли Хусноро,ее муж и сыновья занимаются земледелием. Они выращивают огородные культуры. Хусноро любит работать с почвой и получать плоды своих трудов. Она занята в этой сфере более 19 лет и не предстваляет себя в другой сефере. Сейчас она активно готовится к посеву и хочет посеять помидоры, огурцы и другие овощи. Сперва она хотела бы обработать почву и в связи с этим берет кредит для купли минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Husnoro is an experienced farmer from the Yavan district.  She is 52 years old.  She is a wife and a mother of five children.  Husnoro, her husband and sons are involved in agriculture on a large plot of land in their village.  They grow garden crops.  Husnoro loves to work on the land and reap the products of her labor.  She has been involved in this field for over 19 years and cannot imagine herself working in another area.  Now she is actively preparing for the next sowing and wants to plant tomatoes, cucumbers and other vegetable.  She first wants to treat the soil and is requesting this loan to purchase mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Guliston

texts.ru: Гулистон старается улучшить условия жизни и стимулировать экономическое состояние семьи. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 5 детей. Ее муж получает маленькую зарплату. Это зарплата не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами. Гулистон решила помочь мужу для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей фруктов, так как фрукты имеют большой спрос на местном рынке. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки товара, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Guliston tries to improve her living conditions and stimulate her family's economic situation.  She is married and raising five children.  Her husband earns a small salary.  This salary is not enough to provide the family with all of the necessities.  Guliston decided to help her husband for the welfare of the family.  With this goal in mind, she completed the "Achieve Success" course, organized by the Association of Business Women, and obtained a certificate.  Now she is quite capable of starting her own business and becoming successful in this field.  She wants to organize a business of reselling fruits because fruits have a lot demand on the local market.  She plans to use the resulting income to provide her children with a good education and high-quality food products.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to buy merchandise in order to start her own business.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy fruits in order to start her own business

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DJIGUISSEME ont en moyenne  40 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à  YANGASSO/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers, restauration et de boisson.  Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DJIGUISSEME sont à leur  5ème  prêt solidaire. KADIATOU,  1 ère femme   à gauche  sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 250Kg de riz, 50Kg de fonio, 15Kg d’oignon, 10l litres d’huile et 5 paquet de cube Maggi. Elle s’approvisionne sur place. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Djiguisseme Group are, on average, forty years old, with four children, and live in traditional, extended families in Yangasso/Ségou (the fourth admininstrative region of the Republic of Mali).  The women know one another through family ties, and all work buying and selling various products, food and drink.

This will be the women's fifth group loan, the previous loans were all fully and correctly repaid.

Kadiatou (standing on the far left of the photo) will use her loan to buy 250kg of rice, 50kg of fonio, 15kg of onions, 10 litres of oil and 5 packets of Maggi stock cubes.  She buys her provisions locally, and sells to men and women, for cash and on credit.

Kadiatou expects to earn a monthly average of 20,000 francs CFA, which she will use to provide for healthcare, food, clothing and education costs.  The remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy food products for resale.

loans.name: Dúo Dulce Esperanza Group

texts.es:
DUO DULCE ESPERANZA
Doña Selsa es originaria de la aldea Pacorral del municipio de Tecpán, Guatemala  tiene 54 años de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano y a la crianza de animales.
Gracias al apoyo de su  esposo y el de sus hijos ella sigue adelante con su trabajo, ya que es el medio que tiene para salir adelante.
El crédito que ella recibió lo utilizo para comprar materia prima para sus tejidos y también concentrado y animales para crianza.
Ella sueña con  ampliar mas su negocio ya que así tendrá  mejores ganancias para mejorar su calidad de vida,en el credito anterior pago puntual mente y no callo en mora.
texts.en:
DUO DULCE ESPERANZA ["Sweet Hope Duo"]
Selsa comes from the town of Pacorral in the municipality of Tecpán, Guatemala. She is 54 years old, and she works making traditional weavings by hand and also raising animals. Thanks to the support of her husband and her children, she is continuing with her work, since it is the means she has to get ahead in life. The loan that she received has been used to buy supplies for her weavings, as well as animal feed and animals to raise. She dreams of expanding her business even more, since by doing so she would have better earnings to improve her quality of life. With her previous loan, she paid punctually and did not fall into arrears.

loans.use: to buy supplies for weaving, animal feed and animals to raise.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is a 39-year-old married woman with two children aged three and seven. She describes herself as passionate about her work. She runs a tailoring business where she makes dresses to sell and has been doing this for six years. Her business is in a good location and her primary customers are reliable. She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of funds to buy materials. She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan to buy fabric, thread and other materials. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her standard of living. This is Gladys' second loan with SMEP DTM and her previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy fabric, thread and other sewing materials

loans.name: Leonardo De La Concepcion

texts.es:
el señor Leonardo se dedica a su actividad de venta de productos ferreteros en el mercado desde hace 40 años, es un señor muy trabajador  y le gusta trabajar ya que el es el sustento de su hogar es casado, su esposa le tuvo 4 hijo ninguno depende de el, el solo sustenta su hogar y a su esposa.

vende de lunes a domingo desde las siete de la mañana a cinco de la tarde , en su negocio vende productos ferreteros, solicita el financiamiento para compra de mercaderia para su negocio como : mangueras, candados, cables, extensiones.
texts.en:
Leonardo has been selling DIY products at the market for 40 years. He is very hard-working and likes to work as it allows him to support his household. Leonardo is married and has four children, though the children no longer depend on him. Leonardo alone support his household and his wife.

Leonardo works seven days a week, from 7am until 5pm. He sells DIY items. He is applying for a loan in order to buy merchandise for his business, such as hoses, padlocks, and cables./

loans.use: to buy items for a DIY store, such as plugs, lamps, hoses, keys, padlocks and pliers.

loans.name: Ruth María

texts.es:
Ruth es una artesana de 53 años de edad, madre de un hijo y cabeza de hogar desde que se separó de su esposo. 
Actualmente se gana la vida produciendo y comercializando artesanías en bambú y guadua, oficio que aprendió de un familiar y que hoy en día se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos; el taller se encuentra ubicado en un espacio de su casa, donde trabaja en compañía de sus hermanos, desde hace 4 años.
El crédito solicitado es un apoyo para fortalecer su negocio, pues realizará adecuaciones del espacio y comprará materia prima al por mayor (bambú, guadua, pegante, pinturas) y algunas herramientas de trabajo, esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y podrá sacar nuevos diseños para satisfacer los diversos gustos de sus clientes, obteniendo como resultado, un incremento en las ventas e ingresos.
Ruth manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es  abrir un almacén en el que pueda comercializar todos los productos que fabrica y así mejorar la economía familiar, abriéndose paso para disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida y, brindar a su hijo una buena educación universitaria.
texts.en:
Ruth is 53 years old and makes artisan products. She is a mother to one son and has been head of her household since separating from her husband.

Ruth currently makes a living making and selling artisan products with bamboo and guadua. She learned this trade from a relative and it has become her main source of income. Ruth's workshop is in her home and she has been working there with her siblings for four years.

Ruth is applying for this loan in order to strengthen her business. She will make changes to her working space and will buy basic supplies (such as bamboo, guaduas, glue and paints) in bulk, as well as tools for her work. This will allow Ruth to continue with her work and she will be able to create new designs to satisfy her customers' various tastes. She will then have better results and an increase in sales and income.

Ruth tells us that her greatest wish is to open a large store where she can sell all the goods that she makes. She can then improve her household's financial situation, opening the door to a better quality of life and allowing her to give her son a good university education.

loans.use: to set up her working space and to buy basic supplies (such as bamboo, guaduas, glue and paints) in bulk, as well as tools for her work.

loans.name: Aida

texts.es: Aida tiene  39  años de edad, esta unión libre y vive con el esposo  actualmente. Ella con el crédito pretende comprar madera para hacer muebles. Ella piensa vender  esta mercadería  y así  poder generar más ganancias para contribuir con su familia, ella no cuenta con el capital necesario para dicha compra, ya que es de bajos recursos y no tiene como adquirir el dinero necesario para esto, por lo que el solicito un crédito, y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR.
