Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja…
texts.en: Aida is 39 years old and has a partner, with whom she currently lives.Aida plans to use this loan in order to buy wood to make furniture. She intends to sell this merchandise and earn more profits to contribute to the household. Aida does not have the necessary capital to buy the wood as she is poor and has no other way of finding the money. She is, therefore, applying for a loan - her first from "FUDECOSUR". Aida has not previously taken out loan from state banks but "FUDECOSUR" has provided this loan with better conditions and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Anastasiah

texts.en:
Anastasiah lives in Mangwei, a small town in Kwale County, the southernmost county on the Kenyan coast. Though some of the towns along the beach see benefits from tourism, the majority of people living inland are farmers, and the region's inconsistent rains can make agricultural yields unpredictable. Beekeeping is a relatively new activity in the area, but many farmers here are enthusiastic at the prospect of owning their own hives.

Anastasiah is married and has two children. Her husband transports cargo while she does farming. She has been doing this for eight years now and she is currently growing maize and passion fruit. Anastasiah is looking forward to beekeeping as the bees will help to increase her passion fruit production through pollination.

This is Anastasiah’s first loan with Honey Care and she intends to use proceeds from her beehives to start a passion fruit farm. Anastasiah’s hope for the future is to expand her beehive project.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Arpik

texts.en:
Arpik is a farmer-woman from Tsaghkalanj village. She lives together with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and two little grandchildren. Arpik owns a greenhouse where she cultivates greens in the winter and tomatoes in the spring. She also keeps 2 pigs and 2 calves.
 
Arpik is a very enthusiastic and hard working woman who does her best to run her farm in a sustainable way and help her husband to sustain their family. 
Arpik currently asks for this loan in order to enlarge her agribusiness. She hopes for lenders' support to be able to purchase a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse, potato seeds and fertilizers.

As this is her first loan, Arpik has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse, potato seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Zamina

texts.en:
Zamina is 27 years old and married with two daughters. Her husband is a laborer. They are refugees and live in an IDP settlement. She is a farmer and has raised fruits and vegetables for 7 years.  She sells the fruits and vegetables at local bazaar and earns 400AZN monthly.

Azerbaijan people like eating fresh fruits and vegetables. There is a high demand for them because they are very useful for health. People prefer to buy fruits and vegetables at a local bazaar because they know that these products are fresh. They use vegetables to prepare different delicious dishes.

Zamina needs to increase her income in order to cover her family’s demands. She needs money to provide her children good education. She applied for 2000AZN in order to buy new fertilizers for her garden. This is her second loan and she has a positive client history.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizers for her garden.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cooking oil, maize flour, beans and sugar.

loans.name: Nickson

texts.en:
Nickson is a repeat customer at the Rukungiri branch. He is a professional nurse carrying out his practice in Kisiizi General Hospital, Rukungiri District. He also has a small retail shop which he runs along with his wife. He is a married with only one child so far.
 
Nickson started his business in 2012 to supplement on his income. He needs a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to add capital in his retail business. He thanks UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) for financial assistance which has enabled him to improve his standard of living since the salary he gets is not enough to meet all his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy house hold use items to sell in the retail shop.

loans.name: Adjorman Group

texts.en:
These ladies are part of the group called Adjorman. They are a very hardworking group of ladies who sell African fabric (kente), fruits, second-hand clothing and palm cooking oil. 

Vivian has been selling African fabric for 10 years in her community where she lives. She is married and has two children and the whole family helps in the sale of the fabric. This business enables Vivian to generate the necessary income for sustaining her family. She says that she enjoys her work because it is honest labor and it helps her feel useful in her community.  

She decided to organize a group so that she and her fellow group members could help one another and improve their standard of living. Vivian will use her share of the loan to buy more kente to sell to customers. She dreams of increasing her business by opening an annex shop for her daughter who will work to be paid.

loans.use: To buy more kente to sell to customers.

loans.name: Regino Francisco

texts.es:
Eñ señor Regino se dedica a la actividad de prestar servicios de acarreo en su triciclo, el señor es un hombre muy responsable, padre de dos niños en edad escolar, trabaja de lunes a domingo desde las cinco de la mañana trabaja en el sector del bisne en acarreo de mercaderia a los comerciantes, y despues de las seis de la mañana acarrea pasajeros tanto como estudiantes.

solicita el financiamiento para mantenimiento del triciclo y brindrarles una mejor atención a sus clientelas.
texts.en:
Regino makes his living offering transport services with his three-wheeled vehicle. Regino is a very responsible man, father to two school-age children; he works from Monday to Sunday from 5:00 am. He works in the sector of shipping merchandise to shopkeepers, and from 6:00 am he transports passengers like students. 

Regino is seeking financing to maintain the tricycle and give his a better level of care to his customers.

loans.use: to buy tires and paint for the three-wheeled vehicle.

loans.name: Mayra Damaris

texts.es:
La señora Mayra Damaris tiene un negocio en el mercado de venta de carne de cerdo, tiene 8 años de tener su negocio, en el vende carne de cerdo, pepena, frito, charrasca y manteca de cerdo, la señora vende de lunes a domingo desde las seis de la mañana a dos y media de la tarde, es madre de  tres niñas, todas ellas estudian en primaria, es una señora muy responsable y trabajadora.

solicita el financiamiento para compra  de cerdos en pie, para mandarlos al destace y vender carne, pepena , frito.
texts.en:
Mayra Damaris owns a business selling pork. She has been running this business for 8 years, selling pork, cooked pork fat, fried pork, charrasca and lard. Mayra Damaris sells from Monday to Sunday from 6:00 am to 2:30 pm. She is a mother to three children, they are all in primary school, she is a very responsible and hardworking woman.

Mayra Damaris is seeking financing to buy live pigs to send for carving and sell meat, cooked pork fat and fried pork.

loans.use: to buy four live pigs.

loans.name: Lefa

texts.en:
Lefa is a business management student at the Maharishi Institute. Lefa is 22 years old and was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute:

What do you study at the Maharishi Institute and what classes do you enjoy most?

“I am studying Bachelor of Business Administration and Basic Consciousness Education. These classes lead me to the goal that I have set for myself since starting at the school. The meditation makes me more aware of my surroundings and I can be fully awakened within myself.”

What are your goals after graduation?

“I just want to get out there and work, and experience life and learn about people and management and the world. I don’t mind what sector or what job.”

Tell us about your background.

“I was born in Ventersdorp, south of Johannesburg. My two older sisters and I were raised by a single mother, living with my grandmother and grandfather. My mother is a domestic worker and our primary breadwinner. My two sisters are now married but as I am still young, I am not allowed to get married yet.”

What do you do in your spare time?

“I love to play soccer, watch movies and listen to music. I also enjoy spending time with my mother, or with my friends.

How will the Kiva loan change your life?

“A loan from Kiva will enable me to finally stand on my own financial feet. It will help me to fulfill the goals that I have set for myself and study my degree with dedication. It will mean that my mother’s money can support the family more, as I’ll be able to pay for my fees.”

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Bavakan

texts.en:
Bavakan lives in Lernamerdz village with her two sons, a daughter-in-law and two little grandchildren.

She runs a farm. It currently includes a livestock of cows, sheep, and chickens and she also cultivates tomatoes, greens and grass for the livestock.

Bavakan and her sons work hard to have a profitable farm that will provide an income for their living.
 
By applying for this loan Bavakan would like to enlarge her farm. She plans to purchase 15 more sheep and forage for feeding them. Bavakan hopes that Kiva lenders will support her agribusiness and she will be very grateful to them.

As this is Bavakan's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for 15 sheep and forage for feeding them.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is married with two children and all her children go to school. She has a business selling fruits and has been in this business for five years. She has applied for a loan of 600,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of mangoes, oranges and paw paws. 

She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells on retail basis.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and perishability. She aspires to becoming a wholesaler and also to start growing some of those fruits. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent for her work place.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of mangoes, oranges and paw paws.

loans.name: Liberatha

texts.en:
Liberatha is 43 years old. She sells various items in her boutique, especially food, and she has been in the business for the past ten years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, beans, and cooking oil for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay for school fees money.

loans.use: To buy more rice, beans and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Juana Isidra

texts.es:
la señora Juana Isidra se dedica a su actividad de venta de verduras y frutas en el mercado tiene experiencia de 21 años de tener este negocio , es madre de 5 hijas ninguna depende de ella todas trabajan, la  señora es trabajadora labora de lunes a sabado desde las cinco de la mañana  a tres de la tarde se esfuerza por sacar el sustento de su hogar .
solicita el financiamiento para compra de verduras por quintales y por cajas para aprovechar y comprar al por mayor y asi le hacen descuentos y aprovecha a comprar mas,
texts.en:
Juana Isidra makes her living selling fruit and vegetables in the market: she has 21 years of experience in this business. She is a mother to 5 children, none of whom depend on her, they all work. Juana Isidra is hardworking; she works from Monday to Saturday from 5:00 am to 3:00 pm. She works hard to earn enough to support her household.

Juana Isidra is seeking financing to buy vegetables in larger quantities and in boxes to make the most of, and buy in bulk, and therein she will get discounts and able to buy more.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, potatoes, sweet pepper, garlic and cucumbers in large quantities and in boxes.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine lives in Haytagh village with her husband and two sons. She is a farmer with many years of experience running a farm. She cultivates potatoes, tomatoes and greens and sells the gathered harvest in local open market. 

Marine has now applied for this loan to purchase a polyethylene cover for her greenhouse, potato seeds and fertilizer. This will enable her to enlarge her farm and gather more income for her family.

As this is Marine's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history. The loan is very important for Marine and she hopes that Kiva lenders will support her agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse, potato seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Muhokya Twekambe Gp Group

texts.en:
Jane is a 50-year-old married woman with four children of whom two go to school. She has been in the restaurant business for 13 years. Her restaurant is located in the rural area and she works seven days a week and 12 hours a day.

She ventured into this business to generate income and to look after her her family after vowing to fight the poverty that she went through in her childhood. 

She hopes to expand her business into new markets, however, debtors and few customers are challenges being faced. 

Jane is requesting a loan to buy food to use in her restaurant. She is a member of a group in which each member guarantees the other to get a loan.

loans.use: to buy food to use in her restaurant.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina lives in Mkongani, a small town in Kwale County. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, near Tanzania. Inconsistent rains, especially recently, have made farming difficult, and the poverty rates in the county are above the Kenyan average.

Beekeeping is somewhat new to Kwale, but the passion fruit farms and mangrove forests throughout the area provide excellent sources of nectar for bee colonies. Many farmers in the area have expressed excitement at the prospect of owning their own hives and having a second source of income from their honey to help care for their families.

Angelina is married and has four children. Her husband works in civil service while she undertakes farming. She has been farming for nine years now and she is currently growing oranges and passion fruit in her farm. She is excited about beekeeping as it will help her in pollinating her passion fruits.

This is Angelina’s first loan with Honey Care and she intends to use the proceeds from her beehives to build a family house. Angelina’s hope for the future is to establish a commercial apiary.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Pablo Alfonso

texts.es: el señor Pablo Alfonso es trabajador de una imprenta que esta ubicada en el barrio san agustin desde hace 11 años, labora como operador de prensa, es padre de 3 niños que estudian y por lo que se esfuerza por sacarlos adelante, solicita el financiamiento para compra de gastos escolares como: cuadernos, uniformes, el es elque da el  mayor apoyo en su familia.
texts.en:
Pablo Alfonso has been working in a printing press which is found in the San Agustin neighborhood for 11 years. He works as a printer operative, he is a father to 3 children who are studying and for whom he works hard to help give them a boost in life.

He is seeking financing to buy school supplies: books and uniforms, this is the one giving the greatest support to his family.

loans.use: to buy school supplies: school books, bags and uniforms.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce, a Ugandan, is 48 and married with six children, who all attend school. She has served as a secondary school teacher in Kagadi, Uganda for 14 years. She is also involved in agriculture, specifically in goat-rearing, to supplement her small pay as a teacher. 

Her dream is to educate all her children at a university level even though she is challenged by limited capital and drought that affect the animals.

Joyce intends to use this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 49 years old. She is married and has seven children. 

Christine sells various items in her boutique and has been in the business for the past three years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more beans, rice, corn flour and sugar for sale. She plans to use the profits from the business for paying school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more beans, rice, corn flour and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en:
Eliud is a 33-year-old married man. He has two children, ages 4 years and 10 years. He describes himself as focused, customer-friendly and God-fearing. 

He operates a pharmacy where he sells medicine. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a busy residential area and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge as fluctuation of medicine prices. 

He will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of medicine. His business goal is to be a wholesaler of medicine within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be a successful and rich man. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and expand his business. He also works as a part-time driver to earn extra income.

loans.use: to buy more stock of medicine.

loans.name: Matia

texts.en:
Matia, 35, is a Ugandan living in Kagadi. He is married with one child, aged two years. 

A teacher by profession, he works as a deputy head teacher in a government secondary school. He also farms to increase his income and support his family. 

Matia joined teaching 12 years ago because he loved the job, although he is challenged by the low pay in the face of the high cost of living. Despite the challenges he is facing, he hopes to have a better life in the future through hard work. 

He is requesting for a loan to buy iron sheets, doors and cement for constructing a house.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets, doors and cement for constructing a house.

loans.name: Xuyen

texts.en:
Xuyen, 48, is widowed and has three children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.

Xuyen has been running a general store in front of her house for six years. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying many different basic products to sell in her general store.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: To buy many different basic products to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is 39 years old and single. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. She has been running a general store to earn a living. 

She started her business two years ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying a variety of different products, such as snack food and beverages to sell to her customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a variety of different products, such as snack food and beverages to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Matayo

texts.en:
Matayo is a 68-year-old married man with twelve children. He carries out a timber trade which he started in 1998. It is his business which has enabled him educate his children and he has only three children who still attend school.

Matayo later found out that his business alone no longer meets his needs; he decided to join UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) for financial assistance which has enabled him to sustain his business and meet his family's needs. So he thanks UGAFODE for the financial assistance given to him because it has improved a lot on his welfare.

loans.use: To buy timber to sell.

loans.name: M. Razzaq

texts.en:
M. Razzaq is a 30-year-old married man living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan along with his family. He is the father of two children, both are going to school. He is a milkman by profession and sells milk in his nearby community. He breeds cattle in his yard as well and sells the bull calves to the butchers. He has to feed the calves for one or two years until they have grown up and are healthy, which is a very lengthy and expensive procedure. 

A few days ago, two of his healthy buffaloes suddenly died due to fetal disease; he has been producing milk and breeding from these buffaloes. Now his production of milk and breeding procedure have been badly affected.

M. Razzaq wants to buy a buffalo to keep constant his income and business but he has already invested his all savings into miscellaneous expenses of the dairy farm. He does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy a buffalo to continue business smoothly. Therefore, M. Razzaq has requested a Kiva loan through Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan.

Our field partner met with him and let him know about all the terms & conditions of Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan. He has agreed with our repayment schedule and signed happily all the necessary documents, including client waiver. 

The fetal diseases are the major challenges for him. He hopes that he will pay all the installments on due time. With the profit amount he will buy fodder for cattle and cures against diseases. M. Razzaq is very pleased after taking this loan and thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for producing milk and breeding.

loans.name: Yusif

texts.en:
Yusif is a 41-year-old IDP. He is married and has a son and two daughters. The family has lived in an IDP settlement for a long time. He earns money selling construction tools (screwdriver, helmets, gloves, sandpapers, wrenches, hammers, sledge hammers, pliers, and other kinds of hand tools for fitting and installation work) in a small shop.

People living in IDP settlements build a lot of new houses for their families and have high demands for construction tools. They use them while building or repairing houses. They attend Yusif’s shop in order to buy high-quality tools.

Yusif’s shop is very small and there are not enough tools and other construction products. Yusif applied for a 2,000 AZN loan in order to supply other kinds of hand tools for fitting and installation work to make his assortment wider and to increase his income. This is his third loan and he has a positive client history.

loans.use: to supply other kinds of hand tools for fitting and installation work.

loans.name: With God Group

texts.en:
Our customer Margaret is an entrepreneur with twenty-two years of business experience. She is 61 years old and the mother of four children and a grandmother of three. This client is a member of 'with God' group. She sells cassava and plantain, and she is standing on the left in the photograph. She sells her merchandise at her house. 

She is seeking a loan from ID-Ghana to grow her business. She will buy more cassava and plantain so that she can sell more to her customers. She has launched her business with starting funds received from her husband. In the future, she would like to take out a larger loan, buy a land plot, and provide for the education and food of her grandchildren.

loans.use: To buy more cassava and plantain so that she can sell more to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients in bulk (palm oil, rice, fish, maggi and groundnut oil etc) to make her dishes.

loans.name: Ernestina's Group

texts.en:
Two members make up this group. One of them is Grace. She is 54 years old and married, and has been in the business of selling clothes and shoes for seven years. Grace has been a client of ID-Ghana for three years. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy African fabric to sell to customers. 

Ernestina is 50 years old and has a business selling bed sheets.

loans.use: to buy African fabric to sell to customers.

loans.name: My

texts.en:
My is 42 years old and married with two daughters. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn income through running a soft drink stall. 

My started her business 10 years ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying quantities of soft drinks and cigarettes to sell to her customers. 

She hopes her business will run smoothly and help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy quantities of soft drinks and cigarettes to sell to her customers

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en: Hanh, a 43-year-old married woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City and has two children. She supports her family by running a clothes making business. Hanh has requested a loan to purchase more stock, such as cloth, needles and thread, to offer a better range of products to her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and she can earn additional income to reinvest in her shop and save for emergencies.

loans.use: to buy more products for making clothes, such as cloth, needles and thread

loans.name: Angel Erik

texts.es:
Ángel de 53 años de edad, es un hombre que se ha dedicado a la construcción y también a la crianza de pollos de engorde, solamente pudo estudiar hasta primer grado, pues la situación económica era muy difícil en esos tiempos y sus padres no pudieron seguir cubriendo los gastos de la escuela, se acompañó cuando tenía 28 años, su esposa lamentablemente falleció hace 1 año y su único hijo ha quedado a su responsabilidad el cual está yendo a la universidad.

Él comenzó a trabajar como albañil desde que tenia 15 años de edad, hasta la fecha de hoy el siempre esa su ocupación, esto lo aprendió gracias a sus padres que también se dedicaban a la misma actividad, además tiene cuatro años d dedicarse a la cría de pollos de engorde. 

Ángel utilizará este préstamo para invertirlo en la granja, pues su ingresos como albañil solo cubren los gastos del hogar y necesita que su hijo siga estudiando en la universidad y logre graduarse como doctor y con los ingresos de la granja podrá cubrir los gastos de la universidad de su hijo . 

Su sueño mas grande es que su hijo pueda graduarse como doctor, como así lo soñaba su madre quien ya falleció y sabe que lo va a lograr con la ayuda del crédito.
texts.en:
Ángel is 53 years old.  He is a man who has worked in construction, as well as in raising chickens to fatten.  He only managed to study through the first grade, because the financial situation was very difficult at that time and his parents couldn’t keep on covering his school expenses.  He got married when he was 28 years old.  Unfortunately, his wife passed away one year ago. His only child remains his responsibility while going to the university.

He began to work as a construction worker when he was fifteen years old.  This has always been his job.  He learned this occupation thanks to his parents who also worked in this sector.  Additionally, he has raised and fattened chickens for four years.

Ángel will use this loan to invest in his farm, because his income as a construction worker only covers the household expenses.  He needs his child to keep studying in the university to graduate as a doctor.  With the income from the farm he will be able to cover his child’s university expenses.

His greatest dream is that his child could graduate as a doctor.  This was also the dream of his child’s mother, who passed away.  He knows that it is possible with the support of this loan.

loans.use: to invest in a chicken farm.

loans.name: Ijaz Ahmed

texts.en:
Ijaz Ahmed is a 38-year-old energetic man living with his family in the area of Multan, Pakistan. He has been running a dairy farm for many years and generating income for his family. He sells milk to retailers and to the people of his community. He milks his cows twice a day, while his wife and daughters produce cheese, yoghurt and butter. With the addition of these products, the family earns a sufficient income to run their household. 
Nowadays, Ijaz Ahmed needs to build a new cowshed for his cattle because the current one is in very poor condition. He does not have enough money to rebuild the shed or to buy fodder to feed his cattle. 
Thus, Ijaz Ahmed has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that he can build a new cowshed and continue his business. He has to maximize his savings so that he can fulfil his responsibilities. He thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy building material for the construction of a cowshed.

loans.name: Arise & Shine Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of two hardworking members. One member, Augusta , is 45 years old and married with three children in her care. 

Augusta has been in the food business for eight years and has been selling rice, tinned tomatoes and noodles in Teshie. She has been a client with the institution for three years. She is asking for this loan to purchase more rice, tinned tomatoes and noodles.

Additious is 35 years old. She sells perfumes and creams.

loans.use: To purchase more rice, tinned tomatoes and noodles.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh is a 52-year-old married woman who lives with her two children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money as a community security guard. For the past four years, Anh has run a general store where she sells many products to the people in her community.

Anh is requesting a loan to purchase foods and beverages of better quality and quantity to stock her store. She hopes her loan will enable her to better meet the needs of her current customers as well as attract additional customers. Anh also hopes that she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties that may face her family.

loans.use: to purchase foods and beverages to stock her store

loans.name: Cu

texts.en:
Cu is 44 years old and married with four children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Cu and her husband earn an income running a business producing and selling shoes. She has operated her business for seven years.

Cue is requesting a loan to buy shoes, materials, and accessories to produce more shoes and expand her business. She hopes that her business will run smoothly and will help to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy accessories and materials to increase shoe production

loans.name: Tiep

texts.en:
Tiep is a 60-year-old married woman. She has two sons and two daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money as a ship driver for a company. For five years, she has run a business selling cellphone cards to people in her community.

Tiep would like a loan to purchase a quantity of cellphone cards to sell to her customers. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase a quantity of cellphone cards to sell.

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.es:
Dionicio y su esposa, junto a un grupo de personas de la misma comunidad decidieron cuidar la tierra y los animales el se dedica a la cria de ganado vacuno para la producción de leche, ya que los protejen del frio en su respectivo establo y mantas pues tampoco les cuernos, para que, éstas den terneras de forma natural y el alimento que proporcionen sea fresco y de gran calidad, conservando la buena salud de sus vacas mejoradas.

El vive en casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad de Patacamaya-Arajllanga de la provincia AROMA del Departamento de La Paz a tres horas de distancia  de la ciudad de La Paz cuenta con  varias cabezas de ganado mejorado las cuales requieren mejor cuidado dada las condiciones climatológicas del sector

El sueño de Dionicio es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado, precautelando la buena salud de ellos.Asi mejoar sus ingresos y calidad de vida para su familia
texts.en:
Dionicio and his wife, together with a group of people from the same community, have chosen to care for the Earth and animals.  He works raising cattle for milk production, protecting them in their own stable and giving them blankets. He also doesn’t take off their horns, because he wants his calves to be natural.  The feed he gives them is fresh and of high quality, protecting the health of his improved stock.

He lives in his own home, located in the community of Patacamaya-Arajilanga, in the Aroma province of the La Paz region, three hours from the city of La Paz.  He has a number of head of improved cattle, which require a higher level of care given the area’s climate.

Dionicio’s dream is to increase the number of his herd, ensuring their good health.  In this way, he can improve his income and the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es:
Isidro y su familia, junto a la comunidad decidieron cuidar la tierra y los animales el se dedica a la cria de ganado vacuno para la producción de leche, ya que los protejen del frio en su respectivo establo y mantas pues tampoco les cuernos, para que, éstas den terneras de forma natural y el alimento que proporcionen sea fresco y de gran calidad, conservando la buena salud de sus vacas mejoradas.

El vive en casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad de Patacamaya-Arajllanga de la provincia AROMA del Departamento de La Paz a tres horas de distancia  de la ciudad de La Paz cuenta con  varias cabezas de ganado mejorado las cuales requieren mejor cuidado dada las condiciones climatológicas del sector

El sueño de Isidro es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado, precautelando la buena salud de ellos.Asi mejoar sus ingresos y calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Isidro and his family, together with their community, decided to care for the Earth and animals.  He works raising cattle for milk production, protecting them from the cold in their own stable and giving them blankets.  He also doesn’t de-horn them, because he wants to have natural calves.  The feed he gives them is fresh and of high quality, protecting the good health of his improved cattle.

He lives in his own home, located in the Patacamaya-Arajilanga community of the Aroma Province in the La Paz region, three hours away from the city of La Paz.  He has a number of improved cattle, which require better care given the region’s climate.

Isidro’s dream is to increase his head of cattle, ensuring their good health.  In this way he can improve his income and the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai is a 49-year-old married woman. She lives with one son and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money as a photographer for hire. For six years, Mai has run a business selling clothing to people in her community.

Mai is requesting a loan to purchase cloth and accessories to make clothing to sell. She hopes her loan will better enable her to meet the needs of her customers as well as attract additional customers. Mai also hopes that, through her loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties her family may face.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and accessories to make clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand their business, purchase additional large and small machines, and toner.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase office equipment, supplies and services to open her consultation business

loans.name: Chi

texts.en:
Chi is a 47-year-old widowed woman. She has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. For seven years, she has run a business making and selling clothes to people in her community.

Chi would like a loan to purchase materials for making more clothes to sell to her customers. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for making clothes.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Accra is a metropolitan area where there are enterprising people keen to improve their life; this is where the Margaret lives.

Margaret is a young woman of 35 years of age. She is married and has two secondary school going children under her care. With the little that she earns through hard toil, she helps to give support to her children, who she loves and values so much. She has been working by selling eggs, soft drinks and milk for 11 years now, and now her dream is to have better living conditions.

Margaret feels at ease having been supported by ID Ghana to acquire a loan to boost her business. She needs more support to purchase eggs, soft drinks and milk to sell to customers.

loans.use: To purchase eggs, soft drinks and milk to sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food goods in bulk and wood

loans.name: Xuan

texts.en:
Xuan, 45, is married and has two children. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City.

Xuan has been running a business producing plastic items for six years. He is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying one more machine and plastic materials to make more plastic products to better satisfy his customers.

He hopes his business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist him in improving his family's living conditions and sending his children to school.

loans.use: To buy one more machine and materials make plastic products.

loans.name: Pedro Humberto

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 54 años de edad, es una persona que no logró preparase academicamente, no fue a la escuela ya que sus padres lo pusieron a trabajar desde muy pequeño. Ahora está acompañado y tiene dos hijos que ya son mayores de edad y no viven en casa, ellos trabajan en la agricultura. Solo dependen de él su esposa y una nieta que se está criando con ellos.

Él se dedica a la siembra maíz, cultiva dos hectáreas de maíz todos los años y este año ya se está preparando para hacer la próxima siembra, él ha desempeñado esta actividad durante toda su vida, y este año quiere sembrar una hectárea mas, las ganancias de esta cosecha ayudara a sacar adelante a su esposa y nieta .

Pedro necesita este préstamo para sembrar maíz, esto le ayudará a incrementar sus ingresos y ayudar a su nieta a para que pueda iniciar con sus estudios de educación media (bachillerato).

Su sueño, es que su nieta pueda iniciar bien sus estudios y logre graduarse de bachillerato, ya que él y sus hijos no tuvieron la oportunidad de estudiar, y con el crédito el podrá sacar adelante a su nieta para que en un futuro estudie en la universidad.
texts.en:
Pedro is 54 years old. He didn't receive an education, he didn't go to school because his parents put him to work at a young age. Today, he has a partner and two children who have already grown up and moved out. They work in agriculture. His wife and one of his granddaughters who is living with them are the only ones who depend on him. 

He makes a living growing corn. Every year, he grows two hectares of corn, and this year he is getting ready to sew the latest crops.He has worked in this all of his life, and this year he wants to plant an additional hectare. The profits from this harvest will help him to support his wife and granddaughter. .

Pedro needs this loan to sew corn. This will enable him to boost his earnings and support his granddaughter so that she can start her secondary school studies. 

His dream is for his granddaughter to be able to begin her studies and then graduate from high school, because neither he or his children had the opportunity to study. With this loan, he will be able to support his granddaughter so that in the future, she may be able to go to university.

loans.use: to sew a hectare of corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock for her business.

loans.name: Prima

texts.es:
Prima junto a un grupo de personas de la misma comunidad decidieron cuidar la tierra y los animales ella se dedica a la cria de ganado vacuno para la producción de leche, ya que los protejen del frio en su respectivo establo y mantas, tampoco cortarles los cuernos, para que, éstas den terneras de forma natural y el alimento que proporcionen sea fresco y de gran calidad, conservando la buena salud de sus vacas mejoradas.

Ella vive en casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad de Patacamaya-Arajllanga de la provincia AROMA del Departamento de La Paz a tres horas de distancia  de la ciudad de La Paz cuenta con  varias cabezas de ganado mejorado las cuales requieren mejor cuidado dada las condiciones climatológicas del sector

El sueño de Prima es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado, precautelando la buena salud de ellos.Asi mejoar sus ingresos y calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Prima, together with a group of people from the same community, decided to care for the land and the animals. 

She raises cattle for milk production, sheltering them from the cold with their own stable and blankets; and, she does not cut off their horns, so that the calves can be birthed naturally. She gives them fresh food of a very high quality, maintaining the good health of her improved cows.

She lives in her own home, which is located in the community of Patacamaya-Arajllanga in the Aroma Province within the Department of La Paz, about three hours distance from the city of La Paz.

She has several head of improved cattle, which require better care, given the climatic conditions of the area.
Prima's dream is to increase the size of her herd and protect their good health, thus improving her earnings and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wholesale real and artificial flowers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy the ingredients for her cakes in greater quantities.

loans.name: Nwirhan Group

texts.en:
The Nwirhan group consists of four women from Al-Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 130,000 YER (Yemen rials). 

Seham, a 31-year-old married woman from Al-Hodeidah, is the leader of the group. She is the mother of three children. Three years ago, she started up her business in selling ice cream after her husband became disabled to cover the household expenses. She had no choice but to work and provide her family with food and clothing. Despite her strong determination, she managed to succeed in the first business of her entire life. 

Recently, Seham wants to start selling sweets in new quarters and places in her city, and this is why she applied for a loan of 40,000 YER to buy sweets for resale. She looks forward to improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sweets for resale.

loans.name: Fardos Alkhazan Group

texts.en:
This group is called Fardos AlKhazan. It is comprised of five ladies, all of whom have different businesses. They live in Hadramout, Yemen. They took a loan of 170,000 YER (Yemen rials). 

Alia is the coordinator of the group, and she is 39 years old, married and has six children. She oversees the issues and responsibilities of each member from a financial aspect. She runs a kiosk store out of her house, selling newspapers, pens, books and magazines, etc. She is very friendly and has already gained some permanent customers. 

She is requesting a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy newspapers, books and magazines, among other things, so that she will increase her sales, since these types of products are very popular. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to buy newspapers, books and magazines, among other things, to increase her sales.

loans.name: Cuc

texts.en:
Cuc is a 41-year-old married woman. She lives with two sons and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money as a taxi driver. For nine years, she has run a business of making clothing and ironing clothes for people in her community.

Cuc would like a loan to purchase clothing accessories and material to makes clothes. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase clothing accessories and material to make clothing

loans.name: Leidy Stefanny

texts.es:
Leidy Stefanny, es una persona honesta, respetuosa y con muchas ganas de superarse.
Está estudiando atención integral a la primera infancia  para así mejorar las ofertas laborales y mejorar los ingresos, así mismo tener más tiempo para la hijo y la familia. Personalmente quiere seguir preparándose en los estudios.
Los planes a futuro cuando termine la carrera son trabajar en un buen jardín y desempeñarse muy bien en la labor, seguir estudiando una carrera profesional y darle una mejor vida a el  hijo y una buena educación, tener una casa propia y superar las expectativas cada vez mas. 
Ella necesita el subsidio de kiva ya que las capacidades económicas no son las mejores y por ello no posee todo el dinero para pagar las cuotas.
texts.en:
Leidy Stefanny is an honest, respectful individual who desperately wants to better herself. She is studying comprehensive early childhood care in order to improve her job offers and earnings, and so that she has more time for her child and family. She would like to continue studying. 

When she completes her degree in the future, she plans to work in a good nursery and do her job very well, continue studying a professional career, offer her child the best life and education possible, buy her own home, and keep exceeding expectations.

She needs Kiva's help since she has limited financial resources and so doesn't have enough money to pay her fees.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of university registration fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for incidental expenses, such as broker’s fees, incorporation fees, licenses, etc., and to  completely pay off the previous owner.

loans.name: Al-Shamy Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Shamy and consists of four ladies who live in Sana'a, Yemen. The group has applied for a loan of 180,000 Yemeni Riel from AMB.

Khatima is 31 years old and a married woman who lives comfortably with two of her children in Sana'a, Yemen. She is a hardworking hairdresser with strong ambitions to move forward in life and to be happy. She is well-known in her region for her good reputation and special talent. She serves her customers with a very friendly and amenable manner to be able to increase her customer base. 

Khatima is in a small house and would like to buy home improvement items, but her income from business is low and not enough to buy what she needs. She decided to apply for a 50,000 YER (Yemen rials) loan from AMB to buy furniture and home appliances to improve the living conditions in her house.

Taking this loan will allow her and her family to feel comfortable so they can enjoy living in their house. 

In the future, she dreams that her business will continue to provide income in order to help her family with the household income.

loans.use: to buy furniture and home appliances to improve the living conditions in her house.

loans.name: Abood Group

texts.en:
Abood is a group of four poor women from Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 80,000 YER (Yemen rials) to improve their businesses. 

Elham, a 27-year-old married woman, lives with her family in a small house in Al-Hodeidah city. She said that her husband is unable to cover all their household expenses, so she decided to work and earn money to cover the needs of her children. She is a door-to-door women's clothing saleswoman.  She has earned a good profit from this business, so she decided to purchase more clothes and target new clients. Therefore, she asked for a loan in the amount of 20,000 YER. She looks forward to opening a clothing store in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and target new clients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new fabric and clothes to to resupply her stock.

loans.name: Anilyn

texts.en:
Anilyn previously accessed a loan of 50,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), which she used to buy ready-to-wear merchandise to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help to the education of her child and the family's personal, household and business expenditures.
 
Anilyn would like to apply for another loan of 50,000 PHP to buy ready-to-wear merchandise, like polo shirts for men and women and socks and shirts, to expand her product inventory. Having more items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and education expenses for her child. 

She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. She dreams of being more successful in business and hopes to have a better standard of living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business. This is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for ready-to-wear merchandise, like polo shirts for men and women and socks and shirts, to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Jezel Mae

texts.en:
Jezel Mae earns a living as a nipa thatch waver. She is twenty-eight years old, married and lives in Tangub - Bagumbang, Bonifacio. She is well known for the good quality of thatching services that she offers. In the past, she has purchased nipa palm and been able to save from it. Her thatching services are self-sustainable and have become profitable. She earns a net profit of about PHP 4,000 per month.  

Jezel Mae is seeking a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase nipa palm. This is a regular loan, which will be repaid over several months. She paid back her previous loan in full. Jezel Mae is very diligent and loves accuracy, which only adds to the effective management of her venture.

loans.use: To purchase nipa palm

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is from Polao, Tangub City Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  She has 7 children.  PMPC supported her by providing the capital to start her pig raising business. She sold one pig at a time, helping the family survive. She gives her best efforts to produce good pigs, in order to sell them continuously. 

Divina is now trying to expand her pig business and has also decided to venture into a little sari-sari. She presented her project proposal to Paglaum MPC to finance the project and has applied for a loan of PHP 15,000. With her extra income, she wishes to send all her children to school so they may have stable careers.

loans.use: To buy feed for her piggery

location.town: Tangub-P-7 Polao Tangub City  Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 57 years old and lives in Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with four children now at their adult age. 

For her means of living, Julieta has earned from a hog fattening activity for five years already. She is earning an approximate amount of 1,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing one additional piglet, one sack of feed and vitamins. Julieta has been a member of PMPC for almost three years. In the future, Julieta hopes to engage in another business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing additional one piglet, one sack of feed and vitamins

loans.name: Gertruda

texts.en:
This is Gertruda, 37, a resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Joseph, a bartender, and is a mother to their children. She together with her children manage their household while operating the business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Gertruda maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue and these are the profits that dealers are counting on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php2000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 35,000 loan. She will utilize the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. 

Gertruda dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes to have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Rizza

texts.en: Rizza is 30 years old and lives in Carangan, Ozamiz City. She has two children. She requested a loan of 30,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) for the expansion of her piggery and to purchase more pigs. She has had this kind of business for two years. Rizza wants to grow this business to support her daily needs and other expenses.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs and to expand the piggery.

loans.name: Channy

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Kampong Chnang province’s Tek Phos district, Channy is 56 years old and married with three children. She earns a living through farming rice, and in order to feed and support her family members, she also works as a tailor and sells rice soup. Having been in these businesses for 34 years, she is able to earn about US$17 per day, and manages to save about US$9 each day for the future needs. 

Channy has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles and completely paid back the past loans. Now she is applying for a loan to pay her child’s tuition fee. She hopes this loan will enable her to keep her child in school.

loans.use: to pay her child’s tuition fee

location.town: Kampong Chhnang province, Tek Phos district

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.ru:
Сухроб живет и активно работает в районе Хамадони. Ему 44 года. Он сельский учитель. Сухроб работает в средней школе учителем начальных классов. Одновременно в свободное от работы времени он занимается своим малым бизнесом, а именно предоставляет услуги по очистке хлопка в своем селе на протяжении 6 лет. Сухроб многодетный отец. У него четверо детей и сын. Их необходимо обеспечивать питанием, одеждой, образованием и здравоохранением. Сухроб работает на двух работах, чтобы его дети не знали нужду. Он успевает работать и в школе и в цехе. Он по натуре трудолюбивый человек и не боится работы. 
Сухроб решил расширить свой бизнес. В данный момент в его цехе имеется только одно хлопкоочистительное оборудование. Он планирует закупить еще одно такое оборудование, но оно стоит очень дорого. Такая сумма Сухробу не по карману. В связи с этим он обратился за кредитом и надеется на финансовую поддержку. Благодаря кредиту он сможет купить необходимое оборудование, работа в его цехе пойдет полным ходом и он приобретет новых клиентов, что способствует увеличению его дохода.
texts.en:
Suhrob lives and works actively in the region of Hamadoni. He is 44 years old and a teacher in a rural area. Suhrob works in a school teaching elementary school students.

In his time away from work, for the past six years he has run a small business ginning cotton in his village  He has four daughters and a son. He needs to provide them with food, clothing, an education and healthcare. Suhrob works two jobs so that his children have what they need. He has time to work both in the school and in the shop. He is a hardworker by nature.

He has decided to expand his business. At this point he has only one cotton ginning machine. He plans to buy another, but it's very expensive. He doesn't have that kind of money. He wants to take a loan for this purchase, and hopes for financial support. With the loan, he will be able to buy the machine, get work in his shop into full operation, attract new customers and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy a cotton gin to expand his business.

loans.name: Cúc

texts.en:
Cúc is 26 years old. She is married with one child. She lives and works in Nong Cong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent. 

Cúc has a business growing rice and raising poultry and cattle. Cúc has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Cúc faces in her business is the lack of capital. 

Cúc is requesting a loan to purchase water pipeline, electricity line for a bathroom, a toilet, a wash basin, septic toilet seat, a mirror, a door and material to build the toilet. She and her family don't have latrines; they use a neighbor's latrine. 

In 2014, Cúc joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her family's lives. This is Cúc's first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, Cúc hopes for her business to do well, to remodel her house, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase water pipeline and electricity line for a bathroom, a toilet, a wash basin, septic toilet seat, a mirror, a door and material to build the toilet.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
la señora Maria Auxiliadora vende envases vacios en su casa de habitacion en el barrio santa ana, tiene 17 años de tener su negocio es casada, madre de dos hijos ninguno de estos depende de ella, es una señora luchadora, su negocio lo abre desde las siete de la mañana a seis de la tarde  de lunes a domingo se esfuerza por sacar el sustento de su hogar,

solicita el financiamiento para compra  de barriles y pichingas al por mayor ya que le estan ofreciendo precios comodos.
texts.en:
Maria Auxiliadora sells empty containers from her home in the Santa Ana barrio. She has had her business for 17 years and is the mother of 2 children, niether of whom is still dependent on her. Maria is a determined woman. Her business opens at 7:00 am and closes at 6:00 pm, Monday to Sunday. Maria works hard to derive sustenance while working in her home.

Maria is requesting financing to purchase barrels and other containers at wholesale, since she is offering convenient prices.

loans.use: buy barrels, vessels, and empty sacks.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is 65 years old and lives in Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with no children.
For her means of living, Esterlita has been earning from hog fattening activity for four years already. She is earning an approximate amount of PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing two additional piglets, one sack of feeds, and vitamins. Esterlita has been a member of PMPC for almost seven years. In the future, Esterlita hopes to engage in another business.

loans.use: to purchase two additional piglets, one sack of feeds, and vitamins.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 60 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 4 children who are now at their adult age. 
Shirley has a little store and sells groceries and other consumable products and earns approximately PHP5,000.00 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional groceries and other consumable products for retail. 
Shirley has been a member of PMPC for almost 10 years.  In the future Shirley hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing additional groceries and other consumable products

loans.name: Cerila

texts.en: Cerila is married with five children. She is 55 years old and lives in Malintuboan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte in the Philippines. Cerila owns a sari-sari store to earn a living and has had this business for six years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of work. She requested a loan to restock store with basic commodities like rice, canned goods, soap and other items. Cerila is a new member of PMPC and in the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like rice, canned goods, soap and other items.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean, 44, is a resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines. She is single and has a child. She works hard to provide for herself and her child’s daily expenses.  

Jean operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the working community and most families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings when all family members can consume the meal. This is both a family tradition and a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons. Instead, people buy cooked rice and prepared food which costs less than making your own. She earns additional income by operating a variety store. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue her business, she requests 20, 000 PHP to buy more quantities of meat, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products. 

Jean dreams of being successful in business and hopes that her child will finish his studies. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work.  She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
Александр — из села Ленинка. Он 5 лет занимается теплицами. На 2.4 гектарах земли он выращивает капусту, кабачки, перец, лук и селеру. Рассаду всегда высаживает в закрытый грунт — под дуги и агроволокно. 
Сумму в 22 000 гривен Александр планирует вложить в закупку семян, пленки для покрытия теплиц, удобрения, а также в нужный для этого сезона текущий ремонт имеющихся у него в работе теплиц. Александр тщательно готовит к скорому приходу сезона грунт и теплицы, надеясь в этом году получить со своего бизнеса неплохой доход с продажи выращенных
texts.en:
Alexander is from the village of Leninka. He has done greenhouse farming for five years. He grows cabbage, zucchini, peppers, leeks and celery on 2.4 hectares of land. The seedlings are always planted indoors. 

Alexander plans to invest 22,000 UAH to buy seeds and films to close in the greenhouses, fertilizer and the necessary supplies to repair the greenhouses this season. He is carefully preparing the soil and greenhouses, and is hoping that he earns a decent income from his business this year with increased sales.

loans.use: to buy seeds, plastic film, fertilizers and materials to fix his greenhouses.

loans.name: Armangul

texts.ru: Армангуль 40 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. Старший сын в армии, остальные все школьники, учатся и помогают по хозяйству. Супруг занимается частным извозом. У Армангуль - среднее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Армангуль занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав 19 лет назад, с 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Армангуль, на сегодняшний день у нее в хозяйстве имеется: 7 индюков, 23 курицы, 3,0 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает фасоль для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Армангуль обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом- на покупку семян минеральных удобрений для обработки земли. Доходы от кредита Армангуль планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Armangul is 40 years old, married and raising five children together with her husband. Her eldest son is in the army, and the rest are school children. They study and help in the household. Armangul's husband drives his private taxi. Armangul has secondary education. 

As a main income for her family, Armangul works with field crop cultivation and livestock breeding, after having started 19 years ago with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Armangul's persistent work, her farm currently has seven turkeys, 23 hens and 3.0 hectares of land. Here she grows beans for farm use and selling every year. The monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Armangul turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan to purchase mineral fertilizer for processing the land. Armangul plans to invest the income from the loan in increasing the number of livestock. She also plans to save money to repair her home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 53 years old and lives in Matugas Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with six children who are now at their adult age.
 
For their means of living, Alicia earns from food vending, particularly snacks and viand selling and coco farming. She is earning an approximate amount of PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of works.

She has requested a loan to be used in redeeming a parcel of coco land that was pawned to a relative. 
Alicia has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future Alicia hopes to engaged in other business.

loans.use: redeem a parcel of coco land.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan is 32 years old. She is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Nong Cong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents. Loan has a business growing rice and raising poultry and cattle. Loan has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Loan faces in her business is the lack of capital. 
Loan is requesting a loan to purchase water pipeline, electricity line for bath-room and toilet, washbasin, septic toilet seat, door for bath-room and material to build toilet. She and her family are not using hygienic latrines. In 2014, Loan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her family's lives. This is Loan's first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 
With her business profit Loan hopes for her business to do well, to remodel her house, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase water pipeline, electricity line for bath-room and toilet, washbasin, septic toilet seat, and door of bath-room and material to build toilet

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong, 44 years old, is married and has three children, one son and two daughters. Her husband is a carpenter. She supports family through the income she earns from making and selling furniture. She has been in this business for ten years. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Hong intends to take a loan to increase her working capital and buy wood for increasing her production of furniture. The additional materials will enable her to increase her production for sales. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy wood for making furniture

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan is 47 years old and has three children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Lan runs a business of weaving to earning a living. 

She started her business 22 years ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying a larger quantity of fibre to increase her production of textiles. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of fibre for making textiles.

loans.name: Linh

texts.en:
Linh, 41, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a a security guard.

Linh has been running a general store in front of her house for four years. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying different products to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: To buy household items, food and beverages for selling at her store.

loans.name: Sothea

texts.en:
Sothea is 48 years old and married. She is a mother of six children. To make a living, she and her husband have been growing mango, jackfruit and sapodilla in her village for 10 years. 

This is Sothea's first cycle as a client with Kiva's partner VisionFund. Now she is requesting a loan, and with this loan, she is going to pay for her son to study law. She hopes this loan will make her son have a bright future so he can support his family. 

Note: This photo is with her husband.

loans.use: to pay for her son to study law.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.ru:
Владимир — сельскохозяйственник из села Приветное. Он 12 лет занимается тепличным делом. На 2.79 гектар земли в теплицах, под дугами, агроволокном и на открытом грунте он выращивает укроп, капусту, кабачки, перец, лук, помидоры, огурцы и буряк. Рассаду Владимир обычно высаживает в закрытый грунт — под дуги и агроволокно. 
Владимиру понадобится сумма в размере 19 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить семена, пленку, удобрения, дрова, а также установить капельное орошение в теплицах на время начала нового тепличного сезона.  Владимир молод, полон сил и энтузиазма. Он хочет заниматься своим тепличным хозяйством и, по возможности, расширять его дальше, чтобы зарабатывать на нужды семьи и бизнеса.
texts.en:
Vladimir is a village farmer from Privetnoye. For 12 years he has engaged in greenhouse farming. He grows fennel, cabbage, zucchini, peppers, onions, tomatoes, cucumbers and beets on 2.79 hectares, both in greenhouses and outside. 

Vladimir generally plants seedlings indoors. He needs 19,000 UAH to buy seeds, greenhouses films, fertilizer and firewood, and also to install drop irrigation in the greenhouses for the new greenhouse growing season. Vladimir is young, full of energy and enthusiasm. He wants to do his own greenhouse farming, and if possible to expand it to meet the needs of his family and business.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for his greenhouse farming business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 57 years old and lives in Aguada, Ozamiz City. She is a businesswoman and owns a sari-sari store. 

Her son helps to manage the store. She requests 50,000 PHP to increase her inventory rice, sugar, and canned goods. She has been in this business for more than 4 years.   Her business allows her to support her daily needs and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of grocery items such as rice, sugar, and canned goods.

loans.name: Trang

texts.en:
Trang is 32 years old, and she is married with 2 children. She lives and works in the Nong Cong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. Trang has a business growing rice and raising poultry and cattle, and she has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Trang faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Trang is requesting a loan to purchase a water pipeline and electricity line for the bathroom, a washbasin, a septic toilet, a mirror and door for the bathroom, and material to build a toilet. She and her family are using not hygienic latrines. In 2014, Trang joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her family's life, and this is Trang's first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Trang hopes for her business to do well, and with her business profit, she wants to remodel her house, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine for her family.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily, 63, is a resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to a pastor named Melchor.  They have children. She and her husband manage their household and operate a business. She works hard to provide income for their family.

Emily operates an internet café business. Services like this meet a need as customers’ demand increases. Her main patrons are students who require internet services to meet school requirements. She has customers who need to rent computers for business purposes to write a resume or create office documents.  She also has customers who would just love to surf the net and use social networks.  She also has a food stall for additional income. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in profit every day.

To help her continue to operated her business, she requests 40,000 PHP to buy computer parts and accessories.

Emily hopes that her business will grow and hopes that her family will always be in good health. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Akylay

texts.ru: Акылай 27 лет, не замужем, проживает с родителями. У Акылай - высшее образование, она работает в отделе физической культуры и спорта своего района. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Акылай занимается животноводством, стартовав 4 года назад, с покупки скота на 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Акылай и помощи ее родителей, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 5 дойных коров, 2 кобылы и 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 11,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Акылай обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Акылай планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку нового дома.
texts.en:
Akylay is 27 years old, not married, and lives with her parents. Akylay has higher education. She works in the department of physical education and sports in her region. As an additional income for her family, Akylay works with livestock breeding, after having started 4 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Akylay's persistent work and the help of her parents, her farm currently has 5 dairy cows, 2 mares and 10 sheep. The monthly income is 11,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Akylay turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan to purchase calves to increase the number of livestock. Akylay plans to invest the income from the loan in increasing the number of livestock, and plans to save money to purchase a new house.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy, 35, is married and has one son and one daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn an income running a beauty salon. 

She started this business 15 years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying dye, hair care products and nail polishing products to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy hair care and nail polishing products, and hair dye for selling at her store.

loans.name: Hung

texts.en:
Hung is 53 years old, and is married. He and his wife have been running a food stall in front of their door for 22 years. He started this business to cover his expenses and raise his children. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.
He is requesting a loan to expand his business by offering more food and many kinds of soft drinks so that he will be able to increase the turnover of his business. 

He hopes that through the loan he will be able to expand his business activities and have money to reinvest in his business in the future.

loans.use: To buy food and beverages for selling at his food stall.

loans.name: Sang

texts.en:
Sang is requesting a new loan to restock her general store with products, such as food and beverages. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and to offer her customers a greater variety of products.
She hopes that her new loan will assist her to increase sales and the size of her store. She also hopes it will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food and beverages to stock in her store.

loans.name: Michail

texts.ru:
Михаил 12 лет занимается тепличным хозяйством. Он садит ранние и поздние сорта огурцов, а также раннюю клубнику. Михаил женат, у него есть как свои, так и приемные дети. 
Михаилу необходима сумма в 15 000 гривен для того, чтобы подготовить теплицы к сезону и купить семена, пленку, дрова и необходимые удобрения для высадки семян.
texts.en:
Michail has done greenhouse farming for 12 years. He plants early and late harvest cucumbers and also early harvest strawberries. Michail is married, and has both his own and foster children. 

He needs 15,000 UAH to prepare his greenhouses for the season and to buy seeds, films, firewood and fertilizer needed for planting.

loans.use: To buy seeds, materials, wood, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 47 years old and lives in Tulapos, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor, Philippines. She is married with 2 children.  

They have a small fishing business to earn a living.  They have many business challenges but they realize that it is good to face the challenges instead of becoming discouraged.
